Reviews.Title: “Another FITZ stay!”
Reviews.Author: skylersgrandma
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our trip to Vegas, again staying at the FITZ, now THE D !!! We enjoyed our stay, as usual! This is the first time that our room was not ready, but it was the day after St Patricks day.. we checked in at 9am and our room was "rushed" clean and ready within the hour..the room was just was we expected, no frills but ok ! the shower was AWESOME !!! All the employees are super friendly and go out of their way to help ! Myra at the players club was super !!! Had to go see her everyday, she is so friendly !! Ate at the restauant, good value for my dollars.. games were o.k., lots of new ones.. had no trouble getting cocktails, and we play penny games... did not think the casino was too smoky... looking forward to going back in October, and staying at THE D !

Reviews.Title: “cheap weekend”
Reviews.Author: smokeyj
Reviews.Content: Had a great view from the 34th floor and could hear the street band and show although it didn't keep us awake. Enjoyed the restaurant and the poker bar with the street balcony. Careful in the casino - some of the old machines still payout coin. Perfectly adequate hotel, but rooms need refreshing.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cheri B
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for my third time. I absolutely love this place. If your a no-frills type of person this is the hotel for you. It has an the old Vegas charm. The rooms arent dipped in gold, but they are clean.(and the rooms are cheap for the budget traveler). The staff is extremely friendly from the front desk to the chambermaids. I was a little disappointed that they have changed the name to the D. But, I hope they keep to the old Vegas theme. You walk out the front door and there is the Fremont Street Experience. If you forgot your toothpaste, Walgreens is right across the street. The location is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money-remodel welcome”
Reviews.Author: Drifter235
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Fitz in March 2012 during the NASCAR weekend. The Fitz clientel seemed to be older, which strangely fit the ambieance of the hotel. The parking was free and plentiful if you are attending with a vehicle. The casino seemed to retain a smokiness about it more than other properties close at hand, but hopefully the remodel will take care of this. We got free breakfast which was quite good for each day of our stay. Rooms were dated but maintained and cleaned very well. Supper in the main restaurant was OK, but nothing more. Overall location is fantastic and it was nice to walk out to Freemont street without having to access our vehicle. Staff was friendly and helpful. Noise from Freemont Street was quite loud but never went real late so wasn't a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Changes are coming”
Reviews.Author: shadow700
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Fitz several times over the past years. Received comped rooms March 3-8, 2012. Checked in after 8 p.m. Took longer then expected, as they were trying to locate a good room that was ready. Room 2434 had 2 double beds, non smoking as requested. Housekeeping was still cleaning rooms on our floor when we got up there. First time I've seen that in the evening. Maybe because we were checking in on Saturday evening?? Room was clean and functional. Bed was comfortable. Elevators were fast, with no long waits. The Fitz is starting a major remodel. The Long Bar was scheduled to open the day we left. First few days it was boarded up, the last two days the walls were down and we could see how nice it is going to be. Can't wait to see the upgrades to the rest of the casino and the rooms. I just hope they don't tighten the comps too much. Dealers at the LIR table were all friendly. Drinks were good at the tables, slower at the slots. Hope to stay there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Snomada12
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fitz for three days this past weekend...good value, decent rooms, ok service. Can't complain about the room for the price, it is what it is, a place to shower and sleep...plus they threw in breakfast every morning. The casino is pretty smokey though and the cocktail service is practically non existant. Played the same machine for well over an hour and wasn't offered one drink...not like they were all that great to begin with but...it's the principal! Even sitting at the bar playing video poker didn't net more than one weak Bloody Mary...guess there are rules about playing max coins to get the good drinks...idk...anyway, stay for the price, maybe play somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Baby!!!”
Reviews.Author: CW2021
Reviews.Content: Downtown excitement, Fremont Street party, great prices on drinks, low limit table games and Wonderful service. You are treated like a person not just another "gambler".

Reviews.Title: “Going Downhill, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: rrcerny
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fitz last week, some good things but some worse than before. Good casino and restaurant. Rooms need attention. Bedding was clean but worn. Blanket had holes, bedspread and carpet were dirty. Bath was OK. Unless price is the major consideration, it would be hard to reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “checked out the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: oldtimer630_0
Reviews.Content: While doing the "Freemont Street Experience" my brother-in-law suggested we stop at the restaurant upstairs at Fitzgeralds. Our wives had the salad bar and found it satisfactory if simple. I opted for a new york strip with baked potato and veggies, as well as the salad bar. the price for my meal was only $9.95 a bargain to be sure. The meal was delivered promptly, the steak was cooked the way I enjoy it, (Medium Rare) and I still can't believe the entire meal was so inexpensive. My brother-in-law ordered the fried chicken for $8.00 and to our amazement, not only was the portion HUGE, but he said it was the best chicken EVER!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: CJCalvin
Reviews.Content: Another great stay in downtown. Great service at the fritz

Reviews.Title: “friendly”
Reviews.Author: chiefs159
Reviews.Content: stayed there 2 years ago and it was nice. the check-in was fast and the rooms are very clean, i did not gamble in the casino so i can not say how it is, but the hotel and the food is good.

Reviews.Title: “" Penny Slots are hot and loose" Very True !!”
Reviews.Author: LawrenceToronto
Reviews.Content: I did not stay in this hotel but gambled at the Casino... I was drawn in by the sign on the front saying, "Our Penny Slots are hot and loose" well they certainly were. My mom and I kept winning Small pots. 100 here 300 there and so on. My mom won 300 on a re-spin machine and I decided to sit down at it right after her. About 5 pulls in I hit the re-spin bonus and won 1500.00!!! I was so happy LOL we walked out of there that night with well over 2000.00 profit. I also saw a lot of other people winning fairly large amounts on the slots. Good fun in Downtown Vegas :)

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and clean”
Reviews.Author: sbccc
Reviews.Content: This used to be a Holiday Inn - so don't expect the Ritz. It's downtown which means it's a bit grimy because everything downtown is a bit grimy. However, it's not bad. If you have the appropriate expectations it's a cheap place to stay downtown. It's safe enough and clean enough. The Golden Nugget is nicer - and more expensive (but nowhere near as nice as strip hotels for the money) but I would rank Fitzgeralds as second best downtown. The thing I like is that everything is close. The casino is intimate. There is food and "stuff" within walking distance. There are street performers outside. It's fun. The food there, like the hotel itself, is pretty average. But if you go with the right expectations it's fine

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: jltt
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here in January for one night. Our stay in 2006 was a great experience so we decided to book again. The price for a weekend night was great we also received 2 full breakfasts in the coffee shop that was wonderful. The staff was very nice everywhere we went and again travelling with a senior downtown casinos are great in the respect that are small enough for everyone to feel comfortable. I always take with a grain of salt when people critique the rooms because I feel they sometimes expect more than what they pay for, but I do have to say the carpet in our room looked so dirty you really didn't want to walk on it without shoes or socks. Other than the carpet the room was clean and it had great pressure in the shower. For us time in the room is very limited so as long as it's reasonably clean with a good shower and I feel safe there, that's really all I ask. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “For the night on a budget”
Reviews.Author: VegasBlondie
Reviews.Content: There's a First Friday event every month downtown and we all go down and party and hang out so since we drink we stay there. The hotels are all affordable and I stayed at the fitz, valet were very nice but the check in lady, get over yourself. The room is old and has very few plugs and a little banged up and old tv but hey its a bed to sleep in which wasnt dirty and we made do! Might stay again, I also had the basic basic room so

Reviews.Title: “Go. Go Now. Soon It Might Be Too Late”
Reviews.Author: on-the-cheap
Reviews.Content: Vegas Downtown aficionados know that Fitzgeralds Casino & Hotel has been sold. The new owners, who also own the Golden Gate at the western end of the Fremont Street Experience, are planning changes to The Fitz. Let’s hope they use a light touch. For those of us who need little pampering, preferring clean inexpensive accommodations, The Fitz is the best bargain in Las Vegas. Room 1215 was spacious and 100% satisfactory; in fact, at $29 per night, it was an absolute steal. I was allowed to check-in at noon, and had no trouble getting a 1 PM checkout. Every employee I encountered was professional and friendly. My room had an extremely comfortable king bed, plenty of pillows and towels and an awesome view. There was a work desk and an upholstered side chair in addition to the one at the desk. The TV was not a large flat screen, but it was fine. The bathroom was spotless, medium sized. The closet was small. There were some burn holes here and there, and I was not wild about the high pressure water conserving shower nozzle, which could not be adjusted. The housekeeping staff worked fast and was unobtrusive. Breakfast in Fitzgeralds Courtyard Grill was cooked to order and fairly priced. Don B’s Steakhouse seems to be undergoing a conversion to a more casual concept. I was disappointed that a NY Strip steak was not on the menu, and my porterhouse was on the thin side, but my server went out of her way to make my meal enjoyable. The casino staff at The Fitz is outstanding. The dealers and pit bosses have a good time with you, making the inevitable losing less painful. Kudos to table games supervisor Becky and my host Suzanne. The atmosphere in the casino at The Fitz is right out the 1970s, so if you’re looking for something trendier, refined or elegant, I would suggest taking your bankroll elsewhere. If you are looking for fun while gambling, The Fitz is the place. I hope the new owners don’t try to make Fitzgeralds into a replica of their Golden Gate property, which is a little too hip for me. It’s all but certain there will be a name change in conjunction with the remodeling and upgrading, so if you want to experience The Fitz for what it is, and what it isn’t, go now. Those of us who prefer Downtown over The Strip know to expect panhandlers and the homeless on the eastern part of Fremont Street. The daytime walk down to El Cortez was dicer this time, even more so than when I was there in October, and I would no longer walk alone at night east of the intersection of Fremont Street and Las Vegas Blvd. The Fitz, though, sits in a good spot and there was amble security. The best alternative to a taxi to Downtown from the airport and back remains the public Westcliff Airport Express bus. $2 each way, and the trip takes a little less than 30 minutes: http://www.rtcsnv.com/transit/route/westcliff/westcliff(11-07-10).pdf.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eddie S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Fitzgeralds on Jan. 13th & 14th for the second time. Again I found a good clean room with a decent and functional bathroom. The staff was professional and courteous. Like most places downtown this is a budget hotel/casino, but in saying this I am not putting the Fitz down. I do not spend much time in my room when in Vegas so all I need in a room is for the bedroom to be clean and comfortable, a clean and working bathroom, and good food. For me Fitzgeralds succeeds in all areas as well as having easy access to the Fremont Street Experience.

Reviews.Title: “Always enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: theperry5
Reviews.Content: We have stayed almost everywhere in Vegas and now stay only at Fitzgeralds. The location for us is prime, very laid back,not very crowded,good gaming, very good eateries,and of course, the awesome Vue Bar overlooking the Fremont Street experience. Yes the rooms are average at best but can also be gotten for 20.00 or free if use players club. We have not paid for a room for years and get 3-4 free ones every month.One dollar beers compared to New York New York $6.50???Plus we walk to at least 10 other Casinos on any given day. Will be back in February.

Reviews.Title: “I alway's enjoy the Fitz”
Reviews.Author: airbrush101
Reviews.Content: I had 3-nights comped here in early November. My offer also had free play, match play and a dining credit. I had a very fun time and look forward to going back again. My room was a corner room so it was very quiet and larger than most rooms. After their recent sale I was told that they will be remodeling the place in the near future. Can't wait to see the new changes.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: xantippy
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at "The Fitz" numerous times, and it has always been enjoyable. The hotel is not fancy but the rooms are clean, beds are comfortable and food is delicious and cheaper than the strip restaurants and even the restaurants back home! Two dinners (large portions), beer and pop for around $20-25 at the Courtyard Cafe within The Fitz. Staff is friendly, and casino seems less smoky than in the past. This time, we stayed on the 21st floor near the elevators (#2124). These rooms offer a window that partially wraps around the building for a nice view of city and mountains in 2 directions. The Fremont Experience light show can be a little loud, but it ends at midnight. It is fun to walk around the Fremont area in the evenings and take in the street entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Never Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: lapatrona54
Reviews.Content: We spent my birthday at Fitzgerald's in Las Vegas. We've stayed there before and have never had a bad experience. From the moment we checked in, we encountered nothing but helpful and friendly staff. The beds are SO comfortable. Didn't do so well on the slots this time, but that's to be expected. The only negative thing I can say is that there's no coffee maker in the rooms. Getting dressed to go to McDonald's or Krispy Kreme for coffee can be a pain after a late night.

Reviews.Title: “Lint everywhere, dirty old furniture and no outlets”
Reviews.Author: R0adWarri0r
Reviews.Content: I checked into this hotel because I had never stayed on Fremont St and wanted to give it a try. I was sorry the moment I walked into the room. There are two chairs in the room and both were stained dark. I used one of the bath towels to cover the desk chair as I had to do some work on my laptop. Oops. Only two outlets in the entire room. One is behind the 20 year old Panasonic tube TV and the other behind a nightstand. Bring a 10' extension cord if you need to power or charge a phone/laptop. I suppose the worst part was going to bed. When I pulled the sheets down, lint mushroomed into the air and settled everywhere. The four small pillows and hard mattress didn't make for a great night's sleep. However, the heat not working well made certain it stayed crispy and I soon forgot about the lint everywhere. I searched hard to find something positive to share about this property (and I've been in some bug-ridden hotels in my lifetime). My suggestion would be to find a Motel 6 with slot machines and you'll not only get a better bargain but just maybe sleep a whole lot better.

Reviews.Title: “Good table games, convenient location, but dirty rooms”
Reviews.Author: CharityK13
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel a few times in the past several years and have had a good experience with the service and location. However, the rooms themselves were extremely dirty with severe soap scum, grunge, and mattresses that have seen much, much better days. The price is right and the table games are cheap and plentiful so give it a shot - just don't expect a clean room with functioning features.

Reviews.Title: “Love this casino”
Reviews.Author: ironhorse_traveler
Reviews.Content: Didn't win any money at this casino, but was very nice. The room was clean, the bed was confortable and it was very quiet on our floor. All the employees were very nice and helpful. Will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “I beat a live chicken at Tic Tac Toe here and one 500”
Reviews.Author: GOSEEITALL24_7
Reviews.Content: I want to start by saying I have never stayed here but have played here for hours multiple times over the years. We walked by here years ago and if you got a players card you had a chance to play a chicken at tic tack toe needless to say I beat the chicken! I guess it did not happen often because all the employees went nuts! It was super funny. When I pulled my gift card out it was 500 in free slot play! They went nuts again, that was the highest amount you could get! Ever since then we have to stop in. I love Fitzgeralds it is not fancy but the slots are "loose". The atmosphere is very laid back. You can play on the tables some days lowest minimum bet is is 2.00 (dont worry I have watched them also put 1,000's down at a time)! You can not beat that. Wednesday morning at 3am go on over and the dealers will take time to show you everything and have a lot of Patiences. The time and day just happened to be when I was there. I loved learning and now being able to play craps more then just the pass fail line. The servers are on top of it. They will bring you two drinks at a time (they will only bring one on the strip). They will come by often to check on you. I really enjoy stopping here anytime I am in Vegas! They always have some promotion going on and are very great to the fitz player card members. The comps add up fast. If you want to run and grab a snack they have a Krispy Kreme at the front. You can grab a donut and sit and watch everyone zipline down Fremont street and watch the light show. They also have free wifi in Krispy Kreme. The downfall when you are playing at any casino on Fremont you will run into the riff raft coming in and out. I found that you do not see a lot of that on the strip. SO remember when you are walking about be safe and keep your purse on you. I have never had an issue but have never took any chances.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable value”
Reviews.Author: Crusaders
Reviews.Content: My pick of places to stay in Las Vegas based purely on cost. @ $27 a night excellent value and out of the 4 hotels I stayed at this trip this place came out on top. Great value restaurant on 2nd level with a great steak for $15 or a OK steak for $10. Having stayed on the strip and Downtown I would recommend 1st timers to do the same and if i did return I think here would be my preference. Only negative is the smoking how can these place's legally poison their guest's is beyond me get into the 21st century

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price”
Reviews.Author: SHIP5182
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Fritz, clean room on the 30th floor with a great view. Free breakfast every morning was good, casino has low limits at the table games and lots of old style slot machines which I love. The view bar has $2.00 Bud Lights and you can sit out on the small balcony and watch the people pass by and the light show every hour if you want a fun relaxing time, I know were pretty boring but Strip has lost most of its apeal for us, high prices and huge mega resorts vs low prices and good food down town. The only issue we had at the Fritz is the beds were not very comfortable, they were sold out of King size so we had two doubles, but neither one of the beds seemed to have enough padding between us and the mattress springs. For the price and fun we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay Downtown...”
Reviews.Author: RetiredMama1955
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy here, but if you want value for your $$$, stay here. The rooms were immaculately cleaned each day at exactly the same time!!! All the employees were very friendly and helpful. The view is great if you're on a high floor overlooking Downtown. New ownership so renovations beginning, along with a new name. If you want to spend your $$$ gaming, then stay here! No hidden "resort fees" here! The comps are great too! Their shows are good, and the cafe food and service is above par. You get your $$$'s worth there too! They even have a $2 Blackjack table! Try finding that on the strip! It's so nice to walk out of the Casino right onto Fremont Street and enjoy all the vendors and entertainment they have to offer, and know you're just a few steps away from your hotel room. No need to drive in traffic, find parking, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cecglobetrotters
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at the end of Freemont Street and is central to many places within walking distance to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms Need updating”
Reviews.Author: seachelleRogers
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Fitzgerald when we are in Vegas because we love the downtown area so much at night and the rooms have been decent and reasonable. Last time we will stay at the Fitz though. Rooms are getting old and stale, need some serious updating to keep up with some of the other hotels in Vegas. It would be okay if no other choice available, I just like a little nicer room, and it seems they have let their quality drop in the last couple years.

Reviews.Title: “The right price for a good room on Friday and Saturday downtown”
Reviews.Author: Jacalope
Reviews.Content: 18 and 19 November 2011, room 3237 - we enjoyed the 32nd floor. The price at Fitz was better for the weekend than was the price at Virgin River in Mesquite. What the heck, Las Vegas downtown was more fun! 2 queen beds - though my partner felt they were small. The beds were comfortable though the covers were light. Weirdly in th morning there was music coming from heating cooling unit. I thought I must be imagining as I was sitting at the table, but my partner was laying in bed and asked where the music was coming from. Our room was non-smoking but I kept smelling smoke - maybe it was our clothes from the casino? There was a free safe - handy. Breakfast was included in the room rate - it was tasty and we needed to only pay for beverages. Good service. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money - clean and tidy with great views”
Reviews.Author: Jason B
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fitz for the first 4 nights of the trip before a planned move to the Strip for 6 nights. No problem or Queue for check in - requested a room on a high floor and what a room we got. Floor 34 (the top) with excellent impressive views of both the strip and the downtown area - it really was breath-taking. Room was clean and tidy (shower head moved on the wall slightly - only fault I could find) and because of the new OTIS elevators top to bottom took about 8 seconds - serious ear popping if no-one called the lift on the way down. We did both play poker in Binions however we enjoyed the slots and table games in the Fitz - everyone was really friendly. Seriously for what we paid where would you get a hotel as good as this in the UK - its cheaper that a travel lodge. Location was excellent as I knew it would be from a previous visit to downtown fremont street. We actually had a breakfast buffet one day in the Paradise buffet over in the Fremont casino - excellent value for money for only 8 dollars each. We did also eat the buffet in the Golden Nugget which was the best of the trip... Thats the thing I love about Las Vegas - you can eat anywhere. I cant review the resturants in the Fitz because we simply liked to get out and about. I love Downtown las Vegas and next time we will spend more time down there.. One word of caution tho - ask for the quiet side - we didnt and it was difficult to get some sleep whilst the excellent Fremont street experience is running every hour until 12 Midnight - only really a problem 1st night as we were tired from the 10 hour flight. All in all an excellent hotel for the money - however we got a great room so I would just raise the roof if you get a bad one as there are great rooms to be had here. Note to the Fitz staff - thanks for a great start to the holiday...see you soon.

Reviews.Title: “Saturday Nite on Fremont Street”
Reviews.Author: Loftypines
Reviews.Content: Stayed Saturday Nov 12 2011, $60 for the nite. Perfectly acceptable hotel on Fremont St. I rate this place 3rd best uptown. Golden Nugget if you are really picky. The 4 Queens is next best but it was $100 a nite for this Saturday so I booked in at the Fitz. Really nice staff, great breakfast included. Casino has lots of action with good pays. Sure it`s older and smokey but if you are staying uptown you gotta expect that. People stay uptown to get that old Vegas, customer service feel. The Fitz room was tired but clean, bed acceptable and TV worked fine. shower head comes out of wall at about the 5`4``mark, which I found funny. Lookin for a cheap place to lay your head...the Fitz works fine. I`ll stay there again. Parking garage is goofy so use the Valet

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting, don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: TNFinFan
Reviews.Content: One of the worst hotels I've ever stayed at. We were in Vegas for a week and fortunately, we only booked this hotel for one night. The people were fine, but the room was terrible. Formica was coming off the cheap furniture, the bathroom had broken tiles, the tub was stained black, and the carpet was filthy. I walked about 10 feet in clean new white socks, and they were literally so dirty you would think I had worn them all day. Don't listen to the people who have reviewed this place and say it's a good value. We stayed at both the Luxor (VERY VERY NICE) on the strip, and the Golden Nugget downtown (also nice) for about the same price. Also, the beds were old and squeaky, and very uncomfortable. Steer clear!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for a budget stay downtown”
Reviews.Author: marieatta_pman
Reviews.Content: best thing about this property is the value. I stayed for less than 30$ on a recent sunday night. PROS: great value good location downtown rooms overlooking fremont street experience rooms were clean free parking free breakfast (with my package) and discount coupons hallways were quiet CONS: pain to park in garage higher than level 6 then take elevators to casino, then different ones to rooms not especially fancy elevators could be slow/crowded

Reviews.Title: “RUN as Fast as You Can!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: drhodes333
Reviews.Content: Do Not Stay HERE!!!! This hotel is FILTHY, I was waiting for something to run over my foot. The CARPET was DISGUSTING AND THE ROOM REEKED OF URINE.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable”
Reviews.Author: exterminate98
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the fitzgerald when my son got married. I didn't know anything about the area so I picked it for the price. I wasn't sure if it would be a good choice. I was very happy with the hotel and the location. It is on the old side of the strip. I had a great time! I enjoyed the freemont experience. If I get a chance to go back to vegas I would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Inexpensive Lodging-but there is that street noise”
Reviews.Author: alaskaspeedoboy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fitz one night 10/16/11. I thought $60 on a Saturday night was a decent price. I arrived about 6 p.m. and managed to find a parking spot in the garage. There weren't many slots open. I can see how that could be a problem if you're coming and going. I had a reservation, but they don't guarantee a non-smoking room. However, the woman at the front desk spent several minutes searching for one, and succeeded. I also requested a room as high as possible, due to reports of noise from Fremont Street. I ended up on the 20th floor. To address another complaint I have seen posted, the elevator did NOT strike me as slow at all. The room was fine for the price - clean, decent sized, appliances that all worked, and a great view. However, the air conditioner was noisy. As it turned out, the air conditioner drowned out the street noise filtering up from Fremont, so I just loaded my ear plugs and managed to sleep. I'm not much of a gambler, but I did wander around the casino. After awhile, I could definitely detect cigarette smoke and headed outside. I had breakfast in the Courtyard Grille at 7 the next morning and used a coupon that the front desk gave me. Good basic breakfast for about $2 and the service was very efficient. All in all, not a bad place to stay if you're a sound sleeper (or don't sleep at all in Vegas). Otherwise, you will hear street noise (music) coming up from Fremont and it will keep you awake. I don't see how to avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Rosemarie R
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Las Vegas. We spent 2 nites at the Fitz. I don't think I would do it again. Good Things: entrances right onto Fremont street; the waitresses at the Courtyard Grille were very friendly and helpful. Bad Things: the desk staff, even the Concierge were very rude; we only had two bath towels in our room; the toilet ran for two days, we reported it twice and no one fixed it; no refrigerator or coffeemaker in the room; extra charge for internet. Maybe there are different types of rooms, but ours was average sized. The pool is only outside. If they had a fitness center, I don't know where it was. There wasn't anything friendly or inviting about the room-like maybe a map of the hotel to tell you where to find things in the hotel. My niece was carded in the casino 6 times before someone finally suggested she get a wristband (they could post info about this somewhere). All in all I've had better experiences at cheaper hotels. Our room was just over $60/nite.

Reviews.Title: “Love the FITZ !!!”
Reviews.Author: skylersgrandma
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to Vegas, and again stayed at the FITZ ! We love the FITZ, and this is the only place we will stay.. Rooms are very large, water pressure is great, lots of tv channels... We were on the 24th floor and NEVER had to wait more than 30 seconds for a down elevator !! The staff at the FITZ was great as usual... The food is the Courtyard Rest is good,, fast friendly service ! LOVE THE FITZ, and cannot wait to go back !!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, but a Bit Noisy...”
Reviews.Author: wdbarrett
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a few times. The location on Fremont street is convenient if you like to hang out downtown. We usually book a package online that includes daily breakfast. There is a long wait to get into the cafe, the service is a bit slow, and there is very little choice for breakfast. The free breakfast includes 2 eggs, potatoes, and bacon. You can substitute hash browns for the potatoes, but the wait staff is not allowed to offer it. There is a band stand next to the hotel where music plays rather loudly every night into the early morning hours. The music is easily heard in the guest rooms. We used earplugs on nights when we were in the room before the band stopped. If you do not plan on going to your room until after 2 am, then the noise will not be a problem. Parking is also a bit of an issue. There is not enough guest parking on the weekend. So if you have a car and drive down to the strip, you should plan on returning in the early evening or you will have trouble finding parking. Alternatively, you can use the valet. The rooms are a bit old and outdated, but this should be expected for the low price.

Reviews.Title: “Ughh.”
Reviews.Author: Andrew62463
Reviews.Content: I didn't set my expectations low enough. We arrived in our room to find that it had not been cleaned from the previous tenant. When we called the front desk we were told that there were no other non smoking rooms available and were unable to advise when the room would be cleaned... Many hours later it turns out. Dated decor worn furnishings surly staff. Give it a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: John7720
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints about this hotel. The staff is nice, our room was large and clean. I liked staying downtown instead of on the strip. If you are looking for a luxury hotel, this obviously isn't it, but if you are looking for a decent and affordable place with some vegas charm, this place won't disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Utah_traveler99
Reviews.Content: Rooms are nice and clean and right on Freemont Street. Went to the race treack and hung out on Freemont Street all night. Also, Valet you car, the pubic parking at the hotel is a joke.

Reviews.Title: “The Fitz was great!”
Reviews.Author: robert d
Reviews.Content: Stayed 10/16 thru 10/20. Everything went really smooth. This was my 2nd time at the Fitz. Stayed in room 611. The room was clean and the room service was very good. It helps to leave a tip for the cleaning crew. BJ tables were also very kind!!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place but getting worn out”
Reviews.Author: LoveTravelSouth
Reviews.Content: We always enjoy Fitzgeralds but it is in major need of a remodeling. The elevators seem better than 2 years ago. The rooms are clean but old. Very nice people working there. All were anxious to serve us. There seemed to be a little problem in the cafe. Some of the workers were a little short with us but not grumpy. Just overworked. Great pool area. Nothing fancy but very comfortable and they leave it open for Northern travelers that enjoy the weather

Reviews.Title: “Best casino in downtown Vegas!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Knockout006
Reviews.Content: We Always have a great time at the fitz! Great service and they give u free breakfast right now every night u stay. Plus I win here!!!! Hotel is more than enough for the price! Out of my 20 trips to Vegas I've stayed Here 15 times! love love one of the servers named Edna!

Reviews.Title: “Servicable Room - Nice View”
Reviews.Author: BarryZ
Reviews.Content: I checked into Fitzgerald's Las Vegas for a five night, solo stay in October, 2011. I had stayed here on a number of occasions previously, including during it's original incarnation as the Sundance Hotel, so I was prepared for a servicable room at a low price. I certainly got that. Check in was fast and the clerk was friendly. She put in room #3029, high and facing east, away from Fremont Street. Also quiet, high and away from the Fremont Street Experience noise. Beds were comfortable, but the pillows left much to be desired, but I put up with them. Bathroom toiletries were of hight quality, which was a surprise, The furniture was quirky, to say the least. The large dresser had only two working drawers and nothing in the large space below them.. The end table had no working drawer. The lack of drawer space was made up for by the three large drawers in the T.V. credenza. The in-room safe required a key, which meant that I had to have it with me constantly. Maybe if they ever upgrade the rooms, they'll install the kind that work with a touch pad, whick is much preferable. The bathroom sink had no plunger installed (??), but drained extremely slowly. Sort of an offbeat compensation if there ever was one. If my wife had been with me, I would have asked to switch rooms, but soldiered on alone with this irritating drawback. The low rate included a coupon book and a free daily breakfast in their restaurant, which I didn't eat once during my four night stay. I opted for the "graveyard specials" at other properties around town. On the whole, it was a value-priced room that delivererd as expected without many additional frills. It was fine for a single man on a gambling excursion, but I wouldn't stay here with my wife in tow, as she would find the accomodations spartan for her tastes. Passable but not outstanding in every aspect.

Reviews.Title: “Two weeks at the Fitz - Just what the doctor ordered”
Reviews.Author: Vegasordie
Reviews.Content: Just returned from two weeks in Las Vegas and my sister and I stayed at Fitzgeralds for the second time this year. I paid an incredible £22 per night for a more than adequate room, with two double beds, tv and en suite bathroom. The offer on Expedia said breakfast was not included, however, on check in we received 28 free breakfast vouchers. Due to jet lag we up before dawn each morning and the on site McDonalds for morning coffee was very welcome. You can also get a free refill if you return with your receipt. The facilities downtown are fantastic and all the casinos are within a short walking distance, unlike the strip where the hotels are so far apart. We visited the pool bar at the Golden Nugget one evening and the view of the aquarium in the middle of the pool was amzing. The Fremont Experience was as good as always. There was free entertainment on the stages dotted around Fremont most nights. I enjoyed the Fitz very much and would not hesitate to stay there again, and again, and again.... The Courtyard has some fantastic daily specials, like freshly cooked to order pasta with free soup and salad bar for an incredible $5.99. Their New York Strip steak special is $9.99 up until 6 pm. The food and service were very good. The pool area is at the back of the property and includes a jacuzzi and small pool. It was not very busy and there was room around the pool and sun beds available each day. Overall I know you get what you pay for but what can you get these days for $22. Value for money was brilliant and if you need a clean place to lay your head each night the Fitz is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “The Fitz is OK...and that's about it”
Reviews.Author: UWMutt
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 days/2 nights (Sunday - Tuesday) for $46.67 per night at the Fitzgerald and stayed on the 34th floor. One major problem were the elevators…the hotel only had four. So, you had to wait a while to use them to go up and down the hotel. The room was OK…nothing special about it. I received four complimentary free breakfast coupons (standard 2 eggs, sausage or bacon, and toast). The hotel’s covered garage was a drawback. The pathway is narrow and you have to navigate your car through tight turns. If you have a big pickup truck…good luck with that. I recommend the Fitzgerald only if you can’t book a room at the Golden Nugget, the El Cortez or the Plaza Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: dsazimm
Reviews.Content: The Fitz was nice enough. We got a real good deal but upon checking in they tried to give us a smoking double when we had reservations for a nonsmoking king room. This reservation was made over five months previously so we almost walked out. However, just before doing so, another clerk told ours that she just opened up a room and we were able to have it. I don't know if that was a ploy to keep the prime rooms open for comps for the gamblers or what but we got the room we asked for. It was just frustrating having to go through an argument after a long day of travel. We too were pleased with the free breakfast. The hotel is in the heart of Freemont Street so if you are looking for something off the strip and cheap, this will work. I think I would have preferred the Golden Nugget but maybe next time.

Reviews.Title: “The Fitz is not the Ritz, but it'll do.”
Reviews.Author: EddieB2280
Reviews.Content: Wow! It never ceases to amaze me how many people there are out there who will pay $29 for a hotel room and then complain that it wasn't luxurious or modern enough. We had a great time here. Yes, the furniture, television, and other fixtures in the rooms are kind of a throwback to the 80's. However, everything in the room worked right and appeared to be in good shape in spite of its age. We never took advantage of the free breakfast as we don't like getting up early or standing in line, but it is available if you want it. I only have two negatives about this place. There are only a couple dozen chairs at their pool, and the hotel has over 600 rooms. You do the math. If you get to the pool anytime after 10 or 11 in the morning, you might get stuck sitting on the floor. Also, there are 34 floors in the hotel and typically one out of the four elevators is out of service. We sometimes had to wait much longer than expected for the elevator, and on one occasion we ended up using the stairs. Overall, we felt we got an excellent value for the money and would stay here again. My fiance and I are 30 years old and it's good to see a lot more younger people staying downtown now. On previous trips, we sometimes felt like we were the only people there not getting social security checks. To those reading this, if you've never stayed downtown before, go for it! The downtown hotels are an excellent bargain, and you'll have the same fun and great experience as people that are paying four or five times as much at fancy hotels on the strip. Downtown is a lot of fun, trust me on this. To those looking for a clean, comfortable, and functional room for a reasonable price, I would absolutely recommend Fitzgerald's.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cheap, good food”
Reviews.Author: hotsally
Reviews.Content: Pool was very clean, good concept. Cheap betting, breakfast included in room was great. Corner room had a great view. We arrived at 7 a.m and were told we could get in at ten. When we tried to check in at ten, we were told there were no rooms available until three by a different clerk. Problem rectified, but no apology. Why make your guests wait? Great location. Very very smokey is my only major complaint.

Reviews.Title: “An Adequate Experience”
Reviews.Author: FScruggs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Fitzgeralds Casino and Hotel in August. The room was adequate and while the free breakfast everyday sounds enticing it is the same everyday and you pay for the beverage. The slot machines had mechanical problems a few times and had to be serviced in the middle of play which was a bit annoying. We had a problem with the toilet once otherwise the place adequate. We did have a nice view from our room of the Las Vegas area all the way to the mountains which was rather spectacular. This is a good hotel for a conference. We will stay elsewhere on our next trip to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Bikefest 2011!”
Reviews.Author: MzSpoon
Reviews.Content: Having rode our Harley's across the desert in temperature's above normal, we all just wanted to check in, shower and go have some fun! At check in, the agent behind the desk seemed slightly annoyed when we asked if she could switch our room so we could be close to the other couple we came in with. She couldn't get us on the same floor but could get us a few floor below them. We took it. Big mistake!! We took the elevator to our 22 floor room and went to our room. As soon as we opened the door to our room, I knew ... This was a smoking room. Ugh!! Not only that, the room had two full size (not queen) beds! Come on!! You would think that the little girl at check in would have asked if a smoking room would have been okay. My response would have been "ahhh, NO!" Plus full beds?! Check in girl must have missed the fact that we are a couple and like to sleep in the same bed. I was going to ask to switch rooms, but we were there to enjoy the Bikefest festivities! Other than the fact that check in girl sucks at her job, the room was okay. Typical hotel room...clean enough, beds semi hard, one rock hard pillow and one soft one. Bathroom was large but shower sucked. The towels were tiny and there wasn't enough. We quickly showered and headed out for the night. The hotel is located on Freemont Street which makes it nice after you've had a few drinks. Upon waking up (in a separate bed than my love) with a slight hangover, we got ready and found our way to the free breakfast. I ate toast! LOL! It looked good and everyone else at the table said it tasted good. Overall, the hotel is great for the price and location. Verify your room at check in! Would we go back? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “I Love Fitzies”
Reviews.Author: Christine V
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights the week before last. The Mexican Independence celebrations were in full swing which meant downtown was pretty congested but it was very entertaining. I have stayed at Fitzgeralds before and it will always be my choice of a downtown hotel. I love it. The front desk staff are always pleasant and there has never been a problem with an early check in. The cafe is great. Give me the older hotels over the new sterile ones any day.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at The Fitz”
Reviews.Author: randykay10
Reviews.Content: Stayed the last 3 days of our trip at The Fitz on Fremont Street. Room was good and no problems with this stay. Paid 10.99 to use the internet for 24 hours. They provide free breakfast each day from 7-10am but you should get to the restaurant by about 8:15 to avoid waiting in a long line. Good place to stay and the price is right. The bathrooms are huge.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Visit!”
Reviews.Author: BDOG14
Reviews.Content: Just returned from three day mini vacation to the Fitzgerald Hotel & Casino in Las Vegas. Our room was clean and quiet, with no unpleasant odors as sometimes associated with hotel casinos. Hotel is starting to show some age, such as a slow sink drain, but a real bargain in my personal favorite section of Las Vegas, downtown. Staff is exceptional, with quick and easy check in and out and great housekeeping. We were on the 10th floor, and you could hear the music from Fremont Street early in the evening - but not during normal sleeping hours. Overall, a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: Angie P
Reviews.Content: I never stayed down town Vegas, but I loved it. Fitzgerald had great prices, good location, quiet rooms, and helpful staff. My only minor complaint was the elevators. There was always a wait, and the were so slow. I would recommend this casino/hotel to the budge minded, and I will definately return. FYI..... Do NOT use Spirit Airlines.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Old Town Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Jacqui1288
Reviews.Content: I will stay at the "Fitz" again. All the glitz and glamor of Old town Las Vegas, NV and lights, lights, lights. This hotel sits on Fremont Street. Home of the "Fremont Street Experience", a light and music fest, a true "must see", which runs nightly from Dark until 12:00 am. The noise from this was heard quite loudly in our room but, unless you go to bed early, this is not a problem. Our room was adequate and comfortable. We stayed for the price range which is great! The room came with a full breakfast each morning. The fare was two eggs, hasbrowns and your choice of two bacon, two sausage or a nice ham steak. I chose the ham steak and it was delicious. The hotel also offers a Steak House touted to be the choice of the locals; dinner is around $100.00 for two people without wine. The Coffee Shop boasts a varried cuizine with everything from burgers to ribs. There is also a McDonalds and a Krispy Kreme in the hotel lobby. She's an old building and with that are the inhierant problems of age. The elevator was broken with at least one or two of the four cars down at a time making for long waits for the elevator. We were there during the monsoon season and it rained a bit causing the roof to leak in some places. This didn't affect our room and it was not an inconvience to us. If you're not here for the gambling, there's lots to do on Fremont Street. It's a walking experience of lights and sound, (wheelchairs and scooters are available for rent), . With everything to see from the light show to trinket and souvenier stands.

Reviews.Title: “Eh...”
Reviews.Author: bellabullets
Reviews.Content: The location is good, but as with all things, remember that you get what you pay for. The price is cheap but the rooms are really falling apart. Our shower leaked constantly, the carpet was filthy, the blankets had cigarette burns on them, and the bathroom had some sort of gold glitter glue stuck to the floor that no one in housekeeping has bothered to scrape off. I don't think a clean room is too much to ask. The elevators are murderously SLOW. Expect a 5-10 minute wait on most mornings. The perks of this place are of course, the price, the two dollar blackjack (good luck getting a seat at that table, though), and the fact that McDonald's and Krispy Kreme is right downstairs. All in all, I think we will pay a little more and stay someplace nicer next time. This place scarred me for life.

Reviews.Title: “we like fitzys”
Reviews.Author: mobi136
Reviews.Content: We stayed at fittzgeralds downtown vegas on 7/27-85/11. We've stayed here several times before and have always enjoyed it and the price is always right. Downtown is so much easier to get around and the slots seem to be a lot looser than the strip. I have a problem walking so everything being so close is just great. Also, Fitzs has a Mickeyd's in it and getting early morning coffee is very convient. All the 6 yrs, we've been going to Vegas we stayed on the strip twice.

Reviews.Title: “Under budget”
Reviews.Author: m l
Reviews.Content: My wife, two children (ages 10 and 7) and I spent four nights at the 'Fitz'. Our room was quiet (32nd floor), clean and adequate. Meals were inexpensive and surprisingly good. My family enjoyed the small, but quiet pool. It is downtown, a short drive from the Strip. I would not recommend gambling at the 'Fitz'. We received an excellent value for our accommodations and food. I would recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: yadono
Reviews.Content: Comfort\able friendly rooms and service. I like to stay here when I go out to Vegas with the boys. I have taken a lady friend but you might want to upgrade if you are looking for more plushness. We were treated especially well and found the downtown area refreshingly affordable and entertaining! Clean rooms, good food and service. Always a good time!

Reviews.Title: “Location: FITZGERALD Casino & Hotel, E. Fremont St, Las Vegas, NV”
Reviews.Author: vizio45
Reviews.Content: Fitz Hotel in the old part of town. Near greyhound bus station. the Fremont Experience was amazing. This place is a Budget Hotel. The drawback is that - this is a smoking hotel. Since I was traveling on a budget, I didn't mind. My friends & I jst went back @ nite to take a shower & sleep. The next day up, up up & away. Front desk customer service was superb! Victoria helprd us made it through to our room quick enough after an 8H trip frm CA via AMTRAK & its bus connection. Breakfast was excellent. We only paid the coffee & juice. I'd rec. this place for budget travellers. U can always catch their Muni busses to go to the hign end part of the strip. Shopping of souvenirs like shirts, magnets, etc is so affordable. The bus fare have gone up to $5.00 for a 2H R/T. from North to South Vegas. It used to be $2.00. A LV native said that the increase is to catch up w/ their downed economy. To me, it's too much. $3 bucks wld hve been more sufficient. A lot of the tourist were upset & complained. Will u tell their Cof Commerce abt this? 4bucks for a day pass is a lil doable when u're on a budget. The housekeeper picked up a dirty towel from the floor to wipe the toilet bowl & used the same towel to wipe the bathroom counter, sink & faucet. I was appalled. That was our last day when I saw her did that. Our room was 1114 & 1116. To me, that;s very unsanitary. The lodging was arranged by Trip Res. Our beef was bus fare, smoky smell and housekeeping practices.

Reviews.Title: “Fitzgerald Casino - Downtown Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: AndreLongBeach
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best Casino's to stay and or visit in Downtown Vegas. Everytime I am in Vegas I try to make it to this casino the table's; slots; staff; and hostesses are the best. Room rates are very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “The Fitz Our Halloween Treat”
Reviews.Author: maryl49
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay . Price is right, service is good, food is good, room is clean,slot machines are A-Okay and the adult drinks come @ a nice steady pace. Window views are AWESOME and rt outside the doors of the Fitz u r right smack dab in the middle of the most fun filled bazzaar styled corridor brimming chock full of old style hotels n casinos ,great restaurants, incl/ Nathans Hotdogs, Tony Roma's ,inexpensive gift shops etc .. And the best part of it is that it is all walkable from one EXCITING end to the other. Many of these old heyday hotels have been featured in many tv documentaries, movies and old haunts. Our 4 generation family believe that Halloween is the best time to be here. The best costume Halloween party n parade.

Reviews.Title: “vegas”
Reviews.Author: rkoch2222
Reviews.Content: great time, room was clean and quiet. Food and breakfast special was good and the casino paid off well.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good price”
Reviews.Author: Cherrub
Reviews.Content: We wanted one night off the strip so we could enjoy the Fremont Street experience without having to travel back and forth. We picked the Fitz because of the price, free attached parking and coupons offered. The parking lot was our first experience. Very narrow space and a low ceiling, so be careful if you have a big vehicle. You have to go about 7 stories up to park if you are a guest. No big deal--they have a fast elevator. Check in was fast, pleasant and helpful. They placed a $50 hold on our credit cad because we had a pre-paid room. No big deal. Coupons were good if you were willing to stick around to join their player's club, otherwise, not worth much. Budget rooms, no coffee or fridge. But the view of the mountains especially at dusk were awesome. We also got to watch people jump off the platform for that sky cable ride. That was pretty fun. We were right above a band on Fremont Street, so it was loud. But that's what we came for, so it didn't upset us. Bed was clean (I check always for bugs) and sheets smelled good. Only complaint was the bathroom didn't seem really well cleaned -- like the front of the tub could use a wipedown. Donuts and coffee for sale in the lobby in the morning were nice. So was the noon check out. So much to see on Fremont Street -- but you go to be up for noise. I'd say, shop for price if it matters to you. If this one is in the running, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “The Fitz..”
Reviews.Author: flipxicana
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fitz for 2 nights last week with my 2 children. They loved the pool, which was was empty most of the times we went. Stayed on the 18th floor.Rooms are average. Clean. The fan was a little loud, but we slept through it. The only negative part of the room is when I saw reddish, brownish stains all over the box frames (under the mattress).

Reviews.Title: “Stay here every time”
Reviews.Author: familymtz
Reviews.Content: We loved it the price is low has wonderful table games and staff is great... We want to go again this is absolutely a great place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Why not, if the price is right?”
Reviews.Author: vincentinparis
Reviews.Content: The only reason you'd really want to stay at Fitzgeralds is to enjoy the fun of downtown on the cheap. Our rooms were clean, beds comfortable and we enjoyed being on a high floor, but the look is definitely faded 80s. Plumbing is probably older than that. Drains gurgle even when they are not being used, the walls rattle when the shower is on and one early morning water was barely tepid. AC units are also noisy. Staff is cheerful and friendly, but not always on the ball. The housekeeper greeted me twice one day, but never made up my room despite the fact that it was empty for all but half an hour during her entire shift. When I got back at 6 and saw that the room still hadn't been tidied, I called housekeeping and they sent someone up. But if the price is right as it was for us on a recent busy summer weekend, it's a reasonable choice (especially at nearly half the price of the only marginally better Four Queens next door, or a third of the somewhat ritzier Golden Nugget). Cheap gambling just downstairs rounds out the downtown experience. The fans didn't do a whole lot to cool the balcony bar over Fremont Street, but it was nice to sit and watch the crowds for a while. We didn't eat in the hotel, and probably wouldn't have wanted to.

Reviews.Title: “Good helpful management”
Reviews.Author: wesley1982
Reviews.Content: Nice sized room. Got to pick our floor and 3-4 doors down from elevator. Beds comfortable. Small table and 2 chairs. Air conditioning worked good. Some noise depending on fan speed. Lots of bath sink counter space. Excellent shower water temperature. Tub not clean. Good pool. Very clean. Can order drinks from phone $8. Lots of towels. Private area. Not too far to walk. Courtyard restaurant. Good generous sized meals low priced.$6.99 half rack ribs. $8.99 steak. Free breakfast: eggs, toast, bacon, sausage or ham, potatoes. Really didn't need to go anywhere else to eat. McDonalds and Krispie Kreme on site. Much cheaper than the strip. Easy to walk in and out of casinos on Fremont Street. Drinks are cheaper. Slots pay out more. The rock party atmosphere every night is the best. Lots to see. $3 free play with comp card. Have to spend lots to get anything else. Gift shop needs more t shirts. Not a good selection. $3 margaritas at bar. No problem getting drinks at the games.Management is very friendly and helpful. Check in easy. Concierge seems uninterested. Would stay again for the price, food, and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Max&Lola
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying in downtown and we loved the Fitz. Check-in was quick; room was clean and very comfortable with a great view from the 33rd floor.Public areas on our floor was very clean and we loved the $1.00 ice cold PRR's in the bottle at the bar. Casino had a good variety of games and your $ goes farther downtown. The Vue Bar has a great view of downtown and can't be beat. Breakfast was included in the rate; was a made to order breakfast with eggs, pot, bacon, sausage or ham, and toast in their coffee shop. Great value and good quality food for breakfast. Pool is small but quieter than the strip and you could order drinks via a phone. Loved being downtown and would book at the Fitz again. Service personnel very friendly and we really loved being downtown with the action right out the door! Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Not so hot”
Reviews.Author: crynay
Reviews.Content: The carpeting was just filthy. I was with a group of girls and everyone said their's was too. The bedding seemed new and in great shape. The bathroom need redoing but everything was tolerable except that dirty carpet. Noone would go barefoot. It would have been such a simple thing to correct. I must say we never saw a maid with a vacuum. The high spot was the free breakfast at their restaurant. It was not buffet but served to your table. If I remember right it was cottage fries, bacon or sausage, eggs and some kind of toast and a beverage. It was very good and filled you up. We also had a dinner there and it was good also.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: momzillaca
Reviews.Content: A group of eight friends & family just got back from a 4 night stay at the Fitz. Front desk was very accommodating; got us all near each other on the same floor, and gave us all free late check out for our departure day. They were also very helpful with directions and maps to 'real' shopping malls. The ladies at the Fitz Club desk were very friendly and funny. Any staff we encountered in the hallways and elevators greeted us and inquired about our stay. Cafe staff were also friendly. Rooms were spacious and clean. Beds were very comfy. AC unit was quite loud. Never had to wait long for elevators, even though we were on the 25th floor. Still heard some street sounds, but who's going to bed before 1 am in Vegas anyway? Free breakfast was included; bacon, eggs & potatoes. Pool area is small but clean. The older members of our group had no trouble finding their way around the casino, hotel and street. Much more manageable than the huge mazes on the strip. Night time on Fremont is a big street party. The young people in our group went to the strip one evening, but came 'home' early. From an outdoor cafe they had watched people trying to get into the swanky clubs and weren't inpressed with the homogenous cookie-cutter choosing of who would get in and who would not. On Fremont you party and dance with everyone! We will be staying on Fremont, at the Fitz again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value with a free breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Ydnar
Reviews.Content: Pretty much your typical room, had an old CRT 25 inch TV but at least the picture wasn't distorted like in most properties these days, the ones that have flat screens but not set up properly. Anyway, room was okay, but the fact that it was only a quick elevator ride to the casino or restaurant made this a great stay. The free breakfast was substantial and certainly added to the value. Fitzgerald's is also in a great location on Fremont Street so it's easy to access and in a very fun area.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good, but a couple sour points”
Reviews.Author: Vegaslovers777
Reviews.Content: We just came back from an 11 night stay at the Fitz. For those who want a quick opinion the Fitz is a clean, comfortable hotel and good value for the money. For those looking for more details and specifics my detailed review follows. This was our 1st stay, and overall we were quite pleased with a couple exceptions, detailed below. Front desk/check in/out - very good. Our check in was handled quickly and efficiently (like 2-3 minutes), plus we got the room we booked (not always the case in Vegas). While checking in we requested a mini fridge and it was brought up to our room promptly, while we were still unpacking. Room - in a nutshell our room was clean and comfortable with a comfy bed. For the price we felt it was a good value. Just remember you are not staying at the Bellagio (plus paying little in comparison) so don’t expect ultra luxury. Considering the Fitz’s rates we were completely satisfied with the room. Our room consisted of 1 king bed (2 doubles same price), 2 sitting chairs and small sitting area, desk, so/so TV, iron, coffee maker, and as mentioned, mini fridge. One minor complaint was the A/C worked well but was quite noisy. We stuck a empty match pack between the blades and the unit and that quieted it fairly good. Housekeeping - excellent. We’ve been to Vegas many times and we are late nighters, meaning also that we sleep late. In the past we have had problems getting our room cleaned up and restocked due to this. At the Fitz this was no problem. Despite not getting out of the room till between 2-4 PM each day our room was cleaned and restocked daily, and they did a very good job of it. We could not have asked for more from housekeeping. Pool- The pool and pool sitting area are somewhat small. I’d say pool comfortably holds about 12-15 people and there are about 25 lounge chairs. There is also a 6-8 person hot tub. Pool visitors were of all ages, but learning towards mostly 30s-50s. Good music (at least for us - classic and modern rock). Pool is open till 11pm which we loved as often pools in Vegas in our experience close around 6PM. They have a limited cocktail selection which you order by phone by the pool. But you can also bring your own beverages which many people did which we also enjoyed. For us the pool was ideal as we don’t like large crowds while at the pool and often there we only a 5 or 6 other people there. Depends what you want from the pool but for us it was great. Food - there are limited food options at the Fitz. There is really only 1 full time restaurant. If offers both menu and buffet services and is open approx 7AM-11PM daily. Having said that the food is pretty decent and very reasonably priced (i.e. dinner special $6.99-$9.99). They have a number of daily specials for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. There is also a steak restaurant but its only open I think 3 evenings a week. We didn’t try it but looked at a menu posted on the door and entrees averaged about $30. Other than that there is a 24/7 McDonalds. Staff - generally the staff at the Fitz is very good. Nearly all we encountered were pleasant and helpful and are committed to helping you enjoy your stay. Cocktail /bar service - this is a tough one to rate because it varied so much depending on who was serving. Let me 1st say we’ve been to LV about 12-15 times so have lots of experience in what to expect. We are not one of those who expects a drink within seconds of sitting at a machine. We know in most places the staff work hard and that it takes a bit of time for them to find you to bring you a drink (i.e. 10-15 minutes is not unusual or unexpected). Once they find you then generally are back pretty quick. Having said all that I must say at times the service at the Fitz was very very slow. One time I was playing a table game for about 40 minutes with no service and right after went to a machine for about 30-40 minutes with no service. Another time my wife and I were both playing a table game and went about 45 minutes with no service. We got the dealer to bring the pit boss over and we asked him to check on the service. After about another 30 minutes we still had no service and were about to leave when someone finally showed up. This is not acceptable to me. At most casinos we’ve been too, tables games service is very good. Also comp drinks at the bar can be very slow. One time I sat and played at the main bar for about 25 minutes without being served. This was like at 2AM and there was only 1 other person playing, so it wasn’t busy. In our experience comp drinks at the bar at most casinos we’ve been too is lightning quick (i.e. offered a drink anywhere from within a few seconds to 2-3 minutes). Having said that there are some outstanding servers at the Fitz, Mary-Ann, Julie L, and Joyce in particular. These ladies are quick, friendly and efficient. Most of the other servers are at least decent and serve you in a reasonable time, but there are a ½ dozen or so that are very slow and drag down the overall rating and can give a bad impression to the overall service. Particularly if its your first time there and you are unlucky enough to get one of the bad ones. Players club/comps - compared to other casinos we’ve been to we find the comps at the Fitz are very poor. As I said we’ve been to LV many times and generally we get comped rooms for our whole stay and often meals as well. Being 1st timers at the Fitz we did get 3 nights free and a marginal discount on the other 8 nights but that was it. At the end of our stay we got a shot glass (yippee!). I should add we did play less than we usually do. In part this was due spending time by the pool each day being a summer trip and all. Still the comps/rewards seemed quite low compared to most other places we stayed. In summary we would recommend the Fitz as a clean, comfortable, hotel/casino for a reasonable price. But if you find the comp bar/cocktail service too slow either complain or leave as there is much competition that is willing to offer quicker service. Finally for anyone who values comps/rewards I would recommended you look closely at what the Fitz offers and compare it to others. While we will likely play on occasion at the Fitz in the future we probably would not stay here again for this reason as we can get better comp deals elsewhere. Feel free to PM me with any questions/comments.

Reviews.Title: “Broken, dingy, and smelly”
Reviews.Author: Babs1031
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a weekend night on a whim, as Las Vegas locals wanting to have a fun night out on Fremont Street. When we checked in, our online reservation had not been processed so we were forced to pay again for the room. Then the entire lobby smelled of sewage, our room had beds that felt like they were covered in a think cardboard and when I tried to use the toilet in the bathroom, the handle flew off and sprayed me with toilet water. This was the worst hotel stay I've ever had. The story of our stay has become a funny story for our friends, but our lesson to them is to avoid it at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Siestica
Reviews.Content: We always take a hotel downtown, connection to the strip are easy, and the environment is better, people are more friendly and less bling-bling, this hotel casino was my best stay in LV, amazing staff, smiley and helpful, with delicious breakfast included. Location is good, in the middle of Freemont, with good nightlife, the rooms are spacious and clean, food is also good, and they have the best Croupiers on blackjack table, I totally recommend this place. It's simple and you can feel good, like at home and that's nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: c_bound
Reviews.Content: This hotel is still small enough to get around. The guest elevators are not too far from the parking elevators. The staff is very courteous. The casino is located right on Fremont Street for the sights and vendors. For anyone still wanting the small casino feel, this is the place to stay. It's also great for seniors that have limited walking strength.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive, clean, friendly staff and a great casino”
Reviews.Author: oncewereworkers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a total of 3 weeks. We stayed one week, went away then came back for another two weeks. The casino is located downtown and is a great place to stay if you like playing the slots, eating good food and having roomy but inexpensive and clean accommodation. We can't wait to return next year. The main restaurant has a great menu and the hamburger soup (if you are lucky enough to get it when you are there) is delicious. Fitzgeralds also has another restaurant which is silver service, open Thursdays to Sundays and great for a special night out! Fitzgeralds is located right in Fremont Street where all the action is every day and night with music, ziplining high above the crowds, party people everywhere, and you even get to see Elvis with his backpack and red cape, or the other Elvis with his white jumpsuit... or hang on ... the OTHER Elvis with his black outfit!! Our room had views towards the mountains, we had a king size bed and plenty of space, the bathroom was clean and spacious too and even had a hairdryer and coffee maker.! Waiting for a drink waitress was never a problem and if you tip when you get your drink she will make sure you never go thirsty!! ... unlike some of the more luxurious casinos on the strip where you are lucky if you even see a drink waitress if you are playing the slots. We highly recommend staying at Fitzgeralds if you want an inexpensive weekend away!! The bus to the strip runs regularly and costs$7 for a 24 hour all-buss pass.

Reviews.Title: “Third Strike - You're out”
Reviews.Author: AngelafromOhio
Reviews.Content: I love downtown. I stay at downtown hotels every year when I travel to Vegas twice a year. This year was no exception. I family members arrived a day before me, so I left my bad in their room when I arrived. I checked in to my room, but did not go up right away. We decided to go to lunch first. About 4pm, I finally went up to my room. The bathroom had barely been cleaned since the last guest. I had dirty towels on the shower curtain bar. There was so much hair in the tub that you could tell it had not even been rinsed. There were fresh towels, and new soap but that was about it. I went to the desk to tell them about it, and they called housekeeping to come reclean it. They did, it looked and smelled clean. The following day, phone books were left in the hall by each room. When leaving the room, the housekeeper yelled down the hall to me... "Hey, you better bring those phone books in before you go." All right, fine. I was going to bring it in anyhow, but to have the staff yell at you like it is your job is not reasonable. On my final morning, a knock came at the door at 8:15 am. I heard the yell "Housekeeping". 8:15 am on a Saturday, in Las Vegas. Las Vegas is not a town of early birds, it is a town of night owls. I groggily yelled back.... "I am leaving today, and check out time is noon" She replied.... "Well if you can get ready early let me know, we have someone else checking in to this room" Ok... don't value the guest that is there. Just try to hurry and turn over the room for more cash. Thanks for making me feel like a valued guest on my very last day ever in your hotel! I told the desk manager about this... a different one than the one I told about the dirty bathroom. She seemed concerned. But not enough to offer a free night on a return stay. I was not trying to get something, but don't you think they would try to encourage me to give them one more try? All this would not be so bad, but I had problems with housekeeping last year too. It was way below standard. When I checked in my room last year, the package to the soap had yucky mold all over it. The air vent on the wall had a quarter inch of dust, like it had not been touched in weeks if not longer. Having stayed there before, the standards certainly have dropped. I would not stay there again until they bring customer service back.

Reviews.Title: “nice place but Nugget is better”
Reviews.Author: barbtender13
Reviews.Content: My fourth visit to Fitzgeralds and it was nice and reason for staying there was the price.. No complaints but Golden Nugget is by far THE PLACE in downtown Vegas. Everything there is so nice. Fitz gets terribly loud on the weekends. Had a great time there but will go to the Nugget next trip. If your downtown and want excellent Italian food visit Chicago Joe's on 4th street A very small place about 5 blocks from Freemont Experience. Food is very good and nice way to get away from the hotels and casinos

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for the money!”
Reviews.Author: rrcerny
Reviews.Content: I was very skeptical about the new Fitzgeralds, but the price was right and decided to give it a try for our annual family get together in March. I found the hotel to be pretty good, the room was good, the staff was helpful, the free breakfasts included in the room rate were quite good. I thought the casino was very good. The only thing I really didn't like was the self parking garage which seemed to twist on forever. The hotel is located very good in the Freemont Street, Downtown Las Vegas. My sister didn't like it because in the rooms there didn't have coffee makers in them.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in Downtown, value for money!”
Reviews.Author: rutansh
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a saturday night for around $45, including breakfast - which is a good deal. The room for clean and comfy. They put us on 31st floor with a good view. The breakfast lady was very kind, and breakfast was awesome to start a day. Its right on Fremont street experiance, so if you're shooting for some place in downtown - definitely go for Fitz!

Reviews.Title: “Like it a lot.”
Reviews.Author: bikerbear221
Reviews.Content: 3 years ago we had a lot of fun in their casino so decided we would give staying there a try. We did this for 5 nights last year and based on that we returned this year for 6 nights. This place isnt the Wynn but then you arent paying accordingly. Rooms is fairly large, clean and comfortable. Standard all round really. If you get a higher floor you will have a great view looking out over downtown. Staff all over the property are friendly and helpfull. Casino is a fun place with a good selection of slots and tables. Poker room upstairs is basic but serves a purpose. Vue bar for a cheap drink and a good view on the balcony outside looking out over Fremont. Swimming pool is nothing fancy but gets you wet and space to relax.Mc D for late night munchies or coffee in the morning. Good place all round and for the money is terrific value. We will be back next year. D 1700-10

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: LoveCo50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Fitz for 4 nights. The room was clean and quiet. We had a corner room with windows on 2 sides and a king bed. The staff was friendly and assigned our room before it was ready so we could get the room we wanted. We came back after lunch and got the key. We love getting the free breakfast every morning. We went to the pool/hot tub one evening. There were still towels available, you don't use the towels from your room. This was our second stay and we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This will always be the place I go to”
Reviews.Author: SunInMyEyes
Reviews.Content: I have stayed on the Strip and in this hotel located on Freemont Street in downtown Las Vegas and I have to say that the Strip hotels are nice to look at but this hotel (Fitzgeralds) has some of the best customer service that I have encountered during my many stays. They are very accomodating and have a good comp. system; ALWAYS get a Players Club card and spend some $ at the casino which you are staying at ... from my last trip I was given room, food, money to play, tickets to the hotels' comedy show WOW they really take care of you here! The way I look at it is that since they are not as grandeose they have to try harder to get the clients in the door and make you feel welcome at a fraction of the cost of staying and playing on the strip; take the local transit to where you want to go but everything is very close to this hotel for anything you need rather than walking 4 blocks to reach your next (hotel/casino) destination.

Reviews.Title: “great downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: pat1888Glasgow
Reviews.Content: Have been to vegas many times but this was the first time ive stayed downtown.Located on fremont street,"Fitz "casino and hotel is great place to stay.Free breakfast voucher every day and great price from "expedia" make this the place.Have already booked up for vegas in november and im staying at fitzs again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Deep in the hot of Texas
Reviews.Title: “Fancy? No, but it's comfortable and economical”
Reviews.Author: SpinyNorma
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Fitzgeralds. It's not fancy by any means but I love the Fitz. My room was large and the bed comfortable. The window is large and, while you don't see the glorious shiny strip, I had a view of the mountains and at night the housing developments you could see provided some shininess.
