I like their casino and the cocktail waitresses were more available than in most casinos I visited during my trip. The staff I encountered were all very friendly and helpful. One of the good things about the Fitz is that they are very generous with offers for very little play. I'd have to work up to being considered a low roller and even I get offers for two nights for the price of one. This includes weekend nights. It also came with show tickets (Fitz of Laughter) and coupons. It's a pretty basic room. The TV is old style but it was a decent size and it worked well. The hot water worked fine in the shower but the water pressure wasn't great. Not terrible but not great. There were plenty of towels. Internet isn't free although I understand there's free WIFI at Krispy Kreme. The only other restaurant there that I ate at was their one on the second floor. I think it's called Garden Court. It was okay (especially with the coupon at check in) but I wouldn't make a big effort to go again. The good thing about downtown is that you're not very far from anywhere else downtown. Four Queens is next door and their cafe, Magnolia's, is very good and open 24 hours. There are several other places to eat that are very close. I'd advise you to go afield for eating but then come back to the casino to play. I'd often heard complaints about the elevators there but that problem seems to be fixed. I never had to wait very long for one to arrive and the ride was smooth. I've stayed at two other hotels downtown in previous trips and I now consider the Fitz to be my downtown home. It's nothing fancy but it's comfortable, clean, safe, and economical. The staff is friendly and helpful and, my personal favorite, the Fitz is quite generous with offers for those of us who are not bankroll-enhanced.

Reviews.Title: “Fitzgeralds - Best Ribs Ever”
Reviews.Author: bormanator
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fitz four nights in May 2011. Included free brakfast in the Courtyard restaurant - eggs, meat, toast, home fries. Drinks extra. Food was very good, staff were somewhat slow but there were only a few working early. I had the half-rack of ribs one day for lunch, they were delicious, very meaty, cooked just right. Included salad bar, potato, vegetables. I also had a $2 off coupon for the meal, given to me in the welcome package. I also got a $5 coupon for matching a bet at a table. I used it at blackjack and actually won that hand! They have $2 and $3 tables too. I like that now that the Sahara $1 tables are gone. The room was clean, quiet (even with Fremont St visible from my window). Coke and ice machines on each floor. Convenient to Fremont, buses, shops, food. Pool is small but I did not use it as it has no shade. I will definitely stay here again. Also, the whole floor was non-smoking. Oh yeah, the Krispy Kreme in front has free wifi, the hotel charges too much. My one complaint was that a phone call to Florida cost me $7 dollars.

Reviews.Title: “YUCK”
Reviews.Author: Tracey_Adams
Reviews.Content: I will not stay here again. We wanted to try staying Downtown and I really wished we would of paid more for the Golden Nugget. As soon as you walk in the Resort all you can smell is smoke. Our 1st room was awful. We walked into the bathroom and the front of our Jacuzzi tub was laying on the bathroom floor. All the rusted plumbing exposed. It smelled like molded wet plumbing. The 2nd room the bathroom was a little better but the water would not turn off in the tub. The rooms are so outdated and musty. I will not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: kingjkhan
Reviews.Content: Located on Fremont Street it is right where the action is but the biggest problem is the noise. The noise from Fremont Street is a big disturbance during the night and it is hard to sleep even though the rooms itself is very comfortable. The upside is that it is right in the middle of Fremont Street and you just step out of the Hotel and you are in the middle of Fremont Street experience.

Reviews.Title: “Easter Stay”
Reviews.Author: jlcrn1
Reviews.Content: We stayed over Easter and had a great time. This was our 3rd stay at the Fitz. Rooms are clean and comfy, not fancy. Plenty of towels and soap. Safe for your valubles. Roomy enough for the 2 of us. Elevators working just fine. Staff was pleasant/friendly. Ate at the cafe...food was fine. We always have fun here. would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD PRICE BUT VERY RUN DOWN”
Reviews.Author: harleys1
Reviews.Content: This hotel could be nice if they would spend a little more time deep cleaning and updating carpets. Bathroom sink and tub had problems draining. Very disappointed with this hotel and would not recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough”
Reviews.Author: hakkincac1
Reviews.Content: Still here and leaving in a couple of hours. I enjoyed this place. Relaxing and nice. Was worried the noise would keep me up, but none, it was just a nice place and I was happy with my stay. Would come again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap place to stay if you want to be downtown.”
Reviews.Author: KrazeeNevada
Reviews.Content: This is a reliable cheap hotel in you want to stay downtown. The rooms are clean and roomy, and the price is right. The parking garage is kind of interesting -- expect to go around and around the ramps before you can park. It's fun to pop out every hour to see the Fremont Street show.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE!”
Reviews.Author: CaligirlzJenn
Reviews.Content: Can a review have negative stars??? I stayed at this dump on 4-11-11 to 4-13-11. On my way to Las Vegas, I called this hotel and was offered a rate of $29 per night. When I arrived, tired from my long drive, I was informed that the room rate was $59 for a Monday night and $39 for Tuesday. I did not appreciate the old "Bait and Switch" routine that was played on me. I stayed in room #1723, a corner room at the end of the musky hallway. This place is old and rundown and needs some improvements. My room also had an awful smell, and the bed was way too soft for my liking. The air conditioner unit was positioned close to the bed, which made me stuffy when I went to bed. The bathroom had major problems, for one, the sink clogged constantly and the shower had running water that never turned off. The water came out extremely hot and it was difficult to adjust the water temperature. The water pressure was bad as well. They offered me two free breakfast coupons to eat at their cafe. The breakfast was ok, but the hostess and servers were not friendly at all. I normally am a 20% tipper, but it was hard to leave more than 15% gratuity. I do not recommend Fitzgeralds to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME !!!”
Reviews.Author: skylersgrandma
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Las Vegas, staying at Fitzgeralds.. Another awesome trip. We stayed on the 19th floor and never had to wait for an elevator on the way down. Only 1 time in, 4 days was the elevator fuller, and we could have gotten on, but chose to wait for the next one. Never any lengthly wait going up !! Only ate 1 mean in the cafe, and it was not GOOD !! OMG, the steak special was horrid, very fatty and way way overcooked !! Back to the 4 Queens we went.. Casino was HOT HOT HOT, and not gambling wise !! I like the heat, but the temp was outrageous !!! I was able to play for 6 hours on $30.00 and at the end, I cashed out my $30.00!! The Fitz is the only place that we stay !! Oh yeah, do not be fooled by the pool !! The water is ICE COLD !!! Catch, it does not say heated !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place-great price”
Reviews.Author: Olalani
Reviews.Content: Fitzgeralds was a great place to stay and play. We were close enough to enjoy the excitement of the Fremont Experience yet far enough to avoid all the noise when we needed to sleep. The no-frills room was a little outdated (old tv-basic chan only) but it was clean and comfortable. Employees (esp. housekeeping and slot attendant) were very pleasant and fun to talk with. We scored on the price and also scored on complimentary breakfasts every morning. Try the zipline through Fremont Experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, great price”
Reviews.Author: DingPression
Reviews.Content: Rooms are basic but clean. No fridge, no microwave, no free wi-fi. King-sized bed was very comfortable. Room also has a table and two chairs, two larger lounge-type chairs, a desk, in-room safe, television, cabinets for storing clothing and other items. Carpet was obviously older and frayed a bit in front of the bathroom door but otherwise clean. Staff was friendly, honoring our request for a higher floor, and they also helped us quickly when our room keys mysteriously stopped working the last day of our stay. We ate breakfast in the Courtyard Grill each morning: good food at a reasonable price. Even though our room faced Fremont Street, it was surprisingly quiet. We ran the a/c overnight to help, but I never heard enough noise to wake me up or make me think we were so close to the action outside. Great location, great price, great staff. Room wasn't quite nice enough to earn a great, but it was definitely good. My wife and I would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fitz is where to stay and save money”
Reviews.Author: putt74B
Reviews.Content: got there at 1230 in the afternoon, no problem with getting the room I reserved for that night. Staff was friendly and helpful with any questions you may have. If you want value, the rooms are clean and kept up daily, no frills, if you are looking for value, to clean up and sleep, and not be in your room all day, come on! your in Vegas baby, who is going to stay in there room all day? Will definitely be staying there on the next trip. Only a block from the bus stop to take the bus to the main strip. $7 for 24 hrs on the Duece, a double decker bus, this saves a whole lot of walking and expensive Taxi fares.Food at the Courtyard buffet was good, $1.99 breakfast, and a $8.99 Ribeye dinner with potato and salad all day, versis $15 to $50 on the main strip. Also has a Mcdonalds in the lobby for something quick or a cup of coffee in the morning. Looking forward to the next trip, also I might mention I felt safe and secure there, security is everywhere and not threatining. Had no problems with leaving things out in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel if you want to stay Downtown”
Reviews.Author: travlinmel101
Reviews.Content: If you need somewhere inexpensive to stay…you can’t go wrong with “The Fitz.” It’s just a basic hotel/casino, but for the price, it’s good. I felt safe and comfortable, nothing shady. It’s located right on the end of Fremont Street, which is very close to the bus stop to take you to the Strip (the 24-hr pass was $7). To get on we went to corner of Fremont & Las Vegas Blvd and drop-off was on 4th between Fremont & Carson. McDonald’s is located “inside” the casino, lots of cheap souvenir shops all around, and plenty of casinos. The room offered a safe, closet, full-tub showers, hairdryer, shampoo/conditioner, iron, alarm clock, TV, we had a “nice” view… This was my first time to Vegas, and personally, I would much rather stay somewhere on the Strip. We wasted a lot of time waiting for the bus and riding the bus back and forth. Also, the casinos on Fremont street are “nice,” but don’t have as much “atmosphere” as the ones on a strip. If you have time, though, you could take one day and go downtown just to check it out. (Even with that, I’d rather take a taxi then the bus. But, if you take the bus, there are actually 2 of them, “The Deuce” and then the “regular” Las Vegas buses, unless you have to take the Deuce, AVOID IT, it makes many, many more stops!)

Reviews.Title: “great hotel even better service”
Reviews.Author: carman10167
Reviews.Content: service was great as usual... 5 star service for a 2 star price. rooms are clean and serviceable, not posh but decent. got in at 9:30 in the am and they put us right in our room.... no waiting till 3 or 4 . that was a service in itself... great room with a view.. always fun on fremont... fitzgeralds can't be beat on fremont street

Reviews.Title: “Fitz was fine with us.”
Reviews.Author: shadow700
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fitz March 5-10, 2011, room 3034. I had 3 free nights, and my friend had buy one get one free, so the price was right! Have stayed at the Fitz before so knew what to expect. The room was clean and had a great view. We did have one day that our room wasn't serviced, so when we got back for the night we had to call for more towels. Everyone was friendly except for one coctail waitress. We tipped well, but she acted like we were bothering her when we asked for a drink. I always have fun at the Fitz, and would stay there again. The music was really loud during the weekend, but it was better mid week.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff/So-So Rooms”
Reviews.Author: HotelGirl811
Reviews.Content: Let me preface by saying I work for a hotel so I'm generally biased when traveling. I expect certain things but I'm also more leniant when it comes to problems because I've been on the other side of the desk. When my parents and I checked in, the FD did a great job of meeting our requests and blocking us on a high floor close to each other. So far so good. As soon as we got to the rooms we examined the beds for bed bugs. Room 2430 was good to go. Room 2424 was infested. I actually conduct the training for my housekeeping department so I know what to look for. I had instructed my parents to not unpack for this very reason and immediately called housekeeping. The supervisor who came up was dumbfounded that I even knew what to look for and challenged me on my findings. She immediately recanted however when I produced the "evidence". My parents were moved to 1623 which was bug free. I strongly recommend that any traveler who reads this Review become educated on checking for bedbegs. It doesn't matter if you're checking into the Ritz or the Fitz...as long as people continue to travel there is the possibility of bed begs. I asked that the Front Office Manager call me the next day to discuss the issue and Dawn (manager on duty) did just that. She was extremely apologetic and empathetic and handled the situation beautifully. We were treated to a dinner at Don B's and thouroughly appreciated her generosity/follow through. The rest of the stay was uneventful and relaxing. We made friends with the Craps dealers Herman, David and Lana as well as the pitboss Patrick. Their professionalism and personalities really helped us to enjoy the weekend and we would come back specifically to see them again. The morning breakfast was decent and dinner at Don B's is definitely a must do. Overall (minus the crawlly friends) the rooms were comfortable and accommodating. Water pressure in the showers is AWESOME! The purpose of this review is not to scare you away from the Fitz...like I said, you can unfortunately encounter bed bugs these days at almost any hotel. Moreover it is to praise the team for how they handled the situation and to definitely recommend them for their service. The location of the hotel is perfect if you enjoy freemont street and their staff is well trained on service issues. Because of this we will still consider Fitzgeralds again when traveling to Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Downtown”
Reviews.Author: lockerroom66
Reviews.Content: Stayed Jan 19-23, 2011. Likes and comments: STAFF are friendly and helpful; housekeeping does a great job daily in keeping the room clean and towels changed. Security present but not threatening. ROOMS are basic, but clean; The bathroom has a long vanity, hairdryer, decent toiletries; the towels were functional, but not plush. Our room had 2 double beds, a dresser with 2 drawers, a TV cabinet with 3 drawers, a nightstand, and a table with 2 chairs. I liked the surge rotector with 5 jacks at the bedside floor - hard to find plugs in hotels. This time our room did not face freemont street and the noise was much reduced. POOL- is closed in January, but looked very clean. Hot tub was open. RESTAURANT - excellent value in the mornng - $1.99 for 2 eggs any style, diced breakfast potatoes, and toast. Add bacon or sausage for $1.99 more... the short line to get in moved quickly. GAMING - at least one $2 blackjack all day, MANY $5 tables, generally no waiting, pretty generous with their comps. DRINKS - cocktail waitresses come by frequently and drinks of good quality. Check out the Vue bar overlooking freemont street on the secon floor TAKE a side trip to the Outlets (off Charleston -very closeby), and if you're an adventurer, spend the day hiking Red Rock Canyon, about 12 miles away. DID NOT LIKE: Self parking garage - you have to park above floor 6 and garage winds round and round and is very tight. Other customers may drive too fast and BIG potential for an accident. Valet was efficient and a $1-2 tip is worth avoiding an accident! GREAT Value - be sure to get a Fitz card for special savings and coupons.

Reviews.Title: “Fine stay!”
Reviews.Author: Rogas38
Reviews.Content: It was my first stay at the Fitz and Downtown. I opted to try the bus from the airport and it was a deal! Stopped at the BTC and got a five day bus pass for $10 (senior rate). No line at the checkin and the room was large, clean and quiet (10th floor). The staff was courteous and helpful- especially the cleaners. Downtown was fun- inexpensive food and drink and a real cast of 'characters'. Getting to the main part of the strip was easy (the SDX and the Deuce) and while it took some time (1/2 hour average), it was a fine way to take in the site. I took the WAX- airport express- on my way out and it took c. 20 minutes! Since the WAX crosses the strip and stops at the Trop it may be a hidden gem for getting to the south part of the strip in a hurry... Despite the added time getting to the Strip, the Fitz was a great value. Based on this one visit, I'll definitely try it again!!

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: freewillee
Reviews.Content: Old hotel but the inside has been redone and is well maintained. Very comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Still a good place to stay, but not fancy”
Reviews.Author: xantippy
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at "The Fitz" quite a few times now. Each time, we have found all the staff to be very personable and friendly, the food at the Courtyard Grill tasty and cheap, and the Downtown experience entertaining. "The Deuce" bus is one block away which makes it convenient to get to The Strip if you don't have a car or don't want to drive. It is $5 each way or $7 for unlimited rides within 24 hours. We had some slow drivers this time, but overall the Deuce is a handy way to travel (clean, safe, comfortable). The Fitz is not fancy; it appears to have been built in the 70s with few updates, but the sheets are clean, food is good, and it's cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location nice cheap hotel and no resort fees”
Reviews.Author: UkMacyslover
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fitz for 4 days whilst on a week long vacation in Las Vegas and wishes we had stayed booked into this hotel for the duration of our stay, after 4 days we moved onto the Ecalibur on the strip and wishes we hadnt. The Fitz is an older hotel and does need sum updating in the rooms, but we did find it comfortable and clean although we asked for a non smoking room you could see people had been smoking in it before us and you could smell it a lot. The breakfast in the morning at the courtyrd cafe was very good and set us up for the day either sight seeing or shopping. We went to Nellis Airforce base for the 2010 airshow and we enjoyed it appart from the organisation of getting there transport to and from the base this was a shambles we stood for over an hour in the heat waiting to be loaded onto a bus after going thruogh what looked like airport security what a joke that was. But getting back to the Fitz if you want a cheap stay in Vegas thats my recomendation and where to stay.

Reviews.Title: “always our choice”
Reviews.Author: iapiggy
Reviews.Content: well is another stay here. thanksgiving weekend as usual our regular room clean, quiet and comped. we love the slots and pai gow table. ate at Don B's saturday had the prime rib with a bone wife had filet and lobster tail. we had crab cakes appetizer and dessert that was to die for. so much food.ummmmmm. going back in april expecting nothing less. reccomend downtown for anyone never been . its the old strip but lowest table limits and slots pay off. thanks Alan for another nice vacation

Reviews.Title: “Loved gambling with Johnny.”
Reviews.Author: DAC
Reviews.Content: Do not travel downtown much at all but had to write as it was one of the most fun parts of our trip this time. Cheap food, great drinks and VERY friendly service from the servers to the dealers. The standout was the dealer at the Fitzgeralds by the name of Johnny who made the four of us laugh for hours. He made losing fun if that is possible. The bar service was also top knotch as our drinks NEVER went empty which helped us have some fun. Thanks for the great time as I will return more often downtown after this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel on Fremont Street”
Reviews.Author: elizabethw001
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. It was relatively cheap, 40 bucks a night. The view was great. Right out the window you could see Fremont street...The pool not so great...small. The room was clean, good air conditioner, the parking was not great. It was free but there was hardly anywhere to park. The casino was great. Of all the casinos this one paid out the most. We did have free breakfast, and it was good breakfast...hot breakfast. And the resteraunt was also very good!

Reviews.Title: “loved the fitz...”
Reviews.Author: diana-al
Reviews.Content: been coming to vegas for many years & never thought of this hotel even though we always loved staying downtown-well this trip their rates were incredible & it included breakfast also-I am in the room right now on my laptop-the room is lovely, quiet & clean- the breakfast this morning was wonderful-the workers are all very friendly-there is free parking-there is a 24 hour mcdonalds in the hotel-the guests all look happy-the fremont experience is right here-lots of great restaurants in the area with many $7.99 prices for prime rib-was hearing that vegas was doing poorly-you would never guess that by all of the crowds-it's tuesday & the town is jumping-just love this place!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, for a clean room, on Fremont.”
Reviews.Author: contactjb
Reviews.Content: Great value for a clean room and public areas on Fremont. Well worth the money spent. The fixtures are dated in the room but well maintained. Great place for a budget minded traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Consider Fitzgeralds”
Reviews.Author: HIGUCA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I saw Don Rickles On October 16, and we stayed at Fitzgeralds. We enjoy Downtown more than the Strip because it is not as crowded, and it sure is easier to sample different casinos with everything on Fremont. A couple of days before leaving, I received a call from reservations clarifying our requests for the type of room we wanted. On arrival (at 8:00 p.m.), everything was as requested. We had dinner twice in the casual restaurant, and enjoyed a free breakfast there. The food is good, reasonable, and the waitstaff was generous, allowing us to enjoy the salad bar. On Friday night we dined at Don B's Steakhouse. As usual, the service was great, the filets we had were great, we had a free appetizer (escargot), and since we were celebrating my birthday we shared a great chocolate dessert on the house. The staff at Fitzgeralds was as friendly and helpful as ever, even though the hotel and casino was very busy (which was great to see). Bottom line: Consider staying Downtown, and consider Fitzgeralds.

Reviews.Title: “a good and cheap place to stay”
Reviews.Author: NikoletaL
Reviews.Content: we spent 4 nights here, it was during the week, so double queen bed room was for 30 USD per night!!! The same room on friday and saturday night is for 120 USD! The room was nice and clean, also bathroom, roomservice good. No breakfast provided, and internet acces is 12 USD forn a day!!! They have a poll - we did not try, parking is for free.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: TimSachi
Reviews.Content: I pre-paid 2 nights for a non-smoking room w 1 king bed - I had to take room with 2 doubles - apparently very common problem from reading other reviews. Noises from bathroom (water filling, gurgling noises) all night. TV menu system didn't work so I couldn't order movies nor do room check-out on TV. Toilet didn't flush well; bathroom sink filled up even though not stoppered and drained very slowly. I went to front desk in morning and asked to switch rooms - they said I would have to come back later in afternoon to see if anything else available. I also told front desk about bathroom noises and TV - said they would send a tech to fix TV - they never did. I was essentially ignored. My friend staying in another room had similar but even worse issues - toilet wouldn't flush; TV didn't work at all. The room was very cheap but I still expect a few basics: a toilet that flushes, a sink that drains, and a TV that works, etc. I don't think the Fitz is even capable of providing that so they should close their hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fitzgeralds Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: caitlynspapa
Reviews.Content: Stayed downtown at Fitzgeralds Casino & Hotel last month. Everyone from the bellman, bartenders and dealers made our stay very enjoyable. The only problem was their sportsbook had closed and we had to run across the street to the Fremont. Love betting on the horses and ball games. Hope next time the new sportsbook will be open. Thanks to all who made our stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: deedee5616
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights here and overall had a great time. Good location to everything. There was live entertainment outside every night. Rooms were clean and nice, and although bedding was clean, they had some stains on them. They should throw out soiled linens and pillows and replace with new ones.

Reviews.Title: “My third time and my last”
Reviews.Author: Gardenia073
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel 3 times out of 5 times that I have travel to Las Vegas. This time we stayed for 2 nights and it would be my last. The hotel is getting old, the room that I got this time on level 32 was quite dirty, the carpet was dirty, the water in the sink didnt flush quick enough, the TV is old as well as the piece of furniture where it is on. WE got free breakfast at one of their restaurant and to tell the truth I would rather eat at McDonalds, the service at the restaurant was horrible also.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Value For The Money”
Reviews.Author: SteveSly
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Fitz in mid September 2010. Overall, considering the rooms were only $35 per night we had a decent experience. The hotel has been around for a long time and the rooms are very basic and showing signs of wear. This is definitely a case of getting what you pay for, so considering the price, the room was decent. The one bad experience that we had was that we had booked a King size bed, but were told upon check in that there were none available. The twin beds that we ended up with were extremely small. So small in fact that my wife and I ended up sleeping in separate beds because there was simply not enough room in the individual twins. Not exactly an ideal situation especially when you are on vacation. We had other family members staying at the hotel as well and some of them had the same experience with not getting a king size bed. The hotel staff was all very nice and the elevator problem that used to plague the place has been resolved. In fact I don’t think I ever waited more than about 15 seconds to get the elevator. The casino staff is very friendly and I even walked away with more money than I came with. The food at the café was just ok. The casino no longer has a sports book which was not too big a deal with Four Queens and Golden Nugget right next door. Overall we had a good experience with the exception of the bed situation.

Reviews.Title: “very cheap, adequate hotel”
Reviews.Author: bizramone
Reviews.Content: we havent travelled to vegas before and if we go again i would stay on the strip as it is quite a distance especially with the traffic on the strip makes it seem even further away. we travelled on the deuce bus which gets packed on the weekends. we paid $25 per night we booked a non smoking double room and they didn't have any, so that was a bit annoying and all our clothes smelt of smoke after staying in the room anyway we were on the 22nd floor which was a great view, the room was huge with a large bathroom. It was clean just looked pretty dated. The hotel is part of the Freemont St experience and it was a great atmosphere on the pedestrianised street. We used the pool which was nice and cool in the nevada heat. we bought breakfast in the hotel restaurant but thought it was overpriced and average.

Reviews.Title: “As always...a blast!!!”
Reviews.Author: christib1975
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 09/24 thru 09/28 with a group of family in town for a wedding. Check-in was a breeze...the staff super friendly...and the room was fine. It appears that they have upgraded some of their games...had a dealertainer area setup for the Football promo and seemed to busy most of the time we were there. Stayed in room 2226 in a Smoking Double...great view of the mountains and quiet. Sure, the room shows some age, but it's perfectly comfortable. Cocktail service was great...the staff seemed friendly and I wouldn't hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “If you'd rather spend your money on gambling and attractions, then this is your place”
Reviews.Author: mjames1229
Reviews.Content: Fitzgeralds is downtown hotel. Downtown hotels are not Ooh-la-la fancy (although Golden Nugget is trying to be). Downtown properties give you a comfortable bed, a clean shower and - if you're lucky enough - a room far enough from the Fremont Street Experience so that you can get some sleep. And Fitzgeralds fits on all counts. My buddies and I found three rooms at Fitz for $40/night average (incl a Friday and Saturday night) and the rooms are perfect for that price. The rooms were all clean, the beds comfortable and the TV channels numerous (I had to watch some NFL pregame!). I had no complaints at all. The property is older and the rooms could be refurbished and look nicer, but then I would be paying a lot more, and would have less money for what I really came to Las Vegas for... gambling and eating!

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: vegasluvr
Reviews.Content: We used to stay at the Fitz every year, but a few years ago, we had a very bad experience and there's an old review here somewhere that tells the story. I swore I'd never go back, but after reading some of the new and improved reviews, we decided to give the place another chance because we had so many fond memories. Needless to say, we did not regret our decision. As everyone should know, this is not a fancy hotel. It is a basic hotel room, so if you are looking for an upscale strip hotel, this place is not for you. However, if you're looking for a laid back, clean and basic room at an unbelievable value, then you've come to the right place! They did replace the elevators, and that alone is a HUGE improvement. No more waiting!! Customer service was excellent. Our housekeeper, Ernestine, was so wonderful. If you are lucky enough to get her, please tip her accordingly. She is worth it! We always use valet parking, and they are great guys too and will help with directions or whatever you need. We did not eat in the restaurants this trip so I can't comment on that. All the guests that we ran into seemed to be having a great time, and there was just a great vibe all around with both staff and guests. And btw, there IS a coffee maker in the room. I can't remember the last time I saw that in Vegas. Hubby loved it! We love Fremont Street, and always stay there on our trips to Vegas. We are so glad that we chose the Fitz for this trip and we even won some money in the casino!

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain”
Reviews.Author: RIVERMAN63
Reviews.Content: Got a great room - During CES for a fantastic price. The staff were wonderful, the room was clean and comfortable. The casino was fun and i managed to win a little at Craps. It you are looking for Vegas glitz and glamor - do not stay here. This is a downtown "local" hotel. It provides exactly what you need froma hotel - Cleanliness, comfort, value, polite efficient staff and it is quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Still fine, a bit better than last time”
Reviews.Author: dljpdx
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time I have stayed at the Fitz, and am happy to report that the elevators were all in working order and seemed faster than previous stays - no more waiting 10 or 15 minutes for an elevator to arrive. My room seemed to be in slightly better shape than on previous stays - they may have updated a few things, or perhaps I just got a somewhat nicer room. If you're looking for a 4-star place downtown with all the extras, stay at the Golden Nugget. If you want a decent place to stay, sleep and keep your things, The Fitz is perfectly acceptable and typically has very reasonable rates for a budget-minded traveler. The room, like most downtown hotels, was pretty large. Had a king bed, desk with chair, two end tables, iron & iron board, in-wall safe, bathroom, and TV in a cabinet with 3 or 4 drawers. Wish it had a mini-fridge, but that's my main gripe about all the downtown hotels in general. The bathroom had little bottles of shampoo and lotion, and 2 bars of soap. I used the shampoo and lotion daily, and they were restocked each day by housekeeping. Fresh towels daily as well. The Fitz is comparable to The Plaza, Binion's and The Fremont, where I have also stayed in the past. It's a step up from the Las Vegas Club, which was pretty ratty the one time I stayed there. I have never stayed at the Golden Gate nor California Hotel, so can't make a comparison to those. I've read complaints from people re: various downtown hotels and if you're considering any of them (excepting the Golden Nugget, which is at the top of the list for downtown hotels), be aware that most of them have not been updated in years, perhaps decades. There is no such thing as a non-smoking room - they have all been smoked in at some point; last night, last week, last month...as such you might have a cigarette smell, a burn mark on the bathroom counter or end table...that sort of thing. They're also pretty basic and no frills. Depending on which way the room faces, you may hear noise from the Fremont Street Experience. I don't have any real complaints about The Fitz for this stay, which was 4 nights. Only 2 things bugged me a little: the bathroom sink didn't have a drain stopper (so you had to let the water run when shaving or washing up, which seemed wasteful), and the curtains were about 6 inches narrower than the window opening (so the morning light would flood the room at the crack of dawn). Otherwise, it was fine for my needs, which was a downtown place to sleep and stow my luggage. They do have an on-site pool, which looked clean and maintained, and a number of people were using it during my stay. Wifi is available for $12 per day - pretty steep. They have internet kiosks in the lobby which are likely cheaper if you just want to check email. They do have an Enterprise rent-a-car desk in the hotel, if you want to get out of town for a day (up to Area 51, down to Hoover Dam, tool around town or whatnot). Tips: I didn't eat at any of the on-site restaurants, but did discover a new (to me) diner/restaurant at the back of the Golden Gate Hotel & Casino, called DuPar's (not the cafe', but the restaurant & diner, which is a separate place). The pancakes are great, and huge - try a short stack, which is 3 pancakes but they are as big as dinner plates so plenty for one person, maybe even 2 people to share. They also had good salads and pies, but the chicken noodle soup was off - I think it had been sitting too long. If you're looking for some good old-school style Vegas dining, try The Peppermill or Carluccio's - the decor in both places has to be seen to be believed. For another funky experience, grab drinks at Frankie's Tiki Room. To save a good $40 or more (each way), try taking the #108/Paradise bus from the airport to downtown, and back again. Catch it at level zero, it costs $2, takes about an hour to get downtown (give or take - one time it took me 40 minutes, another time a little more than an hour - plan on 90 minutes and you should be fine). It lets you off at the base of Fremont, by The Golden Gate (across Main St from The Plaza), and it's about 4 blocks' walk to The Fitz. On the way back, you catch the bus on the other side of Main St (the Plaza side), next to the old train car. I've taken this bus a number of times, at varying times of day & night, and it's always been safe and cheap. If you don't mind getting the occasional mail & email offer in the future, sign up for the Casino Player clubs. Most of them have some sort of coupon book that comes with signing up, and/or they give you a little trinket (deck of cards, dice etc)...and admittedly most of the coupons aren't very useful, but a few pay off. For example, at one place I got $10 in free slot play, and while you can't cash out that $10 worth, anything you win, you keep - I ended up winning $65 using their $10. At another place I got a $20 dining credit and ended up paying only $2 for a giant dinner. The better perks come later - I chose The Fitz this time because they send out quarterly coupons - the one I used was for a free night for every paid night, so my hotel was 1/2 price this trip.

Reviews.Title: “kicked us out”
Reviews.Author: skisickie
Reviews.Content: daughter took her disabled dad to the mens restroom and walked the wheelchair into him after checking to make sure no others were there. They kicked her out. Big Problem There, there is not a open Family disabled restroom

Reviews.Title: “Meh..It Was Okay.”
Reviews.Author: nlmeylo
Reviews.Content: I thought the Fitz was just okay. It is older and shows a fair amount of wear and tear, but for less than $40/night over a holiday weekend with a football game in town you don't expect a 5-diamond hotel or complain. Friendly & helpful bell staff. Reasonable minimums on tables. Good food and drink specials. Casino floor smelled smoky and some of the older slots were greasy. The main issue I had with the rooms was when pulling the bedspreads and blankets off the bed, the blankets were riddled with cigarette burns and stiff spots (I can only imagine), but you don't use those anyway and it's not like you spend a lot of time in Vegas sleeping. We were on the 20th floor and had no elevator issues. Had a blast on Fremont Street both outside under the light show checking out the live bands and visiting the different hotels for entertainment. Hogs & Heifers is a block away. Be careful & try not to wander off Fremont Street at night & definitely not alone, e.g., homeless & old hookers. Next time out I'll most likely wait for a BOGO air/flight package on the Strip from Allegiant Air. Bus passes are cheap if I decide to head to another part of town.

Reviews.Title: “nice friendly place”
Reviews.Author: mikeraa
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my 88 year old mother. They were very frindly at the front desk. We arrived at midnight and had to wait for thre computer to change to the next business day. The gal behind the desk was polite and made the wait seem not too long even though she had to fend off a rude, drunk man while we were waiting. We asked for a room near the elevator and was given one which made it nice for my mother. The hotel was neat and clean and the beds were comfortable. The free breakfast inthe morning was an added plus. Great service and good food. I went gambleing and only lost a little money, I could have come out ahead but didn't stop in time...like most gamblers I used the valley parking which made it very easy. I would deffinatley stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KatrinaO
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fitz for the first time last October. Great Location and Great Casino! For the price we paid I can't complain. The rooms are a outdated but it wasn't a big deal, they were always clean and it's not like we spent much time in them other than sleeping! The staff was very friendly and accomedating. I will be returning to The Fitz this November and I can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - Great Room!”
Reviews.Author: BrendaP66
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at this hotel in July, and absolutely loved it... I'll be back for sure! The bellman was telling us that the hotel has undergone a lot of renovations in the last few years, and it really showed. Check in was easy (although a little slow... more people on the desk would have been nice) and the elevators to the rooms are almost right across from the check -n desk and the elevators to the parking garage. Parking was free and we had no trouble getting a parking spot. The elevators to the rooms were super fast! The room was clean and obviously recently renovated (as were the hallways). My friend had medication that needed to be refrigerated, and when we checked with the front desk about this, they had one delivered to our room right away free of charge. The hotel does have internet access, but it was REALLY expensive... about $11 a day! We bit the bullet though and payed that, since we had such a great rate on our room otherwise. We didn't use the pool at all, but we did eat at the coffee shop restaurant. They have some specials, but you really have to watch what time they are. The food was ok, and it was probably one of the less expensive places to eat on Fremont St. I did a little gambling, but always have bad luck, so there's not much use on me commenting on that aspect of the stay. Guess that's why the rooms are so inexpensive! All in all, I was really happy with this hotel. I'd give it a firm 3 star rating (IMO) and a definite thumbs up for location and value. Fremont St is the best place to stay in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Good bargain on Fremont street”
Reviews.Author: brunoffrance
Reviews.Content: If you search a price as us and doesn't want a poor hotel , this one is really a good bargain ! $53 for 2 nights on Las vegas with a saturday inclused.... Impossible to do better, excep if you sleep in your car.... Middle class hotel-casino and not a poor casino too. Plus, you are at the Fremont avenue and realy, it's the BEST free attraction on Las vegas and never seen in another part of the world... it's a great place and unique ! About the bedroom: spacious, a bit oldy furniture , marble for the lavatory,.... middle class but you pay more for less comfort usually in hotels. Breakfast was inclused but no choice: 2 eggs with sauçage or bacon. drinks have to be paid.... NO wifi inclused ( $12 / day) and the swimming pool is often closed but there is a jacuzzi. Parking is free as you are hotel guest ... that is a good news !!!! Finally a good bargain !

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: keywest06
Reviews.Content: While staying at this hotel, I had an unpleasant experience regarding one of the maids who cleaned my room. Needless to say, I was made to feel like it was my fault and the hotel had no responsibility. I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms Need a Reno Bad. Casino Needs New Carpet”
Reviews.Author: Kevin999999
Reviews.Content: I managed to score a room for $39 from a travel site for a Saturday night that included breakfast. For that rate it is really hard to complain, however the room needed a renovation at least 10 years ago and although clean, it felt dirty due to its age. I stayed in room 1841. Looking at the room, it was last reno'd in the eighties. The carpet was very soiled and had stretch bumps. The pictures had those brass frames. The lamp was brass. The furniture had a ton of dings and needs to be replaced. The mattress expired about 3 years ago. You could feel the springs and it had bad depressions. About the only thing that was touched in this room since 1984 was the water saving shower head. The casino seemed pleasant and inviting, but the carpet was disgusting. It needs to be replaced... but it also appears that they never shampoo it. If you look in some corners where there is no foot traffic, you can see the original color. I love the downtown. I have stayed at the Golden Nugget and the Four Queens previously. I was really hoping that Fitzgeralds would have been good enough for me to book again in the future if I wanted a budget room downtown. Unless they reno the rooms and replace the casino carpet, I am not going back... Even if I get a free room offer from the Players Club. FYI - The free breakfast was awesome. 2 eggs, 3 strips of bacon, potatoes and toast. No beverage.

Reviews.Title: “This is where we always stay:)”
Reviews.Author: VegasGal1220
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome. $2 blackjack 24/7, we just love Fremont Street. Great desert view, great pool area, cheap but filling breakfast($2 for eggs, potatoes, and toast), and friendly staff. Never have had a problem in the 5 times we have stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints for the 2nd time”
Reviews.Author: MPLSguy78
Reviews.Content: We travel to Vegas over the 4th of July. This was my second stay at the Fitz. Here are the goods and bads. Goods- First, price. Both the hotel and food options are very inexpensive. There is a store across Fremont St that make drink purchase cheap as well as some food. The Mc Donalds in the hotel is also a cheap choice. The hotel staff are nice and the room was clean. I have stayed at a bunch of Vegas hotels and not one of the them have been perfect when it comes to being clean. The casino and Fremont street makes for fun people watching but watch your stuff, there are a lot of homeless people at night looking for any opportunity. We actually had a very intoxicated homeless guy ask to share our drink with him. The pool area is small but there is no loud music and we pretty much had the pool to ourselves with no kids splashing. You can also bring your drinks in there (No glass). Most of the pools on the strip search your bags and allow no drinks. Then you must buy one of there drinks for $10 and up. Bad- smoky casino, basic room with hard beds, and not much nightlife on Fremont other than gambling. We try and stay one or two nights downtown and then 2 nights on the strip, to mix things up. If you take a shuttle make sure they know you are coming downtown, our driver first said $6, then it jumped to $9 once we got there. One side note- This is the second time we came to Vegas for a big fireworks display (other was 2009 New Years) and waiting on the strip, there was no fireworks of anykind from any of the $$Billion$$ dollar casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Losing Favor - I think.”
Reviews.Author: goingblonde
Reviews.Content: We have always stayed at theFitz when we are staying downtown. With the exception of a few months ago we stayed at the GN for the pool theyhave. The Fitz is old , like all downtown hotels and i i exepct all older hotels like the Fitz to be a bit worse for wear and for the price have never had a complaint. This time i was very disapointed because they have always had coffee makers in the room but now they do not. No room service either to order coffee. So in the morning have to get dressed and go for coffee and this has always been a big pet peeve for me. The bathroom looked like ti hadnt had a GOOD COMPLETE cleaning in months. The floor you coud see where it had dirty areas that i know would come off with a mopping. Do i expect them to mop the floor everyday ? heck no- i expect them to mop when needed though. For the price we paid i dont expect shiny But do expect clean. With no coffee makers now either i dont know if we will continue to stay there. On the other hand not many hotels seeem to have coffee makers these days , i have heard from people other places that once had them no onger do. i recommend it if the coffee factor doesnt bother you and you dont check out the floors like i do L.O.L

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: chaffs
Reviews.Content: We stayed mid week, and Fitz's is great value for money, located downtown by the freemont experance with buses to the strip nearby, Rooms are a little old and noisy,Free wifi and parking

Reviews.Title: “Not that Bad...”
Reviews.Author: Simaurien
Reviews.Content: The Fitz wasn't that bad overall. It's right on Fremont street, so lots to do and see. The hotel itself was decent, but definitely needs new carpet. I've read on here that the elevators needed work. I think they got that all figured out. They are like rockets now, actually scared my little ones when going up or down. (we were on the the 20th floor) The beds were ok, double bed room and one bed was much newer and plush than the other bed in the same room. Bathrooms were clean, but the toilet would run for a few minutes after you flused it. Lots of parking, but you have to share with the regular guests to the casino that were not staying there so on the weekend nights we'd have to valet because no spaces left. Valets are not the nicest people. McDonalds right down stairs so, made breakfast really easy. Overall, it was a decent hotel for the price. Would put on the list of 'can do' hotels.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price, but the rooms could be better.”
Reviews.Author: Deal405
Reviews.Content: My first time staying in downtown Vegas and if this is the best they have to offer, I don't think that I will be doing it again. On the bright side, this hotel had pretty decent food and a few breathtaking blackjack dealers. However, the rooms left PLENTY to be desired! I've stayed in cheap local motels that were both cleaner and more comfortable than this one. Its ok if you're on a budget or for older travelers looking to avoid the strip, just don't expect too much.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Deep in the hot of Texas
Reviews.Title: “Not fancy but a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SpinyNorma
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to stay at the Fitz. I'd heard mixed reviews so I was kind of holding my breath a little but I had a good offer (buy one night/stay one free) so I decided to give it a try. I'm really glad that I did. It's nothing fancy but it was clean and comfortable and the staff was some of the friendliest and most helpful that I've ever come across. The closest I have to a downside is that the furniture in my room was a little worn but it was still servicable. I can live with a little worn. A friend of mine was staying there the same weekend and her furniture looked newer and in better shape. Maybe they save the better stuff for the nonsmoking rooms. It wasn't a problem for me as everything was comfortable and worked fine. I had heard bad things about the elevators there but they've apparently fixed any problem there used to be with them. My room was on a high floor and I never had any problem with them arriving or getting me to my floor in a timely manner. I was there on Friday and Saturday so the elevators got plenty of use and I had no complaints at all. Another thing I really liked about the hotel is that it was really easy to find your way around. When I did have any questions, the staff was always helpful and cheerful. You'd never guess that they'd probably answered the same questions umpteen times that shift. The staff were some of the nicest and most helpful I've met in Vegas. I would recommend the Fitz to a friend in a heartbeat and I'm really looking forward to staying there again the next time I go downtown. This is the third downtown hotel I've stayed at (I also stayed at the California and the Fremont on previous trips) and it's my favorite so far. As I said, it's not fancy but if fancy isn't a priority, give them a try. They're also very generous to low-rolling players.

Reviews.Title: “bad hotel,bad customer service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: slkdog33
Reviews.Content: where do I start?We did not arrive until 11:50.We get in line and their computers are down.After 15 minutes it's check in time.I had a king bed room requested.We arrived late so they say all that's left is a 2 double bed room.Why do they even ask you what your preference is?We were not happy,but yes we did arrive late.I asked the lady at check in what we could do in the morning to switch to a king bed.She said call down before noon.No problem.I get up at 7:30 am and yes I call down to front desk.A man answers the line.I said we checked in late last night,there was no king beds left,we would like to switch rooms.Thats when this very rude man got loud and said sir you requested a king room,you did not reserve one,we are sold out this whole weekend,no you can not switch rooms.I said very rudely back "are you telling me that out of all 35 floors of guests,nobody is checking out today"He said no.Well I decided to go to front desk and stand there while guests were checking out.Out of the six people I talked to,5 of them were checking out of a king room.Wow am I pissed off now.If you think I was upset,my wife was really upset.I finally cool off and did not persue it any further. ROOM Yes my blanket did have a cigarette burn whole in it.Did I say any thing. no.The beds were hard as a rock.there were 2 shower towels in the bathroom.I'd say they were more like half of a towel. Restaurant Our room had some coupons so on our last day,we decide to use 1.It was $2 off meal at the grill.We arrive there at 10:55 am in our seat at 10:57 am.Order our drinks at 11:15 am.Order our food at 11:20.am.we waited til 11:50 am and still no appetizer or food.We had to catch a plane,so we left.I slammed down $6 for our sodas at the cashiers table and said we are out of here.by no means was it crowded at all. Will we ever stay here again.Noooo.not even if they pay me.If that jerk would not have been so rude.may be.to me there was no reason they could not have switched us rooms.screw them.Normally I would have caused a scene,but we did not want to get booted out and have no where to stay.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: nicoleGoodyear_Az
Reviews.Content: My husbad and I stayed at the Fitz once before (a couple years ago) when we were attending an event that they were having downtown. We were not impressed with it, but did not have any "real" issues either. This time it was horrible! Booked one night thru Vegas.com and had prepaid. We were also spending the next two nights at the Rio, which is WONDERFUL! Drove from AZ on a Thursday night and did not arrive at the Fitz until 11:30pm! We woke up the next morning and I wasnt feeling very well (and no, not from drinking, just SICK!). My husband went downstairs to bring some breakfast up to the room. I tried to eat and felt even sicker! Check out time was noon and it was quickly approaching. I was feeling dizzy, sick and just out of sorts! At approximately 11:30 my husband called front desk to see if they had a nurse on staff who could suggest something for me to take, or at least check vitals, etc. to see if I required a trip to the ER? They sent up an EMT, who was just a security guard. He spoke with me and told me that they could give me the name of a doctor that was on call or go to Walgreens and ask the pharmacist if I could take anything. I just felt like I was going to DIE and told him that I just needed to lay down for a little while and we had to check out. Security guard said it should be no problem for a late checkout, just call the front desk. My husband called and argued with the clerk and then the manager on duty. He merely asked if we could have a late check out, maybe 2 hours or so? They told him that they were fully booked and could not do so. Explained to them that security was up in the room and wife is very ill. After arguing that they had no rooms, they told him that we could stay for a full nights rate which was $90. For a late checkout??? We just checked into the room 12 hours prior! And besides, we had a prepaid room at the Rio for 2 nights, just felt so bad could not get in the car and drive over there at the "moment". They were HORRIBLE to deal with. Have never had a hotel treat me with such little compassion. Will NEVER stay there again and would not recommend it for anyone else either. The rooms are about what you pay for condition wise. But the service is horrible. There are plenty of other reasonable hotels downtown if that is where you are looking to stay.

Reviews.Title: “love the fitz”
Reviews.Author: articwolf
Reviews.Content: spent 5 days at the fitz and not one complaint.-was worried about reviews of slow elevators as i like upper floors for the view .they just installed 4 new elevators in jan and i never waited more then 30 seconds for 1 from the 21st floor .my wife loved the $2 black jack and i was happy when they had 50 cent roulette -good freebees to steal in the bathrooms every day and step out the door to freemont street to a live band every night and the freemont dome and the lights .my second trip to stay at freemont but not my last -this was 12th trip to vegas and freemont is where the fun is -if you want to help steve wynn pay for his billion dollar hotels the stay and play on the strip -nice tight machines there and lots of employees with sticks up there butts .rent a car and get off the strip -so much more freedom and places to see and its about 25 bucks a day -go for dinner at jimmy buffets margeritaville -you wont know where to look so much going on and the biggest plate of nachos ive ever seen as recomended by vegas.com

Reviews.Title: “Spend the extra money to avoid the Fitzgerald”
Reviews.Author: newshoesModesto
Reviews.Content: Our trip began with a walk down a hallway that reaked of smoke. Upon entering the room we realized the bathroom hadn't been cleaned between us and the last guests. The shower was a complete joke. We had a difficult time balancing the temperature of the water between scalding hot and freezing cold. I thought I had chosen a bad time to shower the first time. I realized I was wrong when it happened for the next three days. The bed spreads were faded and outdated. The rooms didn't have a coffee maker, nor does the Fitzgerald offer room service; so we had to treck downstairs every morning for a cup of coffee. The Casino was hot and uncomfortable most of the time. On top of everything else we had to pay a ridiculous fee to use the computer in the "Business Center" just to check into our flight. The only bright spot was that they had a McDonald's in the Casino. I think the Fitz has danced it's last dance and should hang up it's dancing shoes.

Reviews.Title: “A great deal!!”
Reviews.Author: Conwayluvs2travel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fitz for two nights. The room is older but it was clean. We had a smoking room and it did really smell of smoke but what smoking room doesn't? The only complaints that I have about the Fitz is that the water pressure in the shower is really bad and you could hear people talking from the neighboring rooms but that would not stop me from staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “pleasently surprised”
Reviews.Author: rehman9
Reviews.Content: arrived early so we were not sure if we could get in a room right away. They had a king smoking room available right away. I was a little hesitant as I prefered a non smoking room. Decided to take it as it could be 3pm before a non smoking may be ready. It was a corner room on the 14th floor. Window looked down on fremont st. ans stage. It had a slight smoking smell but was not as bad as some I have had. Decided to keep the room for the vacation. Had a nice whirlpool tub, large bathroom, table and chairs, sitting chair, and a loveseat. Room was quiet even though it was above fremont street and stage. Everyone was very friendly. We were able to get late check out with out any added charges. I plan on staying again when I visit Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Downtown - NO MORE free coffee”
Reviews.Author: KerrMudgeon
Reviews.Content: Got a 3 night comped stay for 4/15/10 to 4/17, based on past club card play (hit a $2,000 royal flush in the upstairs casino). My experience is for a comped room, and might not apply to rooms for "full-pay" guests. When I called Reservations, they couldn't confirm a "smoking" room two weeks in advance; said it depended on availability when I checked in; said they were removing all the coffee makers from the rooms = no more free coffee; said refrigerators are available, but only with a note from a doctor. At check-in, got a smoking-allowed room on the 17th floor, after rejecting one on the 3rd floor, above the (noisy) Fremont Street Experience. Brought my own $10 coffee maker, bought at Walgreens Drugstore, downtown, last year. Room was OK. Bathroom had a long Formica counter and a large mirror. Lavatory faucets were confusingly "symmetrical": Turn HOT handle counter-clockwise to water ON, but turn COLD handle clockwise to turn ON. No stoppers in the sink or in the bathtub; use washcloths to plug the drains - and be careful not to drop rings, toothpaste caps, etc. down the drains. Free shampoo & body lotion was in squeeze bottles = handy to use. Two soaps supplied: "honey" face bar & "vanilla" bath bar; both are decent-sized, much bigger than the little discs at the Vegas Club & the Plaza. The bed was comfortable. The TV was the used-to-be-standard large tube-type, housed in a cabinet; there were 30+ channels, including more variety than some other downtown hotels. There was a free wall safe with a key lock; don't lose the key! In the casino, all the employees were helpful, but the card club booth was always jammed-up with customers when I wanted to check on my points, etc. I will gamble here again, but I was disappointed that my comped room had no coffee maker and no refrigerator; maybe I'll go back to the Four Queens next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Not Fancy but clean”
Reviews.Author: jjJRFAN88
Reviews.Content: I was a little afraid to stay here because of some of the reviews. But went ahead and booked. We stayed in room 817 the room was clean but was not fancy. If you are looking for Fancy you need to go spend 150.00 to 300.00 then you will get fancy. But my room was 23.00 a night and it was worth it. This was my first time to Vegas and downtown was awsome. I want a nice clean room to sleep in. Who sleep when they are in Vegas LOL. We stayed Mar. 24 and 25 2010

Reviews.Title: “great view for a great price”
Reviews.Author: MoonRiverRoundhead
Reviews.Content: This tower hotel goes up at least 25 stories and the windows while not floor to ceiling are still very large and I love looking out at the desert which is why this is my favorite hotel in vegas. The price can't be beat, and I personally prefer the downtown fremont st. location where you can easily walk to other casinos and enjoy the fremont st light show to the strip, where the hotels are miles apart. Don't expect the rooms to be as nice as mandalay bay on the strip, but then you won't be paying the higher price either.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Vegas Trip Ever”
Reviews.Author: Craps_player2010
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to the Fitz for years and was treated nicely by the staff. That was until March 12. I called my casino host for availability of a room and was told by Nicole" We have plenty of rooms, call back and let me know how many night I would be staying." I was also told she would take care of the room. I called back 3 times on my way from San Diego to Vegas and got no return call. I went to check in and only 1 no smoking room. It was right next to the elevator, noisy, dirty, and the bed springs were popping through the mattress. I know it is an older hotel, but I have never been a worse room ever. On top of it all, I paid $80+ dollars for this room and found out I could have stayed at the Rio for less money. Final insult was when I calmly told Nicole that for the lack of a return call and paying $80 for a terrible room, she spoke very rudely instead of offering an apology. I will not return as a guest.

Reviews.Title: “What a fun place to stay while downtown!”
Reviews.Author: btlifes2short
Reviews.Content: Really had a ball staying here. It's not 4-star by any means but the staff and rooms were just fine. "Great Service Awards go to: "Theo" who is with the gaming tables. A wonderful ambassador for Fitz's! "Shannon" on the craps table who has the best smile and attitude. And finally Patrick on the craps table. I found out that Patrick is the grandfather of a good friend of mines son! Keep up the great job all of you, we WILL be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fine”
Reviews.Author: WISCONSINCOUPLE
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the fitz feb. 20-24 .Had a great time.Super value $23 per night sun-tue.I4vegas.com.Clean, basic rooms.Elevators worked well.Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fitzgeralds is what they claim to be-2 1/2 stars and treated us well”
Reviews.Author: LetMeGetMySuitcase
Reviews.Content: We had one heck of a time getting out of Ohio for Las Vegas Trip, due to cancelled Atlanta flights. We had move our scheduled days of departure/arrival by 1 day. Our rooms were comped through an offer we received in the mail, along with a few other perks..so we were concerned about calling to request a date change. No need. My husband called, and they had no problem changing the dates. It was simple..took about 2 minutes on the phone with friendly staff. We had to rent a car from Los Angeles to drive into Las Vegas..not our original plan by any means..but we got there. We had read about the tight squeeze in the parking garage..but as we located the Fitz, there was an easily spotted sign for valet parking..sweet! Worked like a charm. Friendly guy and took care of the car. Returned in the shape we gave it to them in! Couple of dollars later, we are at the check in desk. Also friendly easy service. Got our room with no wait at about 7:30 pm on 02/14. Gave us additional coupons to use at checkin, which we did use several. Upon checkout, room was exactly as they said..free. No resort type fees at all. Sent us off with a thank you and hope we had a nice stay. We were given the comped room on the 7th floor. It was average, as expected. The elevators, the entire stay, were Zero problems. Had read here previously that they were slow. We entered our room and it was older furniture but not tore up completely as some would say. The bathroom fixtures older, yes..but funtional. Large vanity sink area, which we like, Low flow shower head in a tub/shower combo. Yes, it was older staining but I would not say it was dirty. It was over time built up. No fan in bathroom, just the slats things in the wall above the toilet. Towels, washclothes provided were clean though not "plush"..but again, usable. Provided toiletries and kleenex and plastic glasses along with ice bucket. No coffeemaker as stated on website. If we had called down, we may have gotten 1. We travel with a small 4 cupper anyway, so to us, it was not a problem. In room safe worked fine. Located in closet with hangers, ironing board/iron. There was a full length mirror on bathroom door, which is much appreciated and NOT supplied in a lot of casino hotels we have stayed in. Large vanity mirror as well along with working hairdryer. Since we only had been there 1 night for a short period of time, we did not require room service the first day but did tip the gal in the hall, replaced towels ourselves and some plastic cups from her cart. Had her cross off our room, as we could not find a do not disturb sign for the door. We left our bathroom belongings out in the bathroom, tidied up the rest, locked up valuables and never had 1 single problem. We did use housekeeping the other days of the stay. Left a tip on nightstand each time and was thanked by staff when we they saw us. Room was done way before noon each time, (we transfered to strip hotel morning of 02/17) Yes, TV was older but worked fine. We were placed on 7th floor. No view really. BUT I could easliy see the digital clock with time and temp each morning at casino down the road...that was nice! The main dresser only had 2 top drawers with a wood panel that ran along the bottom where, my guess would be, broken drawrs had been removed and recovered with wood panel. The room we received was located on the side street near a concert stage. We could look to the right and see the top of canopy. Yes, it was loud. Thunderously loud when the Canopy played its screen..but that is to be expected. We were right right beside it. There was also a band playing till 11 or maybe even midnight..beside us and it too, was loud. We were in room first and second evening before those were done..early nights, and I can imagine that some people could not sleep with that going on. We, however were so exhausted the first night- the bomb going off outside the window..did not keep us awake, or wake us. I would have to say the same the second night. We turned TV up a notch as it went on..to hear the words coming from there but it IS LAS VEGAS and it can be loud anywhere. We were not high enough to avoid the noise..so I can not say that you can't hear it further up. The bed was good. Not bad at all. Pillows..flat. Our room was 2 dble beds. No king available they said. We used the pillows from that bed too and it was fine. The casino restaurants were also fine that we used. We ate breakfast at the Courtyard grill. They had a 1.99- 2 eggs, hashbrowns and toast. They also offered 4.99 steak, hasbrowns and toast with 2 eggs. (You could order bacon or sausage for 1.99 to any meal) Service was fine, food was fine..it was not dirty. We did not get to eat at DonB's steakhouse, which we regret. We had wanted to try it- and there were discounts offers given to us as well. We did use the McDonalds one morning for a breakfast to go while playing a few slots to get the morning started. Ate from the 1$ menu. We played some fun slots. Upstairs there is cash in/cash out. Thats fine..except mine ran out of nickles..and was trying get 15.00 out. Had to wait quite some time for service as the man was alone..and working with another patron, He wasn't thilled about it, slightly stressed I would say, but he did speak to us..was just trying to get his job done and move on to the next machine in need. We tried keno for the first time. We won 2.00. Used the coupon offered to us..lost 18.00 of the 20.00 but have an understanding of the game now. Bell desk was helpful to us twice. We had to return rental car to the strip the first morning and he was trying to see closest place to return the car. Then, when we were checking out, they arranged a Towncar service for us thru Exotic Limo..that got us to NYNY..without having to use a cab. (40.00 to NYNY with SUV that arrived to take us, nice driver, safe!) We used the Players desk several time and had a lovely woman, tiny- wait on us each time. We got a free shotglass with our points! Each got 5.00 play, I think..or cash, don't remember really. She was very sweet and we enjoyed her alot. Actually seemed to like her job! Gaming was OK. I didn't win big bunches but did play for a while on what I put in. My husband played 3.00 craps tables..about the same. Enjoyed some of the slots himself. I don't think we ever saw his favorite slot there- Fireball, but he found some others to keep him occupied while waiting for me in the mornings. We did both eat and drink at the Vue bar on the second floor, twice. We used a 241 appetizer coupon we had, and all the dollar drink coupons, or 241's they gave us. We sat outside for a bit the first night and watched the street below us. The food was OK..didn't rave but good. Had chx ranch flatbread pizza and chx fingers with veggies. We split each and for 8.95 or so total for both- enjoyed the TV and people watching..Bartender was a funny guy first night. I would say our stay here was just fine. The hallways were clean to our room. Carpets were not dirty in our room and had been vacuumed. We had no problem sleeping, or problems with bed bugs at all....walked on carpet in socked feet without worrying. We are average folks that stayed at an average hotel and had a fun time! Service and amenities offered were fine. Location was good on Fremont street. We could eat, drink and be merry!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: BeverlyW4
Reviews.Content: We had such a good time, will stay there again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “GO FOR IT! Value for your money! I'll never stay on the strip again!”
Reviews.Author: DiveDude69
Reviews.Content: Wow! In the heart of Vegas, on Fremont street. Yes the Fitz's is older, has some wear and tear as would be expected. Clean comfy beds. good size rooms. Staff I dealt with was great. If you want value for your money and a great area to stay in, stay here! I read reviews that say petty things like burn marks in the rug or worn out hotel..... yup! Kind of like my house...... but I'm not replacing my rug because of one mistake, so I don't expect them to ....but it's clean, friendly and almost homey. I will never stay on the strip again............. On the strip you walk for miles just to get to your room or the street. At the Fitz's you have 6 casino's in 3 blocks. A 1 star price for a 3 star hotel

Reviews.Title: “great downtown hotel situated bang on freemont street”
Reviews.Author: jimcumming
Reviews.Content: would certainly stay here again, room fine, casino fine , food outlets adequate, staff good. Large room with two double beds and a good size TV. Swimming pool in the car park , was a bit unusual but it's only a short walk to the Golden Nugget's pool. Free Wireless in the doughnut cafe on Freemont Street side of the hotel. Handy for shops, casinos, bus stops and Hogs and Heifers

Reviews.Title: “Basic accommodations, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: roundcat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Fitzgerald's for one Saturday night so I could inexpensively add an extra day onto my trip. It served its purpose well, and since I wasn't expecting much I wasn't disappointed. The room was like a basic, somewhat outdated-looking motel room with ugly decor. I have a personal aversion to oak furnishings, but if you don't, maybe you'll like it just fine. The person who checked me in was very nice and it was late so there was no line. The room was mostly clean except for a few hairs in the bathroom. After some extra wiping I even dared take a bath in the tub. The carpet looked a little worn and had a cigarette burn in it, but nothing was too offensive. There was a little peeling of wallpaper around the edges, but hey, it's an older hotel. The bed was clean and comfortable. I didn't use the free breakfast coupon but it's good not for your choice of breakfast, but for a very specific item (which I believe includes eggs, breakfast potatoes of some kind, and choice of sausage or bacon). The casino is run of the mill for downtown casinos -- again, nothing special. I moved to the Golden Nugget for the remainder of my stay (this move was planned in advance and not any kind of function of my like or dislike of Fitzgerald's), and there's a big difference between the two hotels. Fitzgerald's is pretty much just another rundown downtown hotel, but the Nugget is NICE. Casino is nice, pool with shark tank is sweet, and I arranged for an upgraded room which is nothing short of plush. My new favorite hotel is the Golden Nugget! But back on track, there's nothing really wrong with Fitzgerald's, especially if you don't plan to spend a lot of time in the room. I wouldn't recommend it but wouldn't tell you to run away screaming either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay Downtown”
Reviews.Author: glang98
Reviews.Content: We always stay at Fitzgeralds downtown Las Vegas.The rooms are really nice and we had a view of Vegas which was really enjoyable to look at at night..The price was good and we got to see the light shows which were awesome...You can still go to the strip in the daytime and see the light shows at night and be right at your hotel...The other entertainment at night around the hotel was also awesome. We would recommend staying here anytime...

Reviews.Title: “Best value downtown”
Reviews.Author: badscene21
Reviews.Content: The fitz is by far the best value downtown. The newer cabana rooms at the el cortez are a very close 2nd. I've stayed at all the casinos on fremont and they all have issues. The fitz is old and you are paying between free and $50 a night, what do you expect. I love the location and the staff. If you have a problem they always fix it (within reason). Vegas is a place to drink and have fun, it seems like a lot of the reviews on here are by people who don't know how to loosen up.

Reviews.Title: “Another awesome New Years”
Reviews.Author: KimInCali
Reviews.Content: I've been going to the Fitz for over 7 years now and it still does not dissapoint. I am now a VIP member so it just gets better. As usual they offered a great New Year package, three free nights, free drinks at hotel bar all weekend and free wristbands for the concerts. Add great comp points and we had free meals all weekend too. We were given one of their great corner rooms which has wrap around windows and views of the Freemont Street and a bit larger than other rooms. It was clean and had all the ameneties. Cleaning staff was great and left some hats for us to wear for New Years Eve. We decided to try the Don B's Steak house even though it was new years eve and most had reservations. They fit us in right away and the meal was terrific! HUGE steak, friendly staff and it came with a free appetizer coupon. As always the staff is great and the gaming was wonderful. I've stayed at several downtown hotels and the Fitz is still my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again....”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoBikermama
Reviews.Content: We were in Las Vegas for my oldest son's wedding. Booked Fitgeralds thru hotels.com. Most of my family was not excited about my choice of hotel but after our stay they thanked me. All the staff was pleasant. The food was very good for the price. No problems with elevators ever and we were there over New Years. Would recommend it for the price and the location. So easy to get most anything you need within a block. One negative is the cigarette smell.......pretty bad.

Reviews.Title: “second time , better then first”
Reviews.Author: goingblonde
Reviews.Content: we had stayed here before and i was a bit disapointed. since then we have stayed at 4 queens--this time we had an offer for the free daily breakfast and sine it wasnt horribl the fisr time and the rates were better then 4 queens we treid it again.
