The check in lady was exceptinally nice, the room was clean --as with the first time the bathtub faucet is so hard to turn off. i just think the place has not that great plumbing in general , but we had no catastrope's- with it until i flused the toilet our last day there and water sprayed everywhere--the little hose thing had came off so myhusband just put it back on--and i guess that can happen anywhwere anyway. i would say if you are staying dwontown and dont want fancy stay here but not if the room is more then 30 we paid 29 and i would not ever want to pay more then that. but unless you stya at the golden nugget i odnt believe you will find an exceptional room anywhere they are allold-out dated and that is just the way downtown is---go tothe strip if you cant handle "Old" anything.. The casino cashier cage on the 2nd floor was closed the whole time we were there whch was 6 days--that made it in conveinant if you wanted to cash in money -you had to go down tot he first floor. the cocktail waitresses ingeneral were nice and compared to Bininions were a dream-haha

Reviews.Title: “Still a great deal”
Reviews.Author: Lafayette_GAPossum
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visit Las Vegas at least once a year and we always stay at the Fitz for at least four or five days. The service was excellent, the food was very good, the casino is very good. The room, although a little worn, was quite adequate for our needs. The maids were outstanding. We stayed on the thirty-third floor and the view at night was spectacular. The Fitz is still the best deal downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Fitzgeralds a good value”
Reviews.Author: TheLoneTraveler
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a four night stay at Fitzgeralds and had a good time there. I had absolutely no problems with the elevators at any time during my stay (I think my longest wait was maybe 30 seconds and I was staying on the 19th floor). The room was quiet, clean, with a wall safe, and a coffeemaker. Housekeeping was very good. The only negative I had (and this is probably just a matter of personal preference) was that I felt the bed was much too firm. Check-in and check-out were very fast and easy and I would recommend the hotel to anyone wanting an inexpensive place to stay in downtown Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: AudreyW2
Reviews.Content: This was the best 3 days. I had so much here with my husband. my favorite was seeing Celine Dion she is so awesome and her store just as awesome as she . There was lots we done in this short trip. lots wanted to do. another of my favorite was riding thier transit system. even got off the bus in wrong area of town andhad to walk about 2 miles through drug invested and ruins, but reminded me of Chicago then. when we first go to vegas. It was easy enough to find every thing though. I couldnt believe people was smoking their dope right in front of the police there too. that was bad. but love it.

Reviews.Title: “It is about the same as other places downtown”
Reviews.Author: cogite
Reviews.Content: We have family that live in Las Vegas and we come from California to spend Thanksgiving, Christmas, Birthdays, etc. We stay downtown because it is more convenient to get to where the relatives are than staying on the Strip. We have stayed at the Four Queens, Golden Nugget, El Cortez and for the first time this trip at Fitzgerald's. Fitzgeralds is about the same as the other places. The beds were firm, which I liked. The shower faucet leaked. It was pretty clean--not spotless. There was some issue with the elevators, as they all seemed to be at the the same place at the same time. All up on the 33rd floor, then all down at the Lobby. Can not comment on the parking, as I used the valet. We paid a total of $101 for three nights, including a Friday night over Thanksgiving. So the price was right. Booked through Expedia-prepaid.

Reviews.Title: “broken elevators were the least of our concerns”
Reviews.Author: pennygreen
Reviews.Content: We booked the Fitz because it was close to the Fremont Experience and had a breakfast deal. However, we had no idea what a mess the place was. Thankfully we have a VW beetle, otherwise, I'm not sure we would have fit in the covered parking. The turns were really tight! We finally found a spot on the 8th floor, only to discover that the elevators were broken and we had to trudge all of our stuff down all those stairs. The reception staff was less than apologetic. They never even said sorry. We booked a non-smoking room, but when we arrived, they only had smoking left. Again, no apologies. Once we were in the room, our first impression was better than the second. The music from Fremont street was so loud in the room! And that continued until midnight. But our second impression was much worse than that. A trip to the bathroom led to horror! The sink was full of vomit!!!! We immediately called housekeeping and then started calling around for another room in a different hotel, but it was too late by that time. We were stuck in the Fitz! An hour of terrible sounds later, the vomit was gone and we were left to sleep in the very uncomfortable beds. The next morning, it took almost 45 minutes waiting in line to get our "free breakfast" which cost $12 for drinks and tip. Also the pool, which is a postage stamp on the corner next to traffic, was FREEZING!! Never again!!

Reviews.Title: “For the Price You Can't Complain”
Reviews.Author: lucky7Alberta
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through I4 Vegas for 5 nights for a total cost $230.00 Canadian. Too good of a deal to pass up. I was also concerned about the reviews and talked to I4 about our options before we left Alberta. However, we did not need to worry about. We had an early flight and so arrived well before check in. The very nice gentleman at the front desk offered us a room on the 25th floor or we could wait for something lower. We chose to take the room. We had two doubles and the room was quite ordinary except for the fact that the carpets were quite stained. This really didn't bother us too much as we don't spend much time in the room and head their only to sleep. The beds were comfortable and the linens were fresh. We tipped the maid a few dollars each day and she kept our room spotless. Thanks Bok. As for the elevator situation, there were three and sometimes only two elevators working. It was a bit more of a wait on the weekend when the hotel was busiest but I don't think I had to wait more than 5 minutes for an elevator. I didn't find the elevators as much of a problem as the patrons. If there were a lot of people waiting, the rude tourists would almost push people out of the way to get on, instead of waiting their turn for the next elevator. One time I came up behind two older ladies, one with an oxygen tank on a cart. They were first in line and I was next but several people pushed their way on before this poor women who had to manuever her tank around them. Such rudeness I don't understand. I think if people would be more civil there would be less complaints about the elevators. We enjoyed the casino and the cocktail waitresses were pleasant and came around as much as I wanted them too. If you are looking for a nice budget hotel for a good price I think you would find Fitzgeralds a suitable hotel. If you want a 4 star hotel for a budget price this hotel is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Not awful, but a hard place to recommend”
Reviews.Author: camera7
Reviews.Content: I booked a super cheap rate months ago at hotels.com and thought about changing to a better hotel many times as the date of our trip approached. In the end I stuck with my Fitzgeralds reservation with the thought that the money saved would be used for food and games. Now home after 4 nights in LV, I'm having a hard time deciding if I can recommend the Fitz even for the low, low nightly rate. Our room was on a floor that had been remodeled recently. Well, the halls had been remodeled and looked very nice. Seeing that, I was really optimistic about the place until I opened the door to our room. Our guest room had 2 double beds, an armoire, dresser and a nightstand. The "wooden" furniture looked a little like the kind of thing you buy at Target and put together. Not bad, but fairly cheap looking. The beds were on the low end of acceptability. The TV had a decent selection of channels and good picture. The bathtub faucet leaked continuously and looked a little worn. The A/C worked fine but was a little loud. The overall effect of the room was one of advancing age and wear. One of my biggest concerns was the elevators. I had heard of a history of long delays waiting for an elevator and how this was now less of a problem since some of the elevators had been replaced, I'm sorry to say that it is still a problem when the hotel gets busy. Sunday morning I waited 15 minutes for a down elevator before giving up and taking an up elevator and riding back down. That is really unacceptable. I did not eat in the Fitz but ate at the Four Queens and Fremont which are steps away from the Fitz, Everyone I met at the Fitz who talked about the condition of the hotel said something like "well, for the money it's okay." Personally, if I had it to do over again I'd spend another $10 -15 a night for the Fremont of 4 Queens. For that I'd get a better bed, elevators that worked and in hotel restaurants that I am willing to eat in. The best part of the Fitz was the valet service. It was exceptional and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, accommodating Frontdesk, great location, most affordable”
Reviews.Author: agtours
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, accommodating Frontdesk, great location, most affordable

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value in downtown Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ohtrips
Reviews.Content: Fitzgeralds offers a great location (center of Freemont Street) and value in downtown Las Vegas. The room was clean and the hotel in general was clean. The on-site restaraunt was another great value! On-site free parking was average.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your own Lysol...”
Reviews.Author: nytwinsnut
Reviews.Content: The location is awesome... right on Freemont experience. The casino actually has good action. 6 deck BJ with a big rail for spectators, roullette and a decent poker room (but there are way better in downtown). They do smoke there... so that's the first clue of the cleanliness factor. I've been here twice (the first was obviously better) and each time there were questions from our group about the shower, toilet, TV and overall cleanliness of the room... Non smoking means, well, you didn't smoke there. The staff was more than quick to tell us about comps which is good, but all but unresponsive when you ask for basic things like towels, let alone a leaky faucet. There was one reeeeaally bright spot... the breakfast buffet is solid and you can probably get it comped with 2 hours at a floor table. Another push is the price... but the value is strained. We paid $89 a night with free transportation to and from the airport. If these things are things you don't mind, have at it... but don't have any expectations about this being big time vegas...

Reviews.Title: “Fleas fleas and more fleas oh my”
Reviews.Author: star8527
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas a bunch of times I usually stay at the Queens. This time I went to Vegas with my sister Oct 17th threw the 21st. The first three nights my sister complained of being itchy and she had all these red bites all over her legs.That night she saw fleas. The next morning I was on the phone with my husband and two jumped on my sock that was it. Her legs had bites all over them. We went down to get another room and they sent us to the security guard to file a complaint. This guy was a complete moron. He took pictures of my sisters legs and asked the stupidest questions. I could tell by the way he was talking to us he didbn't believe us and thought we were making it up. If you saw my sisters legs you would understand how bad they were.We had to fill out this complaint you would of thought it was a police investiagtion. He wanted to come to our room to do an inspection. He rips all the bedding off and I told him by doing that you just threw them all over the room. The guy is an idiot and the hotel is a dump..But if by chance you do go there be weary of the wanna be cop with the bad acne and bad hair to go with it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and a great value!”
Reviews.Author: ibejumpin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fitzgerald during the Las Vegas Bikefest Weekend. Our room was clean and comfortable, and the hotel staff was courteous. The best food value was the "all you can eat" Soup & Salad bar for $5.99 per person. It included a drink and dessert. The only disappointment was the elevator situation. They are upgrading them and the elevators are very slow or fill up too quickly (10 people max). However, we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “bargain stay in a very comfortable place”
Reviews.Author: llittle
Reviews.Content: just got home from spending two nights at the fitz. was very happy with everything, nice large clean room, comfortable beds and helpful staff. hesitated staying due to some of the reviews i had read, apparently many of these people are looking for luxury hotels at bargain prices. for rates in the low $30 range i'll definitely be back. the staff was nice and helpful. i never had any problems with the elevators as some people must have had in the past. great food specials and quality in the coffee shop. the only thing is the parking garage may be a bit narrower than some of the newer ones, but it's free, or you van valet park.

Reviews.Title: “Best value and fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: PATTYMORE
Reviews.Content: We are always treated like we are celebrities at the Fitz. They are the BEST value for the money. Don B's steakhouse is excellent. The early bird special is the best value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location , Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Orilliacouple
Reviews.Content: We had read other reviews prior to staying here and some were negative but I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel for above average service , friendliness , cleanliness , value , location , swimming pool , we stayed on the 33 rd floor and had no trouble getting an elevator at anytime of day or night , front desk check in and check out was quick and easy , the location right outside the door to the Freemont experience is fantastic , you can also sit in the 2 nd floor bar outside and watch the action and the show . We will definetely stay here agasin on our next visit to " Lost Wages "

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: chukbud
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth stay at the Fitz. And once again our stay was great. The rooms are dated but clean and spacious. The elevators are a little slow,but it is a 38 story hotel so you have to expect a short wait. Having been there before, they have updated the elevators in the last 2 years. Check in was quick and helpful. Valet parking was easy and prompt. We ate in the Grill/buffet for several of our meals and it was great. Can,t beat the breakfast price. Our rooms were compted, so I can not speak for pricer rooms downtown. But if you want a good location and comfortable room downtown the Fitz has it all.

Reviews.Title: “if u don't want to spend a fortune”
Reviews.Author: boszibaba
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and normal size. The staff at the reception are not so nice. Our toilet broke, we couldn't flush it. It was pretty bad in the morning. But at least a guy came pretty fast and fixed it. There was no breakfast included, at least they said so.

Reviews.Title: “no problems”
Reviews.Author: nossaru
Reviews.Content: this is our ninth or so stay at the fitz,, and everything went just fine,, sure the rooms are a bit worn but who spends time in them in vegas. No issues with the elevators at all. Will return to the ftiz again. Great Trip

Reviews.Title: “Decent, nothing above that”
Reviews.Author: Johnzimbo
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 3 nights earlier this month, Sunday-Weds. Have stayed there before so I knew what to expect, and not much has changed. Check in was painless, room average as usual with a hard bed and old bathroom- both need upgrading. Did not have elevator issues but one of the four was out of order, might have been an issue during a busy weekend. One thing I disliked- on the second floor by the restaurant they have a whole wall dedicated to Obama. I prefer businesses/owners who keep their political beliefs to themself!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, No complaints!”
Reviews.Author: goatboy326
Reviews.Content: First let me apologize for the delay in posting my review. This review was from a trip that i took at the end of may. I've been going to Vegas for the past 4 years, I find that Vegas is still the most affordable place to take vacation. The entire package was just under $800 for three people, including round trip airfare, and 4 nights in the hotel. We stayed at the fitzgeralds, this is my second time staying there. The first trip was with my dad, and we a had wonderful time as well, so good that i booked this trip at the same hotel. The Fitzgeralds is an older hotel, as many of the downtown hotels are. The room quality is good, a little worn around the edges but not dirty. I've read many complaints about the elevators, there are signs posted stating that they are in the process of upgrading their elevators. We personally weren't affected by long wait times, or over crowding of the elevator cars. We stayed on the 17th floor, and never had to wait over 3 minutes for an elevator. The staff we encountered were all very friendly, polite and helpful. The only place we ate at the fitz was the McDonalds located next to the casino. The prices there were the same as home, and they had the dollar menu. We avoided the Fitz buffet because of the poor reviews, the Main Street Station and Fremont have very nice buffets. The room was very adequate for our needs, and served it's purpose well, we were never back to our room before midnight so noise from the Fremont experience wasn't an issue. The view wasn't spectacular, but did look out to the mountains, which was nice. The curtains are the very thick "Black-Out" type which is great when you end up getting in around sun-rise and need to power nap before hitting the town again :-D My overall experience with the Fitzgeralds was great, The only minor thing was the narrow paths in the parking garage, very little room to move if another car was coming, and the winding up to the 6th floor was a little dizzying, but then again it's a small garage, for a small hotel. They do have a pool, however we didn't make use of it, but did see it, it's not in the nicest location. The pool is right next to the rear access road, and is surrounded by 7foot tall concrete walls, looks like a pool cell more than a pool area, and the pool was a simple square shape, but the water was clean and blue so that's a good thing :-)

Reviews.Title: “Do NoT StaY HeRe”
Reviews.Author: soinluv74
Reviews.Content: i booked a reservation in advance for my husband and 2 co-workers and when they showed up at 2am after a 5 hour drive, staff told them that the reservation was NoT on file. Even after my husband showed them the receipt of a sucessful transaction, they still would not honor it! they even had the nerve to offer a new reservation at a higher rate!! they ended up sleeping in the truck since they had to be at work within a few hours. here's the WoRsT part... the next morning when i called to speak with the front desk's manager, i told her the situation and the long story she didn't even apologize for the HUGE inconveinience!! WoRsT SeRviCe EveR!!

Reviews.Title: “Everything is convenient at the Fitz”
Reviews.Author: inzane44
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Fitz last week July 26 -31. Check in was quick with no wait around 10:00PM. There was a flyer on the counter about the elevators being upgraded. but we encountered not one problem with them. At most we waited maybe 2 minutes. We were staing on the 17th floor. Breakfast came with our US Air package they give you your coupons at checkin. Breakfast was served extremely fast and consisted of bacon or sausage, eggs, homefries and toast and coffee. We used the pool after breakfast before it became too hot and noone was hardly ever there. We had the pool to ourselves and it was clean. It was kinda weird though walking outside the hotel past the valet parking entrance to get top the pool, but it was nice and not crowded. As far as the gambling goes I played a little BJ...nothing to heavy and walked away a small winner. Fremont St. was nice and don't miss Carl Ferris the sax player. If you're not trying to impress your girlfriend or have been married as long as I and can't impress the wife the Fitz should meet your needs. I liked the fact that everything was close and the layout was easy to figure out....not like some of the bigger hotels on the strip. Access the self-parking garage off 3rd and Carson....small sign says Fitz parking. If self parking wind up past the 6th floor. Although I didn't park across from the swimming pool behind Walgreen's I did see people parking there and it would be easier then winding up around the Fitz garage. Overall it was decent. Just don't expect a JW Marrriott !

Reviews.Title: “Slow, wobbly elevators”
Reviews.Author: TexasNan
Reviews.Content: I have been reading recent reviews of this hotel and, in most, it seems the staff at Fitz has been telling customers that the elevators were being upgraded. We stayed at the Fitz last Aug. 2008 and the elevators were supposedly being upgraded at that time. We had to wait a long time everytime we went to and from our rooms. The elevators jerked, wobbled and bounced. We took a risk each time we got on one because at times they seemed to free fall and then stop with a sudden jerk. They were scary. The rooms weren't the best but I don't go to Vegas to stay in my room. For the most part they were clean but worn and outdated. The beds were not that comfortable but the staff was overall friendly. Did not eat at their restaurants due to past experience with them...food wasn't very good. The hotel is a good bargain if you don't mind Motel 6 quality. We would stay there again if and when the elevators are really "upgraded". Would not recommend the hotel to anyone until the elevators are fixed.

Reviews.Title: “It was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: vegasboundman
Reviews.Content: My fiancee' and I decided to try the Fremont street experience. We stayed at Fitzgerald's. It was the most pleasant experience we have had in Las Vegas. From the time we pulled up to the casino until the time we left we were never dissapointed. The staff was very friendly and courteous (except for the one blackjack pit boss who was probably having a bad day) We are coming back in Dec. for Christmas and bringing some friends. I'm hoping we have the same great experience.

Reviews.Title: “The experience was better than previous reviews had indicated.”
Reviews.Author: poorcat
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the process of upgrading--surprising in this economy. It is clean and pretty well maintained. For those who like the Downtown Exdperience, it is GREAT. If you are a "Strip" person, you would probably be happier staying on the strip. The food at the Courtyard Grill and Buffet was very good, and it was reasonably priced. It did take a little while to be seated, but once at a table, the food was delivered very quickly. I appreaciated the small safe in the room that I could use without involving the hotel personnel. We were there during a heat wave, and I was pleased that the room stayed cool. I have stayed in other downtown hotels that did not have good air conditioning. It will be a pleasure to return next summer. Probably my only complaint would be the parking garage--it was a little tight.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel with surprises”
Reviews.Author: Turtle3103
Reviews.Content: Initially, the hotel looks old to me and I did research and knew that it's a 2 star hotel, but because I got a deal for CAD 69 tax incl for two week nights so I gave it a try, and it turns out to be a positive result. The room is larger that I thought (bigger than Imperial Palace deluxe room and 4 Queen's), it's clean and it has good view. Staffs are nice and helpful. Make sure you sign up the players club and you will get souvenior!!

Reviews.Title: “Fine Room For Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: QenTerra
Reviews.Content: My room was on the 27th floor where it was quiet. It was a budget room with a million dollar view. Internet speed was good, tv service was basic and the room was clean. Nothing really stood out during my stay except the view from my room. Thus, my room was a good value in a middle of the road sort of way.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfying and pleasant weekend stay!”
Reviews.Author: vegasbride08
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fitz June 6-8th. Asked for a larger room with a view specifically a corner view room with the large windows. Was told that we could get one but would have to wait til 3p because there was not any available. No biggie, we headed over for breakfast and did some gambling and arrived back at 12:45 just to check early. Ya never know! We got our room keys and were headed up to room # 3424. Top floor of the building and the room was much to my suprise very nice! Loved the large windows and so did my husband! Bathroom was decent size and clean, no complaints there. Not overally huge but it worked just fine for our needs. And we even had a coffee maker. This is the 1st hotel we have ever stayed at in Vegas that has had a coffee maker. . . we never used it however but it was a nice gesture. Bed was comfortable enough, rested well. Breakfast on 2nd floor for $1.99 and that was very good! The best buffet that we ate at was at Main Street Station! Awesome price! Awesome food and selection. Only downfall was the carpet in our room was not vacuumed very well. It wasn't the cleanest upon arrival but was taken care of later. The elevators sometimes were on the slower side but really not slow enough to truly complain about. Maybe had to wait no more than 5 min or so at times other times we got right on an elevator! The Hotel itself was smokier than I prefer but our room however was not at all and beig I didn't spend tons of time in the casino I wasn't too concerned about the ventilation system. It's to be expected when these are older hotels. Didn't have any luck in the casino area nor did we anywhere else either but then again I don't go to Vegas to get rich! Overall was very impressed and would stay again. Great customer service!! Would not recommend Bell Trans for shuttle . . . over 45 min late for a 2pm pick up and we had been waiting since 1:45. When I called at 2:15 they informed me the driver had already drove by the pick up area which was an outright lie and when we did get picked up they picked up at the wrong location. We were told out front at Registration in front of the shuttle pick up sign and they picked up on the west side of the building. Very disatisfied with Bell Trans! Would never use them again for service! - - -That was not the hotel's fault but just wanted to add that for anyone use shuttle transportation.- - - - -

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, good location and slots”
Reviews.Author: NativeOR
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fitz at the end of May. We wanted to stay downtown this time around. 1st the bad: -Elevators are slow. Though normally not more than a 5 minute wait, the last day we waited 20 minutes as we tried to check out. -Service not so great. Barely saw the cocktail waitresses, check-in nearly refused to check us in. We were not told by hotel or travel agent that a deposit is required. We had arrived the night before we got paid (direct deposit) and only had limited cash on us. Wanted a $50 credit card (we only brought debit card) or $100 cash. We offered to give it to them the next day, and was told they couldn't. Luckily they allowed $20 cash. -Unclean. Not to the point of fearing bugs, but tub was slow to drain, and 2 days in to trip saw it was because a sticker in drain. Easy to grab (but I wasn't going to put my hand down there) but not caught by housekeeping for who knows how long. Feet were black after walking across the floor. Gave tip each day and asked for extra towels the first. The next day towels were gone. Apparently have to ask for them each and every day. The good: Courtyard Cafe - and their staff. Friendly, and the Sliders were excellent! Ate dinner/the Sliders the first night, went back the next night just for the sliders, and went back for breakfast our last day. The slots were fairly loose. We didn't hit it big (though 2 or 3 people did in the 3 day span), but won enough to keep us playing. We were able to play quite a while on $20. The location was great. The Deuce dropped off people right by Fitzgeralds, and only had to walk a block to catch bus to Strip. Walgreens right across the road, so we got water, etc there when we wanted it. Overall, a decent place to play and visit, but I don't recommend staying there. We do plan on returning to Vegas, and we do plan on staying on Fremont again, but we will probably pick another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “another good visit”
Reviews.Author: Exbronx46
Reviews.Content: Spent a full week at the Fitz in May and had a great room and wonderful service. I will admit that the elevators slowed down over Memorial Day weekend but hundreds of guests arrived and I expected that would happen. Valet parking is a breeze and the guys are wonderful. The buffet no longer exists -- small restaurant took its place. It had breakfast and dinner specials that were very reasonable. Internet in room costs extra but I knew that in advance and it worked perfectly. Hope I can get back to Las Vegas again this year and stay once more at the Fitz!

Reviews.Title: “Disappoined with the overall experience.”
Reviews.Author: manderson2482
Reviews.Content: I just left (last night) the hotel - everything about this visit was very poor. 1) The pool area was dirty, when you walked on the cement the bottom of your feet were "black", the water was so cold you couldn't even put your feet in it. The hot tub was dirty and very unclean. 2) the staff were very rude many times during my stay. 3) the food in the restaurant was COLD every breakfast and service was very poor, and the waitstaff were so rude at times, it was like no one cared what happened 4) the elevator wait at times was 45 minutes to get from your room to any other floor. I have stayed at the hotel about 4 times, and this will be my last visit. I will not spend my money at a place that is so poorly run - with poor service, food, pool area! You are cheating people out of their money.

Reviews.Title: “No Problems at All with our one night stay.”
Reviews.Author: Mailgirl
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were staying Downtown and needed a hotel to stay in just for Saturday night. Check-in was quick and the clerk was pleasant. We checked in around 10pm and ended up with a room on the 28th floor. We booked our room on Hotels.com and this was the cheapest option for a weekend night. Our room was a non-smoking 2-bed room. It was a decent size and we didn't run into any problems. The water pressure in the shower could have been better, but other than that, it was fine. The Fitz provides a hair dryer and coffee maker in the bathroom and an ironing board, iron and safe in the closet.

Reviews.Title: “No Hot Water”
Reviews.Author: Mtnfolk2
Reviews.Content: I have made three trips to Vegas in the last year. Stayed at the Fritz from 23 March to 28th March. No hot water for 3 out of five days, complained for 3 days and did no good. Several people check out earlier, because of cold or just warm water. The elevator's where slow and even had to ride freight elevator twice. The maid service was fantastic and room clean. They have changed meat supplier and chef at the FRITZ since my first trip (according to waitress) the food at Court Yard is terrible and expensive. and slow service. The people are nice and friendly , but will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great view!”
Reviews.Author: mcstix
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Fitzgerald's for four nights in February, 2009 for an average of $30 per night. Weekends would have been $49 tops I think. I used the $20 bill trick and actually did get a room with a nice view (3348 I think.) The view rooms are basically corner rooms, and have a "wrap around" window. One view from my room faced the Stratosphere Tower, the other faced West. The room itself was older Motel 6 fair, but was fairly clean. Bedspreads looked and felt very used. There was a small in-room safe for guests, which I used. It was free. Maids were pretty good about keeping people out while they were cleaning the room. i.e. you couldn't just walk into a room unless they KNEW it was your room. A good thing at this hotel, as a few of the guests are a little seedy due to the low prices. I also met LOTS of nice people here during my four-night stay however, so the undesirables are probably the minority. Most people I met staying there seemed to be middle-aged. Got a player's card, which is only good at Fitzgerald's Las Vegas I believe. I played craps and some blackjack at the casino. Craps was $5 minimum and 3X4X5X odds. They went up to $10 minimum at times, but you could always stay at $5 if you bought in before they raised the limit. Nice dealers for the most part. Preferred to play my craps at Binion's however, though they had the same minimums. Another thing I liked about this hotel is the fact that the walk to the rooms isn't too terribly long from the elevator. This is because the hotel is really not that big, though it is one of the tallest (if not the tallest) hotel downtown. I was at the opposite end of the hotel from the elevator and it was a walk, but not nearly as bad as some larger hotels. The hotel is located on one end of the Freemont Street Experience (the south end I believe.) I liked this fact as it was also close to a Walgreens and a couple of gift shops where you could buy your bottled water, sodas etc. The "Deuce Bus" also stops just up the street on Las Vegas Blvd. They'll ding you about $13 per day for Internet, though they do have it. They also had a business center near the lobby, though I didn't use that. Overall I enjoyed my stay there. The price was right and you get what you pay for, but for those on a budget it's a great value and much better than some of the other "cheapies" downtown. I'd recommend the Fitz over the Plaza, Las Vegas Club etc. If you want a "nice" place to stay downtown, try the Golden Nugget's north tower. Usually the GN is about $100/night for north tower rooms, but sometimes they are just $79 per night. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Excuses...excuses”
Reviews.Author: Bowler51
Reviews.Content: We flew into LV for the Men's National Bowling Tournament. The Fitz is about 1.5 miles from the bowling facility and seemed a good choice. We had stayed about 4 years ago and while it didn't set the world on fire then we thought it would be ok....boy were we wrong. The carpets in the casino are dirty. You notice this if you lift up the seats at some of the slot machines and see what the carpet used to look like. There are only 4 elevators to service the 34 floors and 600+ rooms. They are so slow that one routinely waited 10-15 minutes. When I approached the front desk they said that they were in the process of upgrading the elevators and that one was new and used digital processing while the old 3 used analog and they didn't talk to each other well. Indeed, the new elevator was frequently out of service. The beds varied wildly from acceptable to downright unusable. One of our group finally asked to be moved to another room only to be shuffled twice because someone apparently had kept a room key and was occupying a room thought to be empty. Other people commented about the poor quality of the mattresses as well. Our room wall heater/air conditioner failed to maintain the temperature (on the cold side) so we let the front desk know that morning and asked for a repair during the day. When we returned it hadn't been touched so we went back to the desk and a tech was sent. He said the filter was too dirty and he would fix it. It never did function correctly. The casino allows smoking and the low ceilings, combined with a poor air filtration system made it uncomfortable (we are non-smokers). If you want internet (wireless) access the hotel wants to charge $12/day (which is ridiculous) but you can do down to the Krispy Kreme shop and get free access. The employees rarely smiled and many appeared like they didn't want to be there. There are only two restaurants and both are dated and marginal from a food quality standpoint. We had to send food back because it was cold and they appeared to be understaffed. In short we suggest that one look elsewhere. A low price isn't necessarily a sign of a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value, would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: beachinfool
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four day vegas trip, stayed at fitzgeralds. Very nice stay, I would definately stay here again. Ate at Don B's steakhouse, it was very good. Also saw the country music tribut show at the hotel, it was good also. Elevators were a little slow, but we got lucky most of the time. We booked a nonsmoking king, they were out and we got a smoking but it wasnt too bad. Overall, I will definately stay here again and would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “No Problems at the Fitz”
Reviews.Author: shadow700
Reviews.Content: I called the hotel a week before our arrival and requested non smoking, 2 beds per room, adjoining rooms on a high floor with a view. They met all of our requests. The rooms were clean, although the bathroom could use an upgrade. We had great water pressure in the sink and tub, but when we turned on the shower it was very weak. The rooms were cleaned daily. We didn't have any problems waiting for an elevator like others have stated. They are in the process of replacing them one at a time, the new one was running a few times during the week as they were trying it out. It was much faster then the older ones. The coctail waitresses and dealers were all very friendly. I had more fun gambling there then I did any of the other casinos downtown or the strip. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fitzgerald 3 night stay 2/11-2/14/09”
Reviews.Author: keith12552
Reviews.Content: I went with a family member to Las Vegas and we stayed in this hotel,the rooms were clean and the desk staff went out of their way to please us.The casino slots were alot looser than the strip and the Freemont Street Experience was just outside the front door.The rooms were quiet and the beds were comfortable.The 1.99 breakfast specials in the restaurant were delicious.I will be coming back on my next trip.The only negative thing is one elevator is down for overhaul and so there is a short wait for an elevator at times.We requested a lower level floor and had the option to use the stairs if we felt like it.I think this hotel is a good bargain for the money.

Reviews.Title: “My Stay At Fitzgeralds Was Great”
Reviews.Author: gerryquin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Fitzgeralds 10-13 December. Got to the hotel @ 10:00 a.m. was able to check in early. Room was comfortable...not fancy but good enough. Gambled mostly in their casino and had some luck. Was pretty busy due to the Rodeo. Airport was not crowded. Overall, stay was great. Would stay at the fitz again.

Reviews.Title: “34 Floors--- 2 elevators”
Reviews.Author: Ray_Home
Reviews.Content: No problem with checking in, valet parking or the room itself. SOFT soft (way too soft ) bed. Wife complained of bed bugs bite. I saw the reaction. Two of four elevators do not work. Someone told me that this has been like this for a year or more. Anyhow....was on 8th floor and had to walk up and down, as we could never get an elevator. Last time I stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Entirely acceptable”
Reviews.Author: dljpdx
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Fitz 11/27 - 11/30 for the Thanksgiving holiday weekend, in room 1102 (one king bed, smoking). The negative (though not bad enough to make me give a poor review): - The room elevators were quite slow during peak times. 3 of the 4 elevators were working, one was out of order. If there were a lot of people waiting to catch the elevator up, you could quite easily wait 5-10 minutes. Similar waits on my floor while waiting to go down. At non-peak hours it was just a couple minutes. Garage elevators were just fine. - Very slow drain in the bathroom sink, which would back up and gunk would come up and out into the sink. I assume the maids knew about it, since they did clean the sinks and running the water would cause it to back up, but it was not attended to. The neutral: - Room was a bit frayed and worn around the edges, but I knew that going in, having read other reviews. Plus it was a smoking room - not like they're going to replace things that will just get stunk up / burn marks etc. - My room was overlooking Fremont Street, which has a pretty loud sound & light show every evening (once every hour, on the hour, until about midnight.). Quite audible in the room, didn't bother me enough to switch rooms, but others may find it annoying (in which case, request a room on the other side of the hotel). - Loud A/C unit. I like a bit of background noise when trying to sleep, so it didn't bug me too much, PLUS it did help drown out the noise from Fremont Street. - Wish they had a mini-fridge in the room; there was more than enough space to place one. The positive: - The price, only $40/night during my stay. - Location: right on Fremont. If you've never stayed downtown and want to experience some of the older / original Las Vegas, this hotel is a good choice. However, Fremont is a bit limited and after a couple nights you may have already seen it all - an option here is to rent a car from the hotel (they have an Enterprise desk and cars on-site), and the hotel has a free parking ramp for guests, so you could drive to the strip and park at one of the hotels there for a night on the town, or take a drive to Hoover Dam & Lake Meade, or just explore other parts of town. I had rented a car at the airport ($9 per day weekend special from Enterprise) and parked free at the hotel, and did get a good bit of use out of it. Easy to catch a taxi to the strip as well. Depending on time of day, a drive the hotel and the airport, utilizing the interstate, can take less than 20 minutes. - Room size: was quite large compared to other budget-friendly places I have stayed previously (on the strip). More than enough room for 2 or 3 people. - McDonald's and Krispy Kreme on-site, for when you want a quick bite but do not want to wait in line for the area restaurants. At peak times, every single restaurant / buffet will have a line, there is no avoiding it. - Proximity to other casinos etc: walking distance to numerous casinos, buffets / restaurants, bars, vintage neon signs at the Neonopolis, souvenir shops, convenience & liquor stores up & down Fremont, and a few other casinos right outside the Fremont "experience." Notes: Fremont does have its share of local vagrants and such, but I never felt threatened and they generally just seemed to hang out more than anything - was only asked for change once. You're allowed to walk around on Fremont with open containers of beer, drinks etc, so there's a chance you may see a few folks stumbling around, but the police presence was noticeable and never did I see any negative activity. All in all, I would stay here again, or along Fremont, if I wanted to stay in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Fitz~~~!!!”
Reviews.Author: IMJBS
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Fitz on October 10 and were glad to be able to check in at 10:30 am. Our room was on the 17th floor and was a standard King room. The room was clean and comfy. The staff there was great. I lost my cell while in the casino and by the end of the day security had found it!!! Great Roulette & BJ. My hubby was very happy with the $3 BJ and I was happy w/ the $2 Roulette in the mornings. We only ate at McD's and it was good but much pricier than the one back home! We used all our coupons for free drinks and the bar staff was great as well. This was my 2nd stay at the Fitz and it did not dissapoint. I will return!

Reviews.Title: “Fitz was fine by me!”
Reviews.Author: AladarNyc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three days and was very satisfied. The self parking was free (though quite full), check-in was a breeze, and my room on the 28th. floor had a fantastic view. The room was clean and comfortable. Everyone from the Casino floor staff to the Buffet Carver was extremely friendly. They bent over backwards to serve and inform me. The Vue Bar was excellent and the location couldn't be beat....it anchors one side of the Freemont Experience...which is quite the experience. I could easily walk to 10 - 15 different Casinos...all of which make me feel the Vegas experience better than the Strip. They have the character and feel of 'Ol Vegas. I won and I lost, but always felt at home in the Fitz. For the price ($$ 50+ per night), need I say more! Thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “Fitzgeralds of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: trvlrz
Reviews.Content: This was the first time that I have gone to Las Vegas for personal time. We arrived early in the morning on a Friday and was able to get right into our room. The room was not the cleanest room that my wife and i have stayed in but the hotel was old and it was as clean as could be expected. The gambling experience was fun and the casino had a lot to offer for a novice gambler. I don't know if I would stay at this casino again but we got a great package deal and it is right on Freemont street with lots to see. The next time I stay I might try and find a deal on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Accommodations and Service”
Reviews.Author: northwestkorky
Reviews.Content: My husband and I began our stay with a rude front desk clerk who mumbled inaudible words to me when I inquired about validating our parking...never looking up from his screen. When we brought our bags upstairs, there was a young lady passed by the soda machine. The mattress was old, and had springs popping through the padding. Later on that night, there was a fight in the room next door which spilled out into the hallway with lots of door slamming and cursing. Upon checkout when we informed the front desk, they just laughed. In addition, this was the third time we had requested a suite. The first time we waited until 5 p.m. for it to become available, and it never was. This time the rude front desk person just gave us a room, any room, but failed to inform us that a suite wasn't available. The buffet is what I'd call a "cold cut" buffet in that there was only one ham being sliced very thin, and two keilbasa sausages positioned like the missing roast beef and turkey. We took the last serving of green beans. What I ate was terrible, and the staff continued to circle our table asking if we wanted something to drink...trying to fill our stomachs so that we wouldn't be hitting up the buffet too much. With the service and accommodations so poor, I will not be returning to a hotel that I had called a home away from home for 20 years!

Reviews.Title: “First time BUT definitely not the last stay here!”
Reviews.Author: jlcrn1
Reviews.Content: Stayed fir 5 days 11/5 to 11/10. From the front desk to housekeeping to valet and the dealers the ENTIRE staff was cheerful and friendly. We had room 2137...king bed N/S. very clean, comfortable and met all our needs. Safe was big enough for my DVD player, cash, jewelry and camera. Housekeeping very quick and room was very clean. Quiet too. Only 1 time was the elevators slow and that was Monday morning when alot of folks were checking out. No big deal! Food was cheap and tasty.Felt very safe and comfortable there. Will definitely stay here again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Fitz”
Reviews.Author: Camirella
Reviews.Content: Contrary to some of the reviews I had read on here, we had a great stay at the Fitz. We had no waiting line at check-in, everyone was very friendly and we had no waiting lines for the elevators, got up and down quickly and all 4 were working at the time of our stay. Room was nice, we had a corner room up on the 28th floor, great view over Fremont Street. Room was cleaned every day, shower was good, sink drain did make some gurgling noises after you used it and toilet was a little loud after flushing but otherwise everything was great. Courtyard grille and buffet was delicious and you definitely need to get the players club card. By the end of our stay we had racked up $11 to play with and $36 in comps which we used for breakfast and at the gift shop. The slots there were also very good to us. We will definitely stay there again and will recommend the Fitz to all our friends and family!!

Reviews.Title: “Not As Bad As Expected”
Reviews.Author: Texsingyrl
Reviews.Content: In glancing at some of the reviews from here, I was very skeptical as to whether or not I would stay here once we got to Las Vegas. I was surprised to find the hotel was not as bad as what I thought it would be. Pros: The room was clean. No dust, no trash found that wasn't ours, etc. There was not a long wait for the elevators. We received a no smoking room as requested. Cons: The sink 'gurgled' all night. It was not stopped up, it just made weird sounds (old building, I guess.) You could not hear it when outside of the restroom, but it was a bit disconcerting when inside the restroom. The water pressure was not very strong at all. The housekeeper forgot to put a pillowcase on the extra pillow. There were a couple of questionable (chocolate?) stains on the chair in our room. It looked as though someone dropped some pieces of chocolate on the chair and they melted and had not been cleaned off. There was a small stain on the corner of the top sheet on my side. Looked like make-up, but could tell the sheet had been washed. Overall, I would stay here again. I am a pretty picky person and was geared for it to be WAY worse than it was.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time, Great Room!”
Reviews.Author: Caliguy66
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a weekend stay at the Fitz with 4 friends and we had a great time. We checked in on Friday at 12:30p.m. and were given a room right away. The room was a clean, good size room(can't complain since it was comped) and the AC worked PERFECT! The elevators were a little slow, but we didn't care. We could wait 5 minutes without crying over an out of work elevator. The casino was kicking and we made so much noise, even we were surprised that security wasn't called on us. I would definately stay here again(even if I have to pay for the room)!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: x94cherry
Reviews.Content: I got a very good deal on this room, $30 a night for Thursday through Sunday nights plus $75 in free gas from Expedia. You do the math--very, very inexpensive. The room was nothing special, but nice. A lot like a Super 8 Motel, very clean and everything worked. The staff was friendly enough. The pool was nothing special, but it does the job. It's probably the best pool downtown next to the Gold Nugget, but that's not saying much. The casino was nice and dealers were friendly. One highlight was the Vue bar. Their outside patio overlooking the Fremont street experience is a very nice place to sit and people-watch, and drinks are inexpensive, especially the draft beer. They also have pitchers, which is nice. One tiny gripe--they're using too much of the piped-in scent in the casino and hotel, not a bad smell, but phew, a little strong.

Reviews.Title: “Great to Crash and if you want to feel super sexy!”
Reviews.Author: pulgadelmundo
Reviews.Content: We needed a placed to crash before heading into out Vegas adventure full speed ahead..which the Palazzo wouldn't allow until 3pm :) (see review) So LawyerGirl had wanted to go to downtown and I figured this was my quick way to get it out of her system to go on to grander places... It took like 15 minutes to get to the top of their parking structure but I remember that Fritz had some good customer service so I decided we'd sleep there...We caught a pretty sunrise and knew it was going to be hot hot hot Basic Room for 50ish ...we could hear all the maid knocking around but the manager was cool and told us we could have late late check out...2pm On the bright side when we walked around later We looked SUPER SEXY compared to everyone else around us..we even started getting hit on in the elevator...but we are early 30's and beat the median age by like 30 years. The downtown location sucks during the day, much better than night..not much fine dining unless you consider a buffet so...The hotel is next to Wal greens which was nice becuase we got the incidentals out of the way before the rest of the trip As my friend mentioned we waited at least 10 minutes for their 1 over worked 102 year old bellman to show up..I tried to lift the bag FOR him...Some woman had been waiting longer than us.. I asked the VIP guys in their special office if we could get some help...but they said NO, just WAIT......maybe if I hadn't been waiting I would of played some slots and given them some of my money...dummies FINAL NOTE: Do not BRING your lap top...THey have a tiny wall safe..nothing to keep your laptop safe if it is a necessity for you

Reviews.Title: “Fitzgeralds is great!!”
Reviews.Author: reeadytogo
Reviews.Content: Wow!! I can't believe some of the previous reviews. I have stayed at the Fitz many times throughout the years, and I'll agree that it got a little frayed around the edges. It was always clean, and the staff was always friendly, but you should see it now. The owners have been fixing it up with some subtle and some not so subtle changes. Our room had new air conditioning that was actually freezing at night. It had a new bed that was comfortable. The bathroom was redone with new shower that was very nice. The casino was lively and festive with everyone having a good time. Freemont Street was one big party at night with a lot of festivities and plenty of security around. Nothing at all to be worried about. This is a great hotel & casino - just don't go there with an attitude and you won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a very bad hotel - do not go there”
Reviews.Author: SubjectiveView
Reviews.Content: We decided on this hotel based on the 3* rating it had. This is not a 3* hotel!!! It is bad. First of all - everything smells like smoke. Even the non-smoking rooms smell like smoke. Since I don't smoke, I find this to be a bad thing Second - the room we stayed in looked really bad. It was small, dirty looking, not clean. Third - when we wanted to switch the hotel, the hotel manager could not be found (we called at 1am). When he got in (at 6:30) it would not refund us our money (we payed to stay for 5 days and wanted to leave after 1 night). Fourth - we did not feel safe in the hotel/neighborhood - very shady place. We did, in fact leave after that first night and found a deal online for MGM Grand - and there is no comparison between the two. I will never ever go back to that hotel and I suggest that you spend a bit more money and stay on the Strip - much better view, great service and you are right in the middle of all the cool places. Expedia tried to help, but in the end, we had to forfeit the hotel money. They said we'll get a 100$ coupon and $100 back but I have not yet seen those. Might update on this. They also did not want to match the deal I found on MGM Grand's web page because they could not open the MGMgrand.com web page. Well - if they don't want my money it is fine with me.

Reviews.Title: “Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: ledj2
Reviews.Content: Had 2 rooms, 1 with 2 beds & 1 with 1 bed, non smoking, high floor as requested. Both rooms neat, tidy, just your average size hotel room. Never waited long for elevators any of the days we were there (Wed - Sun). All staff I used were helpful & curtious. I also used the pool (heated) & valet parking everyday with no problems. I would stay there again and I would recomend it to family and friends as value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Looks like the end of my relationship with the Fitz”
Reviews.Author: Susieq1047
Reviews.Content: I have tried to be loyal to the Fitz because they have been such gracious hosts in the past...But the last couple of times were not so good... First of all they were obviously short staffed on the Valet parking...the ones working were nice but much slower than the past. The room was bland, dirty and had none of the travel magazines and stuff. I think someone had checked out and the room was not refreshed before we got it...but the carpet was nasty, the air conditioner did not work well ( while it is over 100 degrees outside) and the over all ambiance was just lacking. Left 5 Bucks for Housekeeping to leave us some extra towels and pillows...got one set of towels and A pillow...what? Pillow shortage? You HAVE to get Extra towels there because they have the tiniest, thinnest towels in Vegas. Went down with the coupon they gave us for a free dinner at Don B's and asked if we could pay the difference and have lobster rather than the steak and they said NO! We didn't even say how much we would pay different but they made no effort to make us happy...service was lack luster but the food was delicious. Went to the Buffet with the "Breakfast buffet" Coupon handed us at check in and ..NO breakfast buffet??? So we decided to order of the menu..5 minutes passed and not even a nod like we were going to get service so we got up and walked out...went to McDonald's downstairs. It was very slow and blah....actually all of downtown seemed blah. We checked out early and got a room at the IP on the strip and I fear we will never look back at the Old Fitz..

Reviews.Title: “Its the Kmart of Hotels”
Reviews.Author: eeg1977ok
Reviews.Content: DO NOT stay here. At all. It is dirty, the wallpaper was peeling in the room, the bathroom was filthy. I actually bought a bottle of bleach and poured in the tub. The elevators are horribly slow. We waited 15 minutes for an elevator at one point. We stayed here because of the convienance of Fremont Street. I will not do that again. I will spend the extra money and go to the Golden Nugget. The kicker was there was AN EXPLOSION at the pasta bar people had to be taken out of the hotel on stretchers. The idiot chef but butane bottles near an open flame, almost killed my friend. And were we offered anything to compensate nearly being killed? NO! The staff had the personality of lettuce and were not helpful at all. Overall, a good place to go if you want a good rapin!

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a favor and book somewhere, anywhere, else.”
Reviews.Author: travelersplicer
Reviews.Content: Not only are the rooms dingy and outdated, but the rest of the hotel isn't any better. Don't bother trying to go downstairs for breakfast, I waited 27 minutes for an elevator to go down, and 23 mintues for it to come back up. With over 30 floors, and only 4 elevators (2 of which were broken on my stay) there is no way to accommodate all the people. The restaurant has decent food, but I didn't wait less than 10 minutes to be served. And apparently it was too much of a hassle to even refill a coffee once. I had a completely clogged sink and the men that came to fix it were very polite and worked hard, but the bathroom smelled like rotten water for the rest of my stay since there was absolutely no fan and the windows don't open. And housekeeping didn't replace the towels they took. Do yourself a favor and book somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Never again............”
Reviews.Author: tstitts4
Reviews.Content: Although I had read some bad reviews, I had also read some good reviews and since the rest of the family for the family reunion was staying there, my husband and I decided to give it a shot. Well, what a mistake...From the room quality, to the desk staff, to the casino staff, it was awful. I wouldn't stay there again if someone else paid for it. The elevators were a joke, the front desk personnel had no personality and had no interest in making their guest comfortable and happy. Bad experience...Just in case you think this could be fake...the elevator on the left hand side, behind you if facing away from the casino, was out of order, most of the time we were there. This was between July 24 and July 28th, 2008. We changed rooms twice, and each time had to request the AC filters be cleaned/replaced, because the air blowing out was not cool/cold. I walked down from the 17th floor 2 times on that Sunday and when I called the front desk to inquire about why no elevators were stopping on our floor, or when then did, they were so full you couldn't have put a grain of salt on them, I was told "we are busy, it is check out time, you will just have to wait". Had we had an emergency, it would have been sad. The carpet is in bad need of replacing and so is the wallpaper. The tubs, (in all three rooms that I saw) were chipped, scratched and patched. I know the hotel is old, but basic maintenance and repairing/replacing of worn/torn items would help make the stay at the Fitz better. But even worse than the condition of the hotel, was the condition of the staff. The front desk, even at check in, was rude, dispassionate and unwilling to try to accomodate requests. Even when talking to a supervisor, she stared above my head, and was also blaise' about assisting us. And the wait staff at the casino?????!!!!!! We could sit at a slot for an hour before anyone would come around to ask if we wanted something to drink. Then it would take another hour for them to come back!!! And if you asked for water or soda, forget it! It never arrived at all. We had to go to the bar and pay for our drinks the entire time we were there. I went and bought bottled water and gatorade so I didn't have to pay 3.00 for a bottle of water! Would not recommend this hotel to anyone...

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: TANYA66
Reviews.Content: Fitzgeralds is a very pleasant small hotel and casino. The check in desk was close to the car drop off which was great although quite unusual in Vegas as the hotels do like you to trek through the casinos with your luggage at most of the themed hotels. The rooms were well proportioned, well furnished and clean. We always stay downtown as everything is on the doorstep. My Dad sometimes uses a wheelchair and we rented one from Fitzgeralds during our stay so fremont street is great for getting around. Fitzgeralds has a McDonalds, Krispy Kreme and Starbucks inside or close by. The Vue bar is great as a previous reviewer said as you can sit out just under the Fremont Street Experience to get a great view of the display. The only thing that lets the Fitzgeralds down is the location of the pool. It was nice and clean but you have to walk out throught the valet parking to get to the pool which is located on a corner of the street at street level at the back of the hotel. The pool was quite quiet because of that and if you're not a pool person then it wouldn't dull your enjoyment at all. I would definately still stay there again because of all the plus points and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “As Always, I love the Fitz!!!!”
Reviews.Author: supershe
Reviews.Content: I have visited the Fitz many times over the years, but... it had been about 12 years since I stayed here. In the old days, visited 2-4 times a year for about 15 years, so it felt like returning home. Some things have changed. The Enchanted Forest is gone, but.. I had some good luck at the slots here at the Fitz. I visited most of the other downtown casinos, but found my best luck to be here, at the Fitz. I'm not a high roller, and I didn't get time to spend at blackjack tables, as I usually do, since I met a large group from TripAdvisor.com here, but... there will be other days!! I had a nice room on the seventh floor, close to the elevator, and.. the only comment I have is that the carpet could stand to be replaced. I'm pretty sure this is on the agenda, as all the hallways (that i saw) have been redone, and are quite nice. I had a double queen non smoking room, handicapped, and the bathroom was quite large, with a tub/shower combination, and a very wide sink/vanity. Nice accessories furnished, Pantene Pro-V shampoo & body lotion, and boxed individual soaps, both facial and bath sizes. Housekeeping took very good care of things, bringing extra wash cloths (a stack!) when I asked, and extra coffee for the coffee maker. TV channels are basic, but there are several. Who watches TV in Vegas anyway??? I found the casino help, hotel accommodations (check-in girl was so friendly, and helpful... there was no line, and I got a nice Funbook from her) bell staff, and the people at the Courtyard Grill to all be welcoming and helpful in all aspects. I had a Bleu Cheese Burger with fries here that was killer for $8.95 minus a $2.00 coupon off from the Funbook !! And a lunch special (Crab linguini with garlic bread for $6.95) that was also very tasty. I'll be back, Fitz! You can count on it!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Fitz is OK”
Reviews.Author: LizNPlymouth_Devon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and considering that this cost less than one night would have cost in some Strip hotels I don't think we had much cause to complain. We had a spacious room on 24th floor, with nice views. The decor is a little old and worn, and our bath had marks in the bottom, but the room was cleaned well every day. We didn't have too many problems with the lifts either Loved Freemont Street, and the Fitz has a bar with a balcony overlooking the Street - reasonably priced drinks and a great place to see the Freemont Street Experience (we loved the tribute to Queen)

Reviews.Title: “Didn't like it here”
Reviews.Author: casinocim
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Fremont then moved to Fitzgeralds with family on June 14th. I would rather have stayed at the Fremont. The room was ok. The room itself seemed clean. There were places where the wallpaper is starting to peel off. The bathroom didn't seem very clean. The floor needed a good scrubbing and the tub was stained all over. The beds were ok. Had to wait a long time for the elevators and they were always packed full. The only thing I ate here was a Krispy Kreme donut and it was good. I say stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Two nights at the Fitz...........”
Reviews.Author: Clarkson7
Reviews.Content: I stayed for the first time at the Fitz on Sunday and Monday, June 8 & 9. The check in was easy and I was given a room of the 22nd floor with an excellent view. The room was fine with a comfortable king bed. The air conditioner was good and also quiet. The shower had plenty of pressure. The sink drained slowly. I played the slots quite a bit with average success. I was awakened at 3:15 a.m by the fire alarm. There was no fire. Apparently an electrical malfunction set it off. I would certainly stay at Fitzgerald's again. Also, the elevators were very slow the first day--ok the second day.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the money”
Reviews.Author: samiam6
Reviews.Content: I was very hesitant going in due to the reviews I read. My room was nothing fancy but it WAS clean. Not the Ritz but a good value for what I paid. The hotel staff was very nice, the elevators worked without any problems and I really liked the location. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the wait”
Reviews.Author: deuceDePereWisconsin
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this property. There are better hotels in the same vicinity that are nicer. Check in went smooth. Arrived early and was able to get a room right away. Had to wait for ever for the elevators!! All the time. My wife would get her morning exercise by walking down the 19 floors instead of waiting. The faucet in the tub ran constanly. Not fixed for 2 days. Hot than cold water never a steady stream. Some times scalding hot water!!. I know it is Vegas and you don't spend that much time in a room but it should be nicer that your local Hojo's

Reviews.Title: “Will not be staying again !”
Reviews.Author: ronnilv
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Fitz several times, at least 10 times . Each time we hoped Mgmt. would replace the box spring & mattresses. They haven't. This time was the worst, it was like sleeping on the floor. Unfortunately, we will not be staying at Fitzgerald's anymore. We decided to spend a bit more and stay at The Golden Nugget next time.

Reviews.Title: “Way better than expexted”
Reviews.Author: sunseeker01
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Fitzgeralds May 15 thru the 18th. After reading some reviews, was a little apprehensive about staying here. Turned out-it was a great place with absolute wonderful staff. Everyone went out of their way to do anything for you or to help you. Service was fabulous at all times! Rooms are a little older but that is half the charm of staying downtown. Room was clean and never had problem with elevators. Also, we gambled everywhere downtown, and we won the most at Fitz. I went home home with more than I went with. Can't ask for much more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Casino”
Reviews.Author: kgouin
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here for nights. We had a room on the 31st floor with a nice view of the mountains. The room had 2 double beds, a table with 2 chairs, iron, hairdryer, and safe. The room was average size and was very clean. The beds were not the most comfortable but they served the purpose. The slots in the casino payed us pretty well. The staff was very friendly. The breakfast buffet was not too good but the service was excellent. The selection was very limited. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Never again, HUGE mistake”
Reviews.Author: electotech
Reviews.Content: We will NEVER stay at this place again. Our room was on the 21st floor. The hotel only had three functioning elevators the first day. We stood in the lobby for 20 minutes (I timed it) waiting on an elevator to get to our room. Upon entering our room we were greeted with a six inch wide trail of hair, whiskers, and soap scum the entire length of the bottom of the tub. We were told that they had been working on the plumbing and that noone was in housekeeping to clean the mess up. We asked for another room, you guessed it none available. We cleaned the mess up ourselves. Every day of our stay, that same six inch wide mess would show up in our tub in the morning. Two days into our stay, they shut the water off to 5 floors for "plumbing repairs". Evidently they need another plumber because it didn't work, next day same mess. The next to the last day there our room didn't get cleaned so no clean towels for showers on the morning that we left. Don't even get me started on the "buffet". We arrived on a Sunday morning. We were hungry and went to their "Courtyard" buffet. What a waste of money, the food was terrible the service was non-exsistant. We ate breakfasts at the Paradise buffet across the street after that. The one bright spot was the valet parking staff. They were courteous, prompt and very friendly. Maybe they should run the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Keno Tournament at Fitzgerald's Casino Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: SuePete
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a Keno tournament in Las Vegas at Fitzgerald's Hotel and Casino, and we can't wait to go back! The hotel is in the "old" part of town, right at the beginning of the Fremont Street Experience. Anytime I get THREE NIGHTS FREE, which we did with the tournament, I think it's excellent! The hotel itself is a bit tattered and worn (but clean) - and the ventilation systems are not quite as good as the newer casinos. Things feel a bit "tighter" than in the sprawling taj mahals on the strip. But overall, the good outweighs the bad. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly, for one thing. The buffet is very good and free drinks are served often. There is a Walgreen's Drug store steps from the front door. And best of all, when you play in a tournament, you get three nights' room absolutely FREE. In addition, (and I assume this applies to other tournaments), we received four meal vouchers (for the player in the tournament and a partner) and two other tournament meals, an evening buffet and a breakfast, and player shirts. Now, HOW GREAT IS THAT?? The keno tournament is held 4 times a year, but they also host other tournament events, which, I am guessing, have similar perks. In the keno tournament, you put up $500, but get the full amount back to play in the tournament, and you get to keep all your winnings. Of the approximately 100 players, about 1/4 earned all their money back. The top winner took home over $11,000. We met some "regulars" at the tournament who said, "Why stay on the strip when the only thing I need my room for is to sleep?" The sleeping rooms are adequate, the beds very firm, and the shower was hot. Depending on the time of day, the four elevators could be slow, but that's true with any high-rise hotel. For those unfamiliar with Fremont Street, it is 5 blocks of pedestrian mall with a 1,400 foot canopy light show - billed as the world's largest. It's unlike anything you've ever seen. Also available in the mall area are small shops, drug stores, other casinos, and restaurants - all within easy walking distance, unlike the strip. There is nightly entertainment outside your front door. The Deuce Bus, which runs the length of the strip, is available for $5/day, so it's easy to get out to the other end of the strip if you want to tour other casinos or go to a show. So, check out Fitzgerald's Casino. Las Vegas deals are still there, if you know where to look! Go to the other end of the strip for glitz and glamour and giant pools, but go to Fitzgeralds to have fun, save a buck, and win a bunch!

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: maverick1507
Reviews.Content: First time at Fitzgerald's and will definitely go back. Easy, early check-in; great casino;good-value restaurants; good location. Large comfortable rooms, good bell staff.

Reviews.Title: “Get a written confirmation showing price or the name of your operator.”
Reviews.Author: honydo
Reviews.Content: Our family booked accommodation in this hotel in April 2008 and were quoted a rate of $49.00 for the Sunday but on arrival at check in the rate was $99.00 a big surprise. We went to the casino host area and all they could do was monitor our casino play and perhaps give us a break on checkout of all the room charges. This added pressure to a relaxing trip time planned with family but the price did work out in the end with a final price of $32.00 plus tax. My only point is (told to me by the casino rep) Always know who booked your stay if you're not able to get a written price confirmation. Get a name of the person doing the booking if you deal direct with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: Bob984
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Fitz and my first stay in the Fremont St. area. My room was fine, and the maid service was good. Unlike others, I had no elevator problems. The buffet the first nite was adequate, and I had clipped a coupon in my arrival book which made the price better. Motel staff was corteous to me. I did find the casino to be a bit smokey, but I find many to be that way, as I am a non-smoking asthmatic. They did provide me with a non-smoking room. I think Atlantic City will soon be totally smoke free, and I can't wait for that to happen nationwide. If you are expecting total luxury accomodations, this isn't it, but you are not paying for it, either. On the other hands, the rooms compare to any standard motel and are a good value....I had all that I needed, including hairdryer and iron/ironing board......the room was clean, comfortable, and I had a nice view. I like the whole Fremont street thing....old Vegas....the gambling (and everything) is cheaper, you can get around very fast, etc.....I actually think you get a more "down home/down to earth" feeling there than the extravagance of the strip. I would go back to the Fitz, and as long as Fremont Street is offering better deals, there is a good chance I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fitzgerald's on Fremont Street - NOT close to strip”
Reviews.Author: finkenator9
Reviews.Content: First, we will NOT be staying here ever again. We reserved our trip and room five months in advance for a king size bed and received a room with double beds because they said, "reservations are requests," with no guarantee that you will get what you reserved. VERY BAD first impression. The guy checking us in didn't even make eye contact with us. We complained twice before getting a king bed the next day. We had to switch rooms and had to wait on them to switch. Our room was average, very few TV channels, small TV, cheap furniture. The bed was pretty comfortable, but the A/C was loud and didn't work very well. The bathroom was average size and the water pressure is good, but the wall paper was pealing off and the shower head was loose and coming out of the wall. The housekeeping was average, but the second night we noticed a shortcut taken. They put a full size bed sheet across the king bed sideways instead of getting a king size fitted bed sheet. This is a bad sign! Parking is free, access the self-parking garage from the rear (3rd St.), just write your name and room number on the ticket and you'll never pay for parking. Otherwise, I think it's $1.50/hr. Some of the buttons didn't work on the old phone and there were no maps of the casino telling you where anything was. Fremont St. is pretty neat with shopping and access to the other casino's within a short walk. There is McDonalds and Krispy Kreme donuts in the Fitzgerald's, and Dunkin Donuts in Four Queens. We didn't eat at the casino restaurants, but they looked ok. The Fitzgerald's, and the rest of downtown, is a long way from the Strip. You shouldn't walk it. It's too far, plus it's not safe walking around downtown outside the safety of the casino's. If you do go to the Strip, park at the Excalibur, which is street level and free parking, and it's a short walk to the rest of the Strip. The dealers at the casino are friendly and never felt crowded during the week. Traffic is horrendous on the Strip and especially bad in the morning and afternoon from 3-6pm because thousands of workers need to get to work in a few block radius. You don't need a car, just use the casino shuttles.

Reviews.Title: “Find a Different Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: RedskinsFrisco_Texas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Fitzgerald Hotel on Freemont Street from 3/16-3-20. Have stayed there the past 3 times and this was the worst! Bed was horrible; had to call 3 days, several times a day, to get a hair dryer in the room. Towels were paper thin, room was just run down and OLD. Management really acted like they could care less as far as our satisfaction went. Have usually had great rooms and great prices for the rooms. Liked the fact that we were so close to so many casinos and could just walk a few feet to go to another casino. Think we will end our streak of staying at the Fitz. Prices were just not worth the sleepless nights and backaches we put up with.

Reviews.Title: “great Fremont St experience”
Reviews.Author: Frosty57
