Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying downtown but it certainly isn't going to be the last. We just booked another trip(again at the Fitz) June 22-29. With all the hype I read on here, I was a bit apprehensive about the elevators but we never had a bit of trouble with them and we were on the 35th floor. They were a bit small but given the age of the building--go figure. Our check in was smooth and all of the service we received was excellent. We really enjoyed the breakfast buffett's. The choices were somewhat limited but then again, it's not the Strip. Killer food, though. We probably were the most impressed about the $$$ we saved eating, shopping--just everything. We still do the Strip via the Duece a few times but all in all, Fremont St and the Fitz works for us. Good comps,too, and several in the mail after our return.

Reviews.Title: “The Country Legends show was excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Minnesotagirl55
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice, the staff very helpful and friendly. The food was great. We will be returning next year to the Fitz.

Reviews.Title: “Not Secure Parking”
Reviews.Author: Batbc
Reviews.Content: I used valet parking thinking it would be a safe area in which my vehicle would be left. My car was broken into by way of the driver side window and a valuable item stolen. I later discovered my vehicle had been parked in an area not covered by video surveillance even though the hotel was not busy. The valet attendant could remember to ask me specifically about the item stolen when I went to retrieve my vehicle but could not recall what it was when he was questioned by security. The contact numbers I have been given result in a voice mail with no return or another number which gets me only "all circuits are busy". I have contacted the casino manager but follow up although promised in a week has not been forthcoming in over three weeks. It is now two months since the incident.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown ~Well Worth It”
Reviews.Author: timbit_c
Reviews.Content: I debated staying at the Fitzgeralds Hotel & Casino because I didn't find many reviews on it. I must say after my stay on the Downtown Strip the first time, this was a BIG step up especially when paying the next to cheapest price. Room was clean, view was ok, but could have been better, maybe facing south instead of east. Only issue was because we were in a room near the Freemont Experience, you could hear it, right up until midnight, but considering the show is about 5 minutes max it wasn't bad. Didn't get a king size bed like I wanted but I expected because I was getting there around midnight, that it might be gone. This hotel was clean, the staff were polite and the Courtyard food was good. The location was perfect because it's located at the East end of the Freemont experience and it's a short block to the bus stop to catch The Deuce to the Strip. Also after your done on the strip and brought back, the bus drops you off across the street (two small doors down) from Fitzgeralds. It was a real plus especially if you walked for hours on the strip. Hung out on the 2nd floor and the slots were pretty loose, didn't get a jackpot but came home 2 bills up. :D

Reviews.Title: “Another Good Stay At The Fitz”
Reviews.Author: p_jay2001
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights comped through a mail offer. Was given a corner room on the 18th floor. If you have stayed at Fitzgeralds in the last ten years, you would recognize this room. They have not upgraded for some time, but the room was clean, and in good condition with the exception of a few wear marks on the dresser. The bathroom was spotless, no mold or mildew as some have reported (see attached photos). The carpet was very clean also, walked on it in white socks and did not pick up any dirt. There is a no charge safe in every room. The AC/heater was new, and much quieter than the old ones. I found the bed and pllows comfortable, and slept very well. The rooms are not giant, or fancy, but they are comfortable and quiet. I had no problems with the elevators during my stay. If I was paying, I would probably choose the newly redecorated rooms next door at the Four Queens, but I would have no problem staying at the Fitz again, especially for $0!!

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: FirealSwords
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our first trip to Vegas. The casino was really smokey, and the elevators are SUPER SLOW! The room wasn't too bad except the bathroom. It smelled like urine, and the bathtub was slimy. The sink was slow-draining. The bed and room itself weren't all that bad, they were clean and didn't smell. One thing that kept driving us nuts was that it was either too hot or too cold in the room. I couldn't keep the A/C unit at a comfy medium.

Reviews.Title: “Very Inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: olek7
Reviews.Content: It is an exteremely cheap Las Vegas which is more suited for elderly people. Young people should not stay there, Vegas downtown area is extremely boring and very much dated. The hotel itself is quite nice for few nights stay with lots of restaurants, even Macdonalds could be found there! Very much dated csino and taht's it! Nothing else. The room was spacious and very nice, but my goodness, we stayed on the top floor (34) and it took 10 minutes to get down or up with only 3 lifts working which stop at each floor. I would give Fitz 2,5 stars, not more. The rate was really attractive. 90 dollars a night for 2 King beds! Were could you find a better rate. Really inexpensive!

Reviews.Title: “Mold, Mold, Mold”
Reviews.Author: donicarosik
Reviews.Content: Nothing about this hotel is good except the price. There was mold EVERYWHERE in the bathroom. The sink took hours to drain even after we took the stopper out. There was rust stains on the floor under the sink. The shower pulsed scalding hot, freezing cold, scalding hot, freezing cold. The beds were like a pile of springs with a sheet over them. There was no internet access; I had to take my laptop to the Krispy Kreme store on the first floor, sit with it on my lap, and tell the clerk to turn on the router in order to access the internet. Since I was traveling for work, this was a HUGE problem. I was there 2 nights. The website says "newly remodeled" but I saw nothing either new or remodeled anywhere in this place. When I complained about the dirty room, the front desk clerk replied, "And you stayed here this long?" They did nothing to accommodate my displeasure. Staff seemed annoyed with me for even mentioning it. Do yourself a favor -- pay the extra few bucks to stay anywhere but Fitzgerald's. I would not stay there for free.

Reviews.Title: “Great, and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: xantippy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Fitz for the second year in a row. Both times, all the staff were very friendly, the food in the restaurant was good (and cheap!) and the room was fine. It's not a fancy hotel, but it's clean, and a great value in Las Vegas. If you don't have a car, "The Deuce" stops nearby, and can be taken to the strip for $2 per ride or $5 for unlimited riding for a 24 hour period. The internet connection in our room wasn't very good (and there was an extra fee from a non-Fitz company), but supposedly there is free internet in the Krispy Kreme donut shop in the casino (if you can find a table). We enjoyed both stays at The Fitz, and will probably stay there again next year if we return to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time At the Fitz”
Reviews.Author: dren_r
Reviews.Content: Great Stay..we got two rooms...both were connecting..worked out great..check in was easy...able to check in at 8am...with no problems..Staff was friendly...would stay there again ...the rooms were nice..no smell of smoke...(stayed in no smoking rooms)..the rooms and the bath rooms were quite large.

Reviews.Title: “Good on a budget”
Reviews.Author: bigbaldal
Reviews.Content: When you book this hotel you have to understand this is not a five star hotel. This was our second time stayin at the fitz. Our first time was last year in October we had a corner room with a great view room was o.k nothing fancy but not worth $100 a night for a weekend rate. This trip we requested the same room but did not get it they gave us a corner room on the opposite side with very little view. The room had a king bed, the bathroom had a jucuzzi tub that worked o.k but the shower was horrible not to bad of water pressure but out of nowhere it would get burning hot than ice cold which was very frustrating. The other bathroom problems was the sink drain was very slow. My friends had a problem with the elevator door opening up in between floors and other people said they had problems to but we didn't have any problems with the elevators they do seem to ride a little rough. We ate at the court yard grill/buffet but the buffet was closed until after christmas so you had to order from the grill I had prime rib special 8oz with baked potato, salad and veggie for $8.95 it was good my wife had a new york strip dinner cooked well done but was burnt on one side. They comped one night so for a 3 night say was $95 dollars so overall this hotel is not perfect and you should know that going in but the staff is very nice top to bottom.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at the Fitz, December 6 to 13, 2007”
Reviews.Author: jgluv2travel
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Fitz. When I booked, I asked for a room on a higher floor and away from the Fremont Street Experience. We got room 3236 facing west with a view of the downtown casinos. It was a good-sized room, clean, comfortable with a large bathroom, a safe, coffeemaker and iron/ironing board. Since we were staying for a week I also requested a fridge, which was delivered the same day. We did experience problems with the plumbing once, and maintenance came minutes after I called. The room could use new carpeting and new sink fixtures, the shower had good water pressure. We had no problems with the elevators, even when the hotel was full. Service was very good. The staff (registration desk, card club personnel and cocktail waitresses were very friendly. Whenever I called the front desk the phone was quickly answered. The card club offered items for joining and comps which we applied to the room cost, as well as cash rewards. Room rates were great - $340 for a week and that was for a busy time -- rodeo days. There is a 24 hour McDonald's if you want a quick bite to eat. We did not eat in the restaurant/buffet after reading the trip reports complaining about the food. But there are many restaurants nearby. I recommend Golden Gate, Las Vegas Club and Lanai at the Fremont. If you plan to go shopping or to the Strip it is a short walk to the bus depot. There was plenty of entertainment on Fremont Street. Note - it costs $7 to $8 for a shuttle to or from the airport. It took us an hour to get from the airport to downtown, because the shuttle dropped people off at hotels on the strip first. To take a taxi to the airport was $28 (not including the tip).

Reviews.Title: “Best comps”
Reviews.Author: jamnreg3
Reviews.Content: I booked my birthday trip to Vegas with USAir vacations for $357.10. Flight, hotel and transfers for 1 person. The flights were on time and nothing special. The hotel was great. I have stayed on the strip and this was better to me. The front desk was fast and even had the requests I made 2 weeks earlier in my reservation. The room was on the 33rd floor overlooking downtown and the Freemont Street Experience. It had everything I needed to rest during the day and catch a nap at night. *** If you are a light sleeper and go to bed before midnight do not stay near the Freemont Street Experience****. Even up on the 33rd floor I could hear everything going on down in the plaza. The elevators were not slow as some had stated in their reviews. In fact my ears popped every time I went up or down they were so fast. The pit bosses remembered my name as well as most of the dealers. This really made me feel good. The food was good and the slots were alot of fun. They even took the time one morning when it was very slow to show me the finer points of roulette and craps. These were two games I had never played before but now I will. I am looking forward to finding another great deal in the spring. I would also recommend joining the slot club of any hotel where you plan to gamble. When I checked out after 4 days of eating and souvenier shopping I had no bill at all. They rate you at every table game as well as slots.

Reviews.Title: “Okay - but not great”
Reviews.Author: RosaElliott
Reviews.Content: Just back from Vegas, stayed 4 nights at the Main Street then over to the Fitz for two, we were on the third floor, I would say that the rooms are going down hill, not that clean, the bedding is terrible, the sheets are paper thin and they put a flat on the mattress which does not stay on. Very tired and old, needs remodelling. The bathtowels are like paper and they only give you one each, dispute asking for more. Also they charge $30.00 to your credit card per night (for what I do not know) and they you are credited. They also charge $1.00 for local calls. The mattress was hard - sore back in the morning. The a/c was okay but I do not think it would that great during the summer months. Did not gamble there much at all, too smokey, no waitresses to be found for miles. It's okay if you are only want a place to crash for the night. But the Main Street is 100% better. CHEERS!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the Fitz”
Reviews.Author: VAmanAlexandria
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 34th floor. The place was clean and looked good. There were no issues with hot water or slow elevators as previous people have posted. Plus the hotel was full! The employees in the hotel and in the casino were eager to please. Sure you can find hotels with thicker towels or softer pillows .... but for the money you can't beat the Fitz.

Reviews.Title: “Felt right at home!”
Reviews.Author: specialk817
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to stay in Las Vegas for our eighth wedding anniversary, but we didn't know which hotel-casino to stay at. We figured we had such a wonderful time at Fitzgeralds in Tunica, Ms ( my husband called this his kingdom) Why not book a room at Fitzgeralds in Vegas! I am so happy we did. We had a great experience in Vegas thanks to Fitzgerald's and it's staff. They were so helpful and polite. Just wanted to say thanks! David and Kathy D. Slidell, La.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: fightingamish00
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just average and some things about the room were below standards than what would be expected even at this price (55-60 dollars/night). First of all, the check in was not very smooth at all. They had a problem finding my reservation even though I had booked it 2 months in advance. It's a good thing I had the paperwork with me or I would have really been in trouble. The room overall was average at best but the biggest problem for me was in the bathroom. First, the towels were thin and small and it's a good thing I was staying by myself b/c it took at least two of them to dry me off (and I'm not that big a person). The shower took a while to get warmed up and was also not very clean looking. There were cracks in the walls and tub and the toilet didn't flush very well either. The bathroom's poor shape is what prevents me from recommending this place. On a more positive note, the staffs and employees were especially nice and the buffet staff was extremely pleasant. I really liked the casino but the sportsbook was a bit of a disappointment. It's a good place to stay for the price but there are some hurdles you must overcome and look past. 2/5 stars

Reviews.Title: “Fitzgeralds Las Vegas stay”
Reviews.Author: billshirley
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Fitz every year around New Years. Our treatment gets better every year. Last year was exceptional. Bill and Shirley Beaty

Reviews.Title: “Good Time at Fitzgeralds”
Reviews.Author: aide4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Fitzgeralds from Sept. 7-11, we were part of a group of 10 . Check in was a breeze, our room was just fine. The elevators were not slow as other posters have stated, the only time there was a wait at all was on Sunday morning when alot of people were checking out. The a/c worked great, it was nice having a safe in the room to put our valuables. Housekeeping was wonderful also. We would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: gerryquin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at fitzgeralds 5-9 september. As always, customer service was first rate. rooms, no problem...ac worked too well.....a little noise from bands playing on freemont street but I requested a low floor so no complaint. elevators were sometimes slow......but no slower than other places i have played.....came home a winner at the casino.........i have stayed at fitzgeralds last 5 trips and plan to again.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: beeka30tf
Reviews.Content: The stay was OK for the price. My husband and I pretty much enjoyed our first visit to Vegas. The hotel was like any other hotel for the same price. We spent alot of time in the room and didn't have much to complain about. The view was great! The hotel staff were super friendly and I enjoyed communicating with them. The staff at the front desk were very helpful. We won't have a problem staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Fitz is ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: booktechie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fitz for four nights last week of August 2007. This was my first downtown experience. There are plus and minuses at this property that was supposedly renovated a few years ago. My room was on the 24th floor with a fair northly view. Although the room was supposedly non-smoking there is some tobacco smell (perhaps coming from the floor below?) but it's not strong. The room is good sized, bedding and towels clean, two queen sized beds were rather firm and the mattresses seem new. No bedbugs. I could not tell if the carpeting had been recently steam cleaned because it was a dark shade (chocolate) but walking on it with bare feet was ok. The carpeting is coming up in spots. There is a secure wall safe w/key (no deposit), a hair dryer, and iron/ironing borad. The room lighting is adequate but one ceiling light needed a new bulb. The television is ok but the choice of channels is limited. Closet space good. Furniture is ok and not worn. The bathroom was clean and there is plenty of counterspace for personal toiletries. The hotel provides your basic soap and shampoo and these were adequate. Lack of an exhaust fan means that moisture will remain on the walls and ceiling, which in turn means mold. Just abit of mold above the shower. A serious problem is the shower curtain. Some idiot did not include a plastic curtain to go with the fabric one which means water on the floor every time I used the shower. I had to use a bath towel to sop up water. One good slip on the floor and you can say lawsuit! The shower faucet had a leak (waste of water). Unlike other hotels in Las Vegas the Fitz does not seem ecology minded (they don't ask guests to conserve water and reuse towels). The air conditioner was fine and not too noisy and does help cover some of the music from the Fremont Experience. The Fitz badly needs window washing. The exterior corridors are clean with less wear or wall marks than I have seen at some upscale hotels including the Luxor. Major problem is the elevators. Only three of the four were in operation and a few times I waited for 10 minutes for one. This could be a big problem in a medical emergency (there are separate service elevators not accessible to the public). The hotel itself is clean and fairly easy to navigate. The casino seems easily accessible for those who are handicapped (not so in certain other hotels). Directional signage could be improved. One good thing is that the hotel/casino is not so big that one spends 20 minutes getting to a restaurant. There are some entertainment options that I did not partake. The buffet is closed until later in Sept. The restaurant does not have a huge selection or variety on the menu but it 's not too expensive and the portions are large. My one big complaint is that sometimes noise from renovations in the buffet area can interfere with eating (why not give some discounts for the trouble). Oh yes. This is not a 24 hour restaurant except on weekends; other times there is McDonalds. The steakhouse looks good but I did not try the food (reservations suggested and I suggest dressing up some). The Vue bar has outdoor seating above street level. It has appetizers that come from the restaurant. Customer service is good and staff seem friendlier than at hotels on the Strip. Housekeeping did a good job. I had no problems with check-in or check-out but then there were no lines of people. My overall impression is that the Fitz is ok for the budget minded and especially if one gets a cheap package deal. It is close to the Duece bus stop. I won't comment on the gambling but as nearby gaming options are easily walkable the Fitz has a good location. Fitzgeralds compares in quality to the Riviera but is less expensive. I hope they add some elevators, and please, get a good shower curtain!

Reviews.Title: “Overall "great"”
Reviews.Author: j1golfer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed downtown Vegas for at least the last 10 years. First it was Lady Luck, then when it became run-down, I chose to try Fitzgeralds. Been going there ever since. I recommend this property to anyone who goes to Vegas to gamble and walk to other casinos. If it was a honeymooner, or first time young person they belong on the strip. I don't need the BIG casinos, and I can't walk the distance of the strip like I did years ago. Fitzgeralds has the restaurants, casino, and neat/clean rooms. Everyone whom told about this hotel has stayed there and thought it was great. Being able to walk to other casinos, and feel safe about it, is one of the best things about downtown. We rent a car, travel around, back to Fitzgeralds, and enjoy the Fremont experience. Also, the price is right!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not comfortable”
Reviews.Author: emos-15
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst budget hotels I have stayed in. Its decorated in a very old fashion way or rather never upgraded since it was built in dunno when. The patterns on the carpet made me really dizzy, the giant air cons were so old and loud, no fridges, beds seems so worn and too bouncy, sinks choke easily plus i can hear the next room when they used their taps! Some of the lightings were also spoilt when we first stepped into the room. Luckily the hotel did send someone to fix it once we asked. But even with all the lights functioning...its still very dark and certainly made me feel very uneasy in the room. Moreover, I was there with my husband but was given a room with two double beds instead of a king bed. I certainedly won't think this is a place for couples to spend time but more for gamblers on a cheap weekend getaway. I guess the only redeeming factor is the view of downtown for rooms on higher levels. Otherwise i just count myself lucky that there are no cockroaches.

Reviews.Title: “I Love This Place!!!!”
Reviews.Author: slotspinner
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fitz for our first downtown adventure, and I highly reccommend it!! Sure, it is not as flashy as many of those on the Strip, but we felt safe, the rooms were neat , clean, water pressure good, water temp hot, and beds great!! What more is important? My husband discovered poker rooms so his trip was great. I found three slot machines that just hit for me!! I'll definitely visit again and encourage my clients to give the Fitz a try also!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware: Stay somewhere else!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: chadschick
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fitz July 2007 for our wedding. When we checked in, we found out that we will be charged an extra $30.00 a day for "security deposits". We told the manager that we were unaware of this and he said that we were told when we made our reservation. This is not true, being on a budget, we would remember this important information. I asked my other guests about this and they were all unaware. This is only the begining. We had requested months in advance if we can all be on the same floor, they scattered us everywhere, at least 2 floors between us, not 1 guest was on the same floor with us. My mother was given a room that was still occupied with hotel guests. This made me angry since they have a computer in front of their faces to know if a room is vacant or not. We had to change our room also. My new brother in-law had water and a/c problems. A tech came to work on his a/c, cutting his hand and bleeding everywhere. My maid of honor had water problems and my father had problems with his hotel key, he was switched to another room as well. These were most of the major probles we had, many more had accured. Do you think we received an apology from the manager? No he just stood there raising his voice at us like we were children. This was unacceptable behavior for customer service, i know because i've worked in customer service for many years and know that i should always make guests feel welcomed. I do not reccomand anyone staying at the Fitz. PLEASE STAY ELSEWHERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Really Gone Downhill!”
Reviews.Author: vegasluvr
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Fitz many times. It has always been a basic, clean hotel for the money. We love downtown and usually stay here or the Golden Nugget depending on the rates. This year we chose Fitzgerald's and what a mistake that was! It was the worst experience we've had there in the half dozen times we've stayed. Very long line for check-in...didn't seem very organized. Got to our room on the 17th floor and the a/c was not working properly. Long story short, we had to move twice before I had to call a manager and demand a room with an a/c unit that worked. My husband said they were timed out to shut down after so many minutes...a money saving tactic. Mind you, this was June in Vegas!!! On top of that, the maintance man they sent to the first room tried to make us believe it was just too hot outside to cool the room!So I guess every single hotel room in Vegas is sweltering in the summer there?!? Basically all the staff we dealt with during this issue made us feel as if we were "complainers", which I most certainly am not! It had to have been at least 82 degrees in that room! We will never stay at Fitzgerald's again and will stay at the Nugget or one of the other downtown hotels. What a shame that the place has deteriorated so much.

Reviews.Title: “Old”
Reviews.Author: payingitforward1
Reviews.Content: This place is old and impersonal. The beds are not comfortable. The conspicuious security presence makes one feel uneasy. If you really need to stay downtown, and there really is no need to, stay at the luxurious Golden Nugget for a few bucks more.

Reviews.Title: “the fitzgeralds is ok”
Reviews.Author: kgl1720
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the fitzgeralds july 15 thur the 17,I was worried with all the bad reviews I had read. everthing was just fine we stayed on the 34th floor and the rooms were very nice and clean and did not smell, the elevators worked just fine never had to wait more then a few minutes,the only thing we didnt like was where the pool was you had to walk through the casino to get to the pool,but once you got there the pool area was very nice.I have stayed all over vegas in the last 25 years you are right downtown and can walk all over which I loved.,I never ate at the fitzgeralds but I like eating at golden nugget buffet and tony romas.No it isnt the most beautiful casino but for the price you pay for a room you cant go wrong.KK

Reviews.Title: “Attitude is Everything”
Reviews.Author: lovesVegas12
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love Vegas,and I had never stayed Downtown, so when we got such a great price for flight and room from Boston we thought we'd give it a go. I would definitely stay Downtown again , but I would probably pick another property. I think 30-50 minutes for the elevator was just too much.Plus because most of the elevators were broken,people kept trying to cram in. We checked out the day the elevator fell, but were told to do it again 2 days later, that was the package deal.I thought the Fitz might contact us about our problem, but they didn't. On the bright side, Fremont Street is a blast,everything is less expensive in this area,and there is plenty to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible ”
Reviews.Author: nannyHouston_Texas
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Vegas and our stay at the Fitz was TERRIBLE. The rooms were very smelly, the carpet was so bad that you bet not put your feet on the ground. The showers had a foul smell, we had to wait 45 minutes to catch an elevator (every day we was there). While we were there the elevator dropped. All the employees were telling us to be careful because they had just had a crash on the elevator causing injuries to several of the people that was on the elevator. The front desk staff was very rude. We were there for 3 nights and 4 days and it was the worst hotel experience I have ever had. Molly's buffet that they advertise was under renovation, but they don't tell you that when you are booking the rooms. I will never stay at the hotel again. There were 22 of us that went, we reserved 10 rooms and all of the rooms were HORRIBLE.

Reviews.Title: “Continuing Elevator Problems”
Reviews.Author: hubcap66
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 4-7 Jul 07. 3 out of 4 elevators were operational and could not handle the people. We had to use emergency stairs on two occasions. This is a continuing problem at Fitzgeralds. It would appear that Fitz's mgt would get this corrected so folks can be playing in the casino rather then spending time waiting for elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sarealtor
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Fitzgerald on several occasions in the past seven years. When I go I take into consideration the age of the establishment and overlook the small problems I have encurred. But, this time was totally the worst hotel experience I have ever experienced in my lifetime. Arriving Sunday, June 24, 2007, there were three of us traveling together, so I had booked two rooms. They showed only one room for three people. (These were pre-paid rooms through a travel agency) Luckly, they had extra rooms, but I had to pay again since they showed no record of the second room. In all the times I had been this seemed to have been the busiest time ever. The elevators weren't working properly and they took us along with others up to our rooms through the service elevators. There were two elevators that were not working. One of which I found out later was due to impatient guest who over loaded it and it fail and engered three people who we heard on the evening news went to the hospital. Monday and Tuesday seemed more pleasant until 1:30am Wednesday morning when someone in my party went to take a shower and due to the forceful water pressure the shower head blew off and hit them flooding the bathroom floor. We had rec'd notice the water would be turned off between the hours of 2:00am and 4:00am Wednesday morning. The shower head incident occurred prior to the time. But, after that time about 5:30am I heard a drip, drip, drip, and got up to investigate and found that the faucet to the vanity sink was running and even throuh the stopper was not closed the sink had filled up and was overflowing onto the bathroom floor. (I'm sure this probaly was due to the excessive water pressure when the water was turned back on.) When maintenance was called we were told they would be right up. (Ya, right!!! 3.5 hrs later). One of the people in my party had to come to my room to shower. When we checked out we spoke to the manager who absolutely showed no empathy , but offered to buy us lunch. (We had just had breakfast and were checking out. Useless!!!) Throughout our stay we over heard several other guest complaining about various things and the employee that they vented to always had an "OH WELL" this happens all the time type of response. The Fitzgerald Hotel & Casino just lost three guest and really don't seem to care. It seems odd to me that most of the older Hotels & Casino's have remodeled or done some upgrades in some way or another, except for the Fitzgerald.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and it shows”
Reviews.Author: mslefreeman
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and our room was not ready. The lady at the desk went ahead and checked us in, but said that we would have to return to pick up a key. I asked for a room on a high floor and away from the freemont experience as I had read other reviews that said that was the best, and of course we were told that none were available. Our room was on the fifth floor right on the corner, with the rainbow right under our window. The room was not the cleanest and the furniture was old and worn. The noise was a bit bothersone and the thumping from the bass kept us up at night. The staff was not too friendly, but not rude either. It is a cheap place to stay, and if you are on a budget I guess that it is not horrible. I would not stay here agian.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: jb247
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from Las Vegas. We stayed at the Fitz for the first time. This was my first time staying downtown and we absolutely loved it! Yes, the Fitz is old, but considering what you pay to stay there it is perfect. If you are like most people, the room is used to shower, lay your head down for a few hours...and maybe a couple of other things ;) Everybody there was extremely friendly, and you can walk to anywhere on Freemont Street. The only complaint I would have about the hotel is that the elevators can be a bit slow at check in time. It may take a few minutes to get on one, but just be patient, it will come. Overall I definitely would recommend staying at the Fitz.

Reviews.Title: “Love Fremont street”
Reviews.Author: lynette24
Reviews.Content: Well here I"am again just getting back from, downtown fremont st stay at the Fitzgeralds as always very nice people there everytime I go they always ask what floor do I want this time my room was 3340 very nice veiw,too now for as my winnings!!! 1400 this time, check out my pictures, think those slots know who I"am,, Had a nice week from june 18 to 23-07.

Reviews.Title: “The Fitz - decent”
Reviews.Author: babylou21
Reviews.Content: The Fitz. First time staying here. I was pleasantly surprised. The rooms could certainly use a refresh but I thought everything else was nice. Rooms - Old furnature plus small full size beds. The Rooms could use a refresh. We were on the 16th floor. Never once heard the music or any noise from fremont street. Hallways - I thought the hallways leading to the rooms were pretty nice. I thought at first WOW this could be nice. But as stated before the rooms were average at best with the decour. Parking garage - Make sure your brakes work..Steep ramps.. Casino - I played Video poker and visited the poker room. The casino is not large but had an variety of games. Low stakes and loose slots... Poker room was nice. I only stayed for one tournament. The fitz will surely get a return visit if going on a budget again. For the money it was a bargain. And the gaming was fun. We had a great time playing and hitting the fremont street experience. And we did this in one night... I didn't notice the smoke that everyone seems to say. The casino didn't smell like smoke nor our room. Hallways were nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the price”
Reviews.Author: MaryAnn
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the Fitz from 5/15 to 5/19. We have stayed here previously. The hotel is a good value for what you pay for. It is an older hotel with clean accomodations. We had a corner room with a king size bed on the 18th floor. Elevators were touch and go as far as the waiting time. Staff was very friendly. Would stay there again for the price alone.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Mattresses EVER!”
Reviews.Author: Hottomato100
Reviews.Content: We booked a vacation package and the location of the Fitz sounded like what we were looking for...didn't want to stay on the strip and the Fremont Street Experience was fun. We stayed 4 nights. When we checked in, there were only two employees working the desk and check-in was very slow. We had requested a non-smoking room on the highest possible floor, which we got. We were on the 34th floor and no noise problems. The mattresses, however, were the WORST I have ever slept on! Casino was small and very smokey -- too many penny and nickle machines. Buffet was OK, but not great. Room was fairly clean, but the first morning, there was no coffee in the room, and we never did receive any paper cups in the room. I might stay again, purely for the reasonable cost.

Reviews.Title: “We were impressed!”
Reviews.Author: shiggles7
Reviews.Content: Myself, husband and 3 children just returned from staying at the Fitz in Las Vegas. Honestly, we were very happy staying there. The Valet was so quick on getting our car each day. We were very impressed. Our room was on the 34th floor looking out towards the city. Absolutely gorgeous. The rooms were very nice, with the beds being totally comfortable. The people at the front desk were very helpful and sweet. The service was so great - and that goes for the restaurant. The kids enjoyed McDonalds and we enjoyed Starbucks. The jaccuzzi was nice and hot, and the pool was very refreshing. I liked that there was a lot of shops in walking distance. We do plan on staying at the Fitzgerald Hotel when we come visit again. The casino was busy, but always an open seat. We do recommend this hotel when trying to find one in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Intollerable!”
Reviews.Author: BlueangelOregon
Reviews.Content: My reservation was booked online, when we arrived they gave us our key and room #, when we entered the room we found SOMEONE ELSES BELONGINGS, They had given us a key to an ALREADY OCCUPIED ROOM!! The desk clerk said that they had no other rooms and in a while we were finally given an empty room, the floors were dirty and with no fan in the bathroom there was MOLD AND MILDEW on the ceiling! Overall there was not enough staff and to get service there was quite a wait. Unable to find another room we stayed 3 days, by then we were both sick with bad sinus symptoms. As soon as we found another hotel we left, within a day we both began to feel better! I am beside my self I do NOT understand how this hotel has stayed in bussiness. I have posted pics of the floor and ceiling see for your self!

Reviews.Title: “unnacceptable experience with the room”
Reviews.Author: Machman
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Fitz on a previous trip to Vegas, and found the room to be acceptable. It was functional and clean, with clean being the key factor. That having been said, I thought I would try them again, unfortunately with a much different experience I must say. When I checked in, I just dropped stuff off in the 31st floor room, and headed out without inspecting the room. I wish that I had. When we came in that night, we did not even need to use the toilet, just the sink. The next morning, when we did go in to use the toilet, the toilet still had fecal matter in the bowl from a previous visitor! It did not look like it had been cleaned at all. To top that off, there were suspicious stains on the floor next to the toilet, and there was no shower curtain liner to retain water in the tub. Now, I can understand a room being older and a little worn, frayed carpet, worn our outdated furniture etc, but I think it is 100% all right to expect a clean room. Finding that was disgusting. It made me question how clean any of the room was at that point. To top that off, the staff as a whole is pretty unfriendly. I complained to the manager, who apologized and said that I would be refunded for the room, but it is now a week later and the charge to my card has not been refunded. That will be the last time I stay there. For the price, and what you get, check out other options.

Reviews.Title: “First Timer to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: bosoxbob
Reviews.Content: We wanted a cheap hotel for our first visit to vegas and we were not dissapointed with the Fitz. Rooms were comfortable, the view was great. Showers were hot and the elevators were fine. The casino was the best part. We play let it ride and the table stayed at $5 all day and night. The comps were great, after the second day we did not have to pay for a meal. We will be back, sooner than later.

Reviews.Title: “great as usual!”
Reviews.Author: megbowlstrike
Reviews.Content: Everytime my family and I go to Vegas, we stay at the Fitz. We go to Vegas for the gambling and food, and downtown is the best in our opinion. The gambling is cheap and looser than the strip, and the food is how Vegas used to be. We aren't really impressed by the food at the Fitz--we like the Golden Gate and 4 Queens coffee shops much better. The Golden Nugget's buffet is my favorite. The rooms at the Fitz are large, clean, and cheap. Some of them have been remodeled and are very nice. The others are older but are still a great deal. There can be some nice views since this hotel is the tallest downtown. The elevators are slow--we have experienced that every time at the Fitz. If you're looking for a cheap and clean place with good gambling, then I suggest Fitzgeralds. However, if you're looking for an upscale strip-like resort in the downtown area, check out the Golden Nugget. Although it's 3 times the price of the Fitz, the rooms are very plush and rival those on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “No fleas on me...”
Reviews.Author: NASCAR8
Reviews.Content: Might be ticks on some of those chicks, but there ain't no fleas on me.... One smell of that place and we were out of there !!Gross

Reviews.Title: “Quite pleased with the Fitz...February 26th-March 2”
Reviews.Author: MaryL31
Reviews.Content: Overall, our experience was quite good. Stayed in room 2133; king size bed was quite comfy; pillows a bit soft, but room/bathroom was clean, and housekeeping did a good job and never attempted to get in our room until we removed the privacy sign. All of the staff were helpful and courteous, except for an older man at the Krispy Creme (a bit nasty) and the woman at Mc Donald's (won't get into what nationality for fear of being accused of discrimination) who waited on us twice and did not understand a bit of English either time. Elevators (4 of them) WERE a bit slow at busy times, but most of the time, they weren't bad. Breakfast buffet was not bad, except for the coffee, which was luke warm. Don B's (formerly Limerick's, I believe) was quite good, and their early bird special was a great deal, as was their salad for 2 (I DO love my salad)!!!! Casino was hot and cold...there were times I couldn't lose, and times I just couldn't win...did well at 4 Queens next door. Would definately stay at the Fitz again...biggest complaint? No ticket redemption machines...you HAD to go to the cashier, and the one on the first level always had 2 or 3 people working, but only one of them was dealing with customers. The others were always doing something else.

Reviews.Title: “You could do better.”
Reviews.Author: Stackman97
Reviews.Content: While there wasn't anything terribly wrong with the hotel, one could do better for much the same price at some of the other locations. Pros: -The rooms were clean...a little old but clean. -The staff was helpful. -You walk right out the door and you’re on Freemont. Cons: -You walk right out the door and you’re on Freemont...which means that on a weekend with a band you can hear it in your room...very well. -Parking was a pain. Unless you did valet every time you comeback, you had to wind-up a narrow parking garage for at lest 6 stories (first 6 are reserved for valet) before you could find a spot. You then had to take the elevator down to the casino and then walk across the room to board another elevator to take you to your room floor. -The elevators took forever in the morning as everyone was going for breakfast. It can take 10-15 min. for an elevator. The hotel wasn't bad; I just know that you can do better for pretty close to the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Slow elevators?!Not!”
Reviews.Author: harshba
Reviews.Content: Prior to booking at Fitzgerald's I looked on here for reviews. The key thing I always saw on here was that the elevators were slow as molasses. When I was there over Christmas, I was surprised to find that the elevators were so fast they made my ears pop going up and down. I think what people have to understand is despite there being 4 (or 6? can't remember) elevators, they have to service like 40 floors. What do you want to bet all these people complaining about the slow elevators are riding at the peak times of the day? Yes, the hotel is old, and yes, not all the rooms have been renovated, but you get a lot for what you pay for. I don't think I have ever spent more than $50 a night there, and more common is around $30. It is around the same accross the street at Binions and many of the other downtown hotels. I found our rooms to be not only clean but MORE than acceptable. When I go to Vegas all I want from my room is CLEAN and a shower that works and is clean. If you want a 4 star hotel, then stay in one. If you want a safe, clean, and economical place to stay that is close to everything, then stay at "The Fitz" (or Four Queens, Binion's, etc.). Now if you want to gamble at the hotel you stay at, then I reccomend the 4 Queens for meal comps.

Reviews.Title: “Fitz is okay only”
Reviews.Author: kittee
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend in Vegas and we stayed at Fitzgeralds for three nights. The casino is good, rooms are adequate only, elevators are extremely slow and small. The beds are really hard and pillows are lumpy. On the plus side, we had a corner room and the view was excellent. Also the walk from the elevators to Fremont street was quite short. I think the Fitz's best feature is its small size. I ate at Molly's buffet one morning because I had a coupon, one of the worst buffets I've ever had in my life!

Reviews.Title: “stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: pattia
Reviews.Content: just back from vegas....stayed 2 nights at the Fitz. The rooms are very old. The beds are hard as rocks. The wallpaper was peeling off the walls. The heater was very loud. On the plus side, the shower had good water pressure. Basically you get what you pay for

Reviews.Title: “bad stay”
Reviews.Author: Anchor08
Reviews.Content: There are 70,000 +- folks who need a place to stay twice a year (one week each visit) for the new Furniture Market in Downtown Las Vegas. I have a hard time understanding why Fitzgerald's cannot honor reservations made by myself and others whom set up these reservations months ago for non-smoking rooms and only to find out when we arrive there are none available. I talked to many in our trade and they are of the opinion that the downtown hotels do not want or need our business. We will never make a reservation at a hotel that cannot guarantee non-smoking rooms. The front desk staff at Fitzgerald's basically told us they were sold out and that smoking rooms aren’t that bad. Other words tough sh… Well, were gone!!!!!!!! Garry

Reviews.Title: “loved the Fitz”
Reviews.Author: cabralinfl
Reviews.Content: My 1st time in Vegas, my husbands 5th. It was wonderful, the stay at the Fitz was great, the staff so friendly, they go out of the way to help. I enjoyed the slots especially the Wheel Of Fortune. The food was great. The room was clean and neat. I went to a few other casinos and found out I didn't have to go any further than the Fitz. I wish we could have stayed longer. WE WILL BE BACK!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: RoscoeLaw
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay downtown this year and picked the Fitz because that's where my wife's parents would always stay. It's a nice hotel for the money. We were 10th floor facing the west. The hourly shows on Fremont Street were not a concern... slept right through all of it. The only problem we had was with the television which took a while to warm up and get a picture, but other than that, a great time at the Fitz!

Reviews.Title: “We're regulars at the Fitz”
Reviews.Author: SandradeeOmaha
Reviews.Content: We have been going to the Fitz for years. The location is great. We love to play the table games because the dealers are so friendly. We had never played anything but black jack when we got brave and tried Let it Ride and Pai Gow. I even got up enough nerve to try Craps. All because their staff makes you feel comfortable. They also reward their regular players with comp rooms and that makes it hard to choose another hotel. The last two times we came, we entered their slot tournament. We had a blast. We also love staying downtown. The Fremont experience is fun. The ability to walk from hotel to hotel is nice and we like the relaxed atmosphere. All in all, it can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the $, but won't do it again”
Reviews.Author: LowRain
Reviews.Content: We arrived after midnight and were told that no more non-smoking rooms were available. So we wound up with a room stinking of stale cigarette smoke. The room itself was okay...carpets a little frayed and the drains were slow, but it was clean. The heating unit was really LOUD, and there was not enough heat, which was important since the temps went down to low 30s and high 20s at night during our stay. The casino is too smokey and drafty to enjoy, and some of the poker and slot machines are very old (coins, not tickets), but they are upgrading. We didn't play much in the casino for those reasons. There are so many other nicer, less smokey casinos on Fremont. Although the hotel and casino have their share of shortcomings, the staff are very, very nice, and it is a friendly place. The shows are truly wonderful and inexpensive. I will go to the Fitz again just to see the shows, especially Steve Connolly's "Spirit of the King" -- a great performance! But I won't be staying there ever again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: moml
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Fitz many times, it's like a home away from home. Good food, fun gaming, friendly and helpful staff. Doesn't cost a bundle either! We'd go there any time, and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The best dam casino in downtown Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: wroni
Reviews.Content: In august 2006 myself,my wife Patricia,my stepdaughter Gillian & ..........oh yah my son-in-law Karl stayed at the "FITZ" and never ever regretted it . The staff there could not have been any better .The room's were always clean & cool & the beds were always made with fresh linen.Down stairs in the casino the slots were nice & loose. My wife Pat enjoyed playing the slots and she did pretty well.Gill liked the tables & she did very well also$$$. as for Karley well he's a craps man & 1 night he smoked the table$$$$$.( he's thinking about becomming a pro). As for me well I don't want to talk about it.!! So get off that chair folks & book the "FITZ" to-day, & tell them "Karley" sent you. See you at the "FITZ"!! Bob,Pat, Gill & oh yah .........."KARLEY".

Reviews.Title: “OK Christmas at the Fitz”
Reviews.Author: BHP1
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Fitz on the evening of 22 Dec. having booked four nights. This was our first ever stay downtown but judging from the reports on Trip Advisor we were confident that there would be no problems and for the most part there weren't any. Travelling with my parents who are in their 70's the front desk staff asked if we wanted rooms near the elevator, being unfamiliar with the layout of the building I declined the proposal and we found ourselves with rooms second and third from the front on the 8th floor. We soon discovered that wasn't such a great idea. Sure there was a bit of thumpa thumpa in our rooms but my wife is a very light sleeper and she didn't lose any sleep over it.. After midnight it was barely noticeable. Travelling in Calif. for a week we returned to the Fitz for our last night in Vegas and took elevator rooms on the 10th floor. There was still a bit of vibration even at the back but again no one lost any sleep over it. We didn't try Limerick's or the Buffet but found the Coffee Shop to be quite satisfactory. Overall, the Fitz is well situated, everything is handy, ie Walgreen's, Deuce, souvenirs, etc. We all gave it a big thumbs up and look forward to visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Pick a high floor!”
Reviews.Author: pokergal
Reviews.Content: Fitzgerald's is a great hotel for the price, but pick a high floor and here's why: We originally were on the 6th floor in a corner room. This room was located DIRECTLY ABOVE the Fremont St. Experience. I know we all go to Vegas not to sleep, but if you're tired and it's 2 in the morning, you don't want to hear Kenny Loggins crooning in your ear...that's what happened to us. We requested a higher room the next day and got one on the 21st floor. What a difference! Here were some of the amenities we received on Floor 21 that were not on Floor 6 (besides the quiet!): free newspaper, lighted makeup mirror, hair dryer, data port center. For the money,. the Fitz (high up) is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel questionable housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: dnoelcha
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Las Vegas we stayed at the Fitzgerald. It was, for the most part, great. We checked in with some of the friendliest hotel staff that I had the pleasure of dealing with. Sandra was hilarious and very helpful. There were only two problems that we encountered on a daily basis. There were three of us staying at the hotel on the 27th floor and the shower dripped all 5 days we were there and the housekeeping couldn't seem to understand that if you have 3 guests in the room, you need towels, coffee etc. for 3 people on a daily basis, not two! We had to call every single day we were there for enough amenities for 3 people. Other than that, the place was clean, well lit, very quiet and the view was spectacular. We felt safe in the lobby, even at 4:00 in the morning when my sister and I were by ourself. We never did get to try Limericks. It was closed and under renos every time we went. The breakfast buffet was fabulous with helpful chefs at two stations to make your fresh omelettes. Prices were reasonable at Molly's and the staff were friendly and on their toes giving good service. Security could be seen almost everywhere you looked. We did not break the bank while we were there but plan on going back to try again this October. I would recommend this place to anyone who wants to stay off the hustle and bustle of the Strip and sit on the balcony with a cold one while watching the Fremont Experience.

Reviews.Title: “Room 323”
Reviews.Author: Fisherman167
Reviews.Content: Fitzgeralds room 323 was at the end of the hall across from the stairs and just below and adjacent to the Fremont street experience. The room is about 130’ away from the elevator. The window view is a ground roof view of the roof and an angle view of the FSE metal cover. Standing on your toes you can see the corner of the Fitzgeralds balcony bar. The Nov. rising sun provides plenty on reading light in the low wattage room. You can hear the bass of the Fremont Street Experience. The sound is not real bothersome to me with the air conditioner and TV on. I did not have a problem sleeping, but most people will be bothered. The stairs next to the room come out on the 1st floor inside the high roller roped off area, but that was not useful to me. I could not find a door to the second floor on the stairs. The rooms above (423 & 523 maybe) on floors 4 & 5 dirextly abone appear to have a curved window in the corner of the room, while 323 does not. Fitzgeralds does not have in room internet access, but does have a public (pay?) room downstairs. I could pick up the free wireless signal from Crispi Kreme on the first floor, but it was too weak for me to use. A signal booster might make it work since the donut shop is directly under the room. The TV has a few more channels than other downtown Vegas hotels, still no favorite premium channels but the channels are: 2.KVMY My Network TV 3.KVBC – NBC 4.C-SPAN – II 5.KVVU FOX 6.In room KENO 7.TBS Atlanta 8.KLAS CBS 9.Univision Spanish 10.PBS KLVX 11.WGN Chicago 12.USA 13.KTNV – ABC 14.CNBC 15.MSNBC 16.ESPN 17.CNN 18.Fitzgerald Channel 20.Hotel Info 21.Hotel Info 22.LV Tourism Convention 23.Classical Radio 24.Country Radio 25.Rock Radio 26.News Radio 27.NBC KVBC Channel 3 LV 22.There were (3) adult channels that played free around the clock, which was a real surprise. I noticed you could also purchase them, but they were free in this room on channels 37, 38, and 39. There is also a control lockout for parent or wife. The room had a tiny one cup (10 oz) coffee maker in the bathroom. The small tea or coffee bags with a string will work perfect in it if you bring some. Other fixtures: Ironing board, king bed, iron, free key safe, proterra shampoo, conditioner, lotion, facial bar soap, and large oatmeal bath soap, 2 large towels, 2 medium towels, 2 wash cloths, 3 ash trays, ice bowl with 6 cups, 2 coffee cups, 9 coat hangers, complicated alarm radio clock, king bed with 3 pillows, one closet pillow, 4’ diameter wood table, 2 chairs, one sofa chair, large 2 drawer dresser, 3 drawer wood entertainment center, (2) one drawer night stands, 3 lamps, 2 trash cans, 3 phone books, phone with $1 per call, Philips 29” regular screen TV/remote, in room movies $10.99 each, smoke detector, fire alarm, 3 fire sprinklers, tissues, 3 mirrors, 2 pictures, tissues, and of course toilet paper and bible. I left $1 in the bible for you. The air conditioner could keep the room extremely cold and the fan noise moving the air was the only loud sound. The room was roughly about 30’X17’ including the bathroom. Fitzgeralds has no room service, no hair dryer, and only two electric wall plugs. They do have checkout available on the TV. The hall had a $1.50 20 oz drink machine and a free ice machine. Molly’s Buffet is minimal selection, but has an omelet chef in morning until 11 AM. Buffet breakfast has 2 boxed cereals, make your toast, hash browns, 2 sausages, milk, 5 juices, sodas, 5 pastries/muffins, 2 scrambled eggs, bacon, minimal fruit, and jelly. Coupons are available for Mollys at check in and at the front door in the evening. The Fremont and Golden Nugget Buffet are larger. Molly’s Café is small but has excellent service and a $9.99 steak & shrimp. The 4 Queens, Golden Nugget, and Horseshoe café are better. Smoking is still allowed in specific areas the restaurant, but city laws are expected to isolate smokers soon in all LV city restaurants. MacDonalds is downstairs with $1 double cheeseburgers, $1 sundaes, 1$ frys, 2 for $1 pies, $1 spicy chicken burger, and $3.99 big macs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay Downtown!”
Reviews.Author: luvmytrips
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay at the Fitz. We knew what to expect because it was our third stay there. The location is great! Hotel is clean and comfortable. Four nights free gave us money to spend on other things. There have been several new restaurants opened on Freemont Street, so there is a lot to choose from downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Downtown Vegas”
Reviews.Author: hawaii2vegas
Reviews.Content: It ain't the Jewel of Fremont, but it's fine for downtown. Friendly staff, decent rooms with good views, balcony overlooking FSE, older crowd. Near Neonopolis and Walgreens. Friends staying at other Fremont Street properties nearby said their rooms were ratty, and ours was nicer. I liked it more than my wife did (she prefers the Golden Nugget). My only beef was their old school TV and lack of channels, but who watches much TV in Vegas? Eat elsewhere, though--there's better coffee shop grub at Golden Gate and the Cal, or brew pub fare a couple blocks away at the 777 in Main Street Station. They have a small pool which was not crowded at all. Gaming is okay for a small casino, but very little FPVP, except for a few 10/7DB and FPDW. There is also progressive 8/5 bonus poker at the upstairs bar that seems pretty good depending on the meters--the wife hit a straight flush quarter progressive for $100, for example. Speaking of the upstairs bar, they don't have much in the way of beer selection--Heineken will have to do. Played a little Double Deck BJ, $5 min, 3/2 naturals. I think there was single deck, but not much. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Reviews were Right!”
Reviews.Author: traveller5757
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze, the very helpful and cheerful young lady at the front desk upgraded us to a corner room with a jacuzzi and king-size bed upon finding out we were there for our 5th anniversary. The room was large and clean with a nice bathroom. The staff was exceptional and all had excellent customer service skills, nice to feel like you're a valued guest. The cafe food was good, though I think we'll skip the buffet next time. The food there was good, but the selection was a bit thin. We are planning on staying at Fitzgeralds whenever we return to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for First Timers”
Reviews.Author: jltt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the first week of October, 2 Seniors with 2 adult children. 3 of the 4 were Vegas First Timers. This was the perfect place. Everyone was friendly and helpful. Check in at noon was fast, we were given side by side rooms on the 25th floor with a great western view. The non-smoking rooms were clean and the bathroom was large with great water pressure in the shower. My one requirement was a clean room and I was not disappointed. The casino offered much variety of slots and was small enough that everyone felt comfortable going off on their own knowing we would be able to find each other again. There was a $3 blackjack table during the morning hours. The pool area was small but clean and valet parking was speedy. Everyone loved the downtown area. I would not hesitate to stay here again or recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay at the Fitz”
Reviews.Author: Mogirl50
Reviews.Content: My friend and I go to Vegas at least once a year and have stayed on the strip until this year. Some years ago the downtown area seemed run-down and kind of scary. We didn't even go there for many years. Earlier this year I went with my daughter and since this was her first visit we went downtown. We had a wonderful time and to my surprise they are improving almost all of the hotels and casinos, the streets are cleaner and feel safer, some of the old empty warehouses are opening clubs and eaterys, it was the highlight of our trip. I'm so glad I convinced my friend to stay at Fitzgeralds. Yes, it's older and much smaller than some of the fancy shmancy ones on the strip but that was fine with us. We had no elevator problems and our room was satisfactory. We had a great view of the mountains from our room on the 27th floor. The other casinos seemed so close compared to the long treks from place to place on the strip. We took the Duece to the strip 3 or 4 times and saw what we wanted to see there and then came back to the laid back atmosphere of the Fitz. I would recommend the Fitz and the downtown area to anyone that just wants to relax and enjoy the "old vegas" experience. If I was still a twenty- something with extra energy (and money) I suppose the strip would be the place to stay, but since those days are long gone, Downtown is where I'll stay from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value”
Reviews.Author: drjello
Reviews.Content: just got back from las vegas. we spent 2 nights at the Fitzgeralds Casino & Hotel. it was a very good stay. the check in was very fast, no lines at all. the elevetors are not slow at all. we did not wait more than 2 mins for each time we had to go up or down. our room was at the 25th floor. even though it was on the opposite side of the street we had a great view of the mountains and the city- especially at night. the room was very clean and did not smell of cigarette. the bathroom was very large and clean as well. the pool is ok- nothing spectacular. a little small, but it has a heated jacuzzi. the cool thing is that it is open from 7am to 11pm. it is quite clean and they provide towels. stay away from the buffet- it is cheap (about 7 dollar) but the food is not very good and it does not have a big variety. you'd better spend a few bucks more and go to the next door "paradise buffet" in the fremont hotel and casino which is definetely better and has a lot of better choices. the Fitzgeralds has a good sized casino. it is pretty casual, nothing fancy. you will find mostly locals here. and gambling is WAY cheaper than the strip. it takes about 20 mins to get to the strip by bus and 10 mins by taxi or car. walking to the trip from Fremont street does not look really safe- especially at night. overall we had a good stay- this hotel is a good deal if your traveling on budget.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed Sept 21st-24th”
Reviews.Author: kbarzee
Reviews.Content: I was very nervous to stay at this hotel after I read the reviews that other people left on here. I actually called right after reading the comments to make sure we got a non smoking room. Our room was like any average holiday inn type room. The important thing is that it was clean! yeah! All the staff we spoke with were very courteous. We actually got a room on the end of the hallway so it had a big corner window in the room. We stayed in room 1523. We would definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: dalejr1fan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I go to Las Vegas atleast once a year and we usually stay at the Fitz. We have stayed at many places on the strip but we enjoy the downtown casinos and the Fremont Street Experience better. The staff are great to us we have even got to know some of them by name. The rooms are clean and comfortable and that is all we need. We do go to the strip to see anything new and do some shopping and go to the spa. But when it gets late and you want to go to another casino you do not have to take a cab or walk a mile+ to get back to your hotel. Molly's Buffet is OK. It is rather small compared to many of the buffets in Vegas but for the money you get a good variety. We love the itimacy of it all in a huge city the Fitz makes you feel less intimidated by it all. It has been awhile since we have been to the Fitz but we have plans to be there in October of this year. We were in Vegas in December of a convention and stayed on the strip due to my huband getting a free room. But we went to the Fitz almost every night to see the staff and enjoy the tables.

Reviews.Title: “The Fitzgerald was Good to me”
Reviews.Author: FreezingInMN7
Reviews.Content: I am not sure why these people who write the reviews have so much trouble with everything at the Fritz. This was my second stay there and I can honestly say that it was just as enjoyable this time as the first. Check in was very easy and simple. We got in later in the evening so it wasn't busy. Rooms were just as I remember, two beds, big bathroom, air conditioning was on so the room was nice and cool. The showers are some of the best with very hot water and very good water pressure. No problems in my room, as others have indicate in there reviews trouble with the showers, I haven't noticed it on either of my stays. The first time we stayed we didn't eat at the Fitz for any of our meals with the exception of McD's. This time we ate twice at Molly's Buffet for breakfast. Others say it is bad. I thought it was good. Made to order omellets or eggs however you want them. Fresh fruit, cereal, hot breakfast meats, pastries, and your choice of beverages. What more do you want for a mear $7.00? Try going to the strip for breakfast on $7.00. Any buffet down on the strip is more like double what you pay here. The casino is fantastic for payoffs on slots. I played a lot of slots and more times than not cashed out ahead. The slot attendents were always around to help with change or whatever. The cocktail waitresses were always coming by. I don't think I ever waited more than 5-10 minutes for a drink while playing the slots or table games. The table dealers are pretty friendly. They make it fun to play there. Cabs to the strip are a bit spendy, but if you don't want to cab it, take the Duece double decker bus that comes by. For $5 you can ride for 24 hours anywhere from downtown to the end of the strip. I would definitely stay here again....Over all, another good stay at the Fitzgeralds.

Reviews.Title: “The FITZ Rocked!!!!”
Reviews.Author: memom3x
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd trip to Vegas and our first time downtown. We absolutley loved it and will not stay on the strip again. We were skeptical about staying downtown, but I am glad we did. The Fitz was awesome. The staff was friendly and helpful. There was an issue with the air conditioner, but it was resolved quickly. That is the only negative thing I can say about the Fitz. The poker room was fabulous. We loved the dealers and pitt boss...HI MIKE!!!. The food was good and cheap, and there was a great selection of slots to choose from. We will definetely be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Love the FITZ”
Reviews.Author: fatboy100th
Reviews.Content: Staff is the best. They make you feel at home. Yea the FITZ is older, smells like smoke, booze and cheap women... but that is what Vegas is all about. If you don't like old Vegas, stay on the Strip or better yet vacation at a spa with the rest of the tree huggers and PETA girls. I will choose a good cigar, cold beer and 24hr action anytime. What happens in Vegas stays in Vegas..... If you don't like it stay home... If you do , come party with me in Oct. I'll be back at the FITZ.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Fitzgerald Hotel in Las Vegas, NV. They have problems”
Reviews.Author: miracle53
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Fitzgerald Hotel 3 times before this visit. It was a nghtmare this time. Don't know what has happened there. There was rudeness that started before we even arrived when we tried to get some info from guest services because I am handicapped and in a wheelchair. When we arrived they had our room totally not as requested, then changed us to a room that had no refridgerater in it, less towels and wash clothes than were needed and as we were only staying minus flying time 2 days, waiting to try to get what we needed took up most of our 1'st day. Our air conditioner did not work and it was over 100 degrees there. I had reserved and arranged and paid for my disabled father and mother in law and their room was not handicapped and they had the wrong kind of bed requirement as we did. The only friendly people were the ones in the restaurants inside the hotel. Staff on the second floor of the casino at one point were not to be found and it was not busy there. It has definitely gone very downhill since our last visits and all of them were in the last year. Will not stay again there, nor gamble there again. Also shower water was cold and housekeeping entered our room while we were in there without even knocking, and there was a doorbell outside our room. So steer clear of there if you can! It spoiled our trip there and this was our son's graduation present, whom was a Special Ed student that should have been fun, but we spent too much time, trying to get needs met and could not see all that he wanted to see. We were told they would try to change our room the next day, but never happened and then they messed up our billing and we had to spend time getting that straightened out. In fact it was so bad and can be a little harder trying to travel with a wheelchair that it has caused me to reconsider travleling again, as it is expensive all way round as we flew from Michigan, 1800 miles, not to run into a problem every time we turned around at the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “rude staff, dirty rooms”
Reviews.Author: saja1949
Reviews.Content: We booked a great travel package so stayed at the Fitz. The first room we got was smoking and walls, blankets and rugs were dirty and had cigarette burns and smelled terrible so we asked to be moved to a nonsmoking room. This room was cleaner, still old looking but for the price wasn't bad. We put our luggage in the room and came back in three hours. We tried our key and it wouldn't work. I went to the front desk and she told us we had the wrong room (we had an envelope with the room number written on it and our friends were staying in the room she said was ours). They had given our room to another couple. After much discussion with the woman at the desk, another desk person came over and fixed this mistake. The first woman was rude and said that I was lying about what room was mine! She said to go back to that room and see if my luggage was in fact there. It was and she didn't even apologize. On the third morning at 3 am, the fire alarm went off. We went down 29 flights! When we got down, no one bothered to let us know what was going on. I felt that someone should at least have been at the bottom of the stairs to let us know. On the other hand, we had lost luggage and the bell desk person was super friendly! I would not stay here again as it is old and dirty but mainly because of how we were treated by the staff. S Small, Vt.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty....but expected.”
Reviews.Author: hfm28
Reviews.Content: I made sure to read other reviewer's comments on this hotel and they were not proved wrong. Fitzgeralds is kinda stinky, lacking amenities, the elevators are sloooooooow (imagine stopping EVERY floor for 32 floors) and don't even bother with the pool. Here's the thing, though: you get what you pay for. It isn't expensive to stay here, and it's just a skip away (literally) from the Fremont Street Experience. You're not paying for a boring, subpar room (and they ALL are unless you're VIP) in an overpriced hotel on the strip. The only disadvantage to staying downtown is that you will invariably want to visit the strip, and it's about a $15 cab ride to get you there. If you make sure to get a room on a high floor you will avoid all street noise. The beds are average. If you've been to Vegas before and don't need to "wow" yourself by paying way too much to stay in basically the same-looking room but a fabulous exterior (which isn't enough in my opinion) try to stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay at Fitzgeralds”
Reviews.Author: chitowngambler
Reviews.Content: The Casino was pretty much as I remembered it, nothing fancy, typical for Downtown.. Fun book included two for one drink specials, discounts on hotel logo stuff, a little money off on shows. and a $5.00 match play blackjack or roulette, I did the roulette and got $15.00 back. My room was on the 21st floor, out of I think, 34 floors in the hotel. For an extra 10 bucks, I got an upgraded room, as is my custom. Room # 2134. $39.00 plus $10.00 + $49.00 plus tax, so call it $55.00 a night total.. No extra hidden fees but you were warned of a charge for local calls at $1.00 each and even more for long distance. I used my cell phone, good signal strength from Cingular in the room. Checking in and out was no problem. Electronic door lock and 2 keys. No bugs. I had heard complaints about the elevators but I had no problem with them. There were 4 and they moved pretty fast and there was only a reasonable wait time for them. 21st floor hall was in good shape with new carpet in appealing patterns but it had begun to come up at the seams but I guess hauling those heavy baggage carts around will tear any carpet up over time. Ice machine and soft drink vending machine near the elevators. Quiet in the room, no sound from the hall nor from other rooms except some sound of running water in the bathroom. The A/C could be considered loud by some but I am a city boy and not used to the quiet, so for me it was just a little background “white” noise. Comforting in a way. King sized bed, bedding was fine. 3 pillows plus 2 extras from the shelf in the alcove. Mattress was fine. One could feel the springs through the pad if you worked at it but it was not noticeable when sleeping. The best bed I had so far was at the California, that may have had that memory foam pad, anyway it was a nicer bed than at TI. In the room there was the bed with wall mounted headboard and two night stands, misc. lamps, alarm clock, a small desk and chair, an easy chair on the wall common with the bathroom, a round table and 2 chairs near the window, a dresser and armoire with TV above and drawers below. All in great shape, no sign of wear and everything worked. There was even a shoe buffing machine. Decent sized color TV that got local channels, live Keno and tourist infomercials and CNN. Not a problem because I don’t go there to watch TV anyway, just the local weather and later the weather back home. Remote control worked fine. Carpet, a “lucky Irish” green color, was in good shape, no wear and was clean. General room decor was pleasant. A very few black marks where wall met the luggage carts but not really noticable. Housekeeping staff was efficient but not all spoke English. so there were a few Fawlty Towers moments when the statement that “I will be back at a certain time and please be done by then” was not always understood. One wall was waist to ceiling windows facing west. You had a view of the hotels nearby with mountains in between., you could just see the time and temperature on top of Binions. That was handy to see how hot it really was. 103 at sundown one day, an hour or so later it had dropped 10 degrees to a bone chilling 93. In late afternoon, with the hot sun on the windows, even with the A/C on high and the black out curtains shut, the A/C struggled to keep it cool. It was not hot but could have been cooler. The curtains blew around a little while the A/C was on. Bathroom was fine, it had a tub and shower, a long marble countertop with one basin. Good stuff in small bottles, about standard, not a name brand but it smelled good. 3 sets of bath towels, hand towels and wash cloths. These were not as soft as at home but nor were they the sand paper you get at a lot of places. Shower as fine, the water pressure was very strong, almost too strong, think fire hose. There was no way to turn down the volume of water. After a while in the shower there was some water built up in the tub. By no means a problem for me. Also, in the bathroom was a coffee maker with 2 cups. ample supply of plastic glasses. A hair dryer that started out mounted on the wall then fell off due to a poor anchor bolt. I reported it and it was fixed promptly. Some un-gluing of wallpaper above the shower, probably due to humidity. No closet, your clothes were on a rod in an alcove on your right as you first walked in. A good number of wooden hangers. Shelf above for other stuff. Also an iron and ironing board. Stout room safe mounted in the wall of the alcove, used a key. The hassle with that was where to put the darn thing. I personally prefer a electronic combo safe for that reason. Internal volume was maybe 14 inches by 12 by 4 deep. Probably as big as the one at TI but smaller than the one at California.
