Not quite big enough for a full sized lap top, you could probably put 2 large hard cover books side to side, with a little room to spare. No fee to use the safe. The ground level pool was nice but nothing fancy. A rectangle maybe 30 by 20 and 5 feet deep max. A few palm trees but nothing elaborate. Ample plastic loungers and a good supply of towels. No attendant nor life guard but there were cameras. I noticed security ask a couple with 2 small babies not to put them in the pool. Maybe for safety reasons but frankly they did not look housebroken to me. You could call from drink service. Plenty of sun in mid August and I think it would be sunny in all but the coldest months. Pool was a street level with a wall on 3 sides and a fence on the 4th side facing a drive way. Not right on the street, so no problems with people passing by. Your room key opened a gate. There were washrooms nearby accessed with your room key. Pool was open 7:00 am to 11:00 pm. No glass allowed but discrete cans of beer poured into the plastic glasses were fine.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed traveller of Phoenix Arizona”
Reviews.Author: ziploc
Reviews.Content: The hotel was horrible!! staffs were not friendly and we reserved a non smoking room but they said that they dont have one.. The hallways smells stinks and we have to move from one room to another bacause there carpet was soaking wet due to the malfunctioning of their aircondition... we moved to another room the same thing happen.. while staying there the front lobby was leaking with water from the second floor! it is so embarassing my in-laws were disappointed big time!! they could not sleep at all bacause the room was so smelly. Never again staying in that hotel! they need to fix that problem.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Stay”
Reviews.Author: MomsTuxedo
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Friday afternoon. The room was ready for us, looked clean & comfortable. We left for the evening & to connect with friends that were coming in to the same hotel for the Mother's Day weekend. When we got back to our room, my daughter & I both showered but noticed that the tub was not draining. She called housekeeping to report it & was told it would be taken care of the next morning. We got back from our Mother's Day brunch at 2:00 pm to find BLACK SLUDGE all over the ceiling, tub, toilet & floor. (But the tub drained). She again called and talked to housekeeping who assured us that they would have it all cleaned up by the time we got back that night. We arrived back at the room at 2:00 am to find a newly painted ceiling over the tub, but nothing else cleaned in the bathroom. Daughter called housekeeping again, then the front desk, and was offered another room which we refused (what was to say it wouldn't be just as bad), so was assured that the problem would be taken care of first thing in the morning. We left at 10:00 am, returned at 3:00AM, expecting a nice clean bathroom & a nice long shower, only to find the same mess. This time we got a different housekeeping superior who came with a housekeeper within 5 minutes of our call, complete with two gallons of disinfectant & other cleaning supplies. They were shocked to see the condition of the bathroom and immediatly set forth to fix the problem like it should have been done in the first place. When they left, we could have "eaten" off of the floor or any other surface of that room. I wish we would have gotten their names, because they definately should have been rewarded for THEIR excellence. To bad the rest of the housekeeping help wasn't even half as good as them. In all fairness, the sheets & towels were clean. And the McDonalds all night cafe had milk available for me to take my medications with. Also, our friends had no problem with their room. I was in Motel & Resort Management for many years & would never have allowed a customer to go through what we did with Fitz's. And finally, the management never even gave us an apology. Obviously, we will NEVER stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “OK......”
Reviews.Author: sunnnychick
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fitz on July 14th &15th. We have been to vegas many times but never stayed downtown. We normally don't use TA's but we booked our airfare through one and got two nights at the Fitz for mere pennies more. We arrived not expecting much after reading all the reviews on here. Check-in was quick and painless for arriving at 5pm on a Friday. The front desk staff was pleasant. We requested a room on a high floor despite the complaints about the elevators. We got a corner room on the 25th floor. The room was outdated, the bedspreads worn and there was an empty spot above one of the beds where a picure once hung. The bathroom was a nice size with good water pressure. We had an excellent view of the mountains and it was nice to watch the sun come up in the morning. The beds were not very comfortable but after staying out gambling till the wee hours it didn't bother us too much, if we were staying more than two nights it would have really disappointed me. The comments about the elevators were completely true. We waited about ten minutes every time we had to go up to our room. And coming down, we stopped at nearly every floor. Plus, the elevators were hot and because of the long waits, you were often crammed in with a lot of others making for an uncomfortable ride. We used the parking garage and that was a horror as well. The valet takes up the first six floors and maneuvering around is difficult , especially with a bigger car. I'm sure there have been plenty of accidents in there. The pool is small and located next to the parking garage, but it was very clean and uncrowded. Another plus, its open till 11pm, unlike some strip properties. We liked the location, and being downtown, but probably wouldn't stay there again. If you go there not expecting much, you probably won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fitzgeralds - the worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: snowsden
Reviews.Content: This hotel was horrible, we stayed 3 days due to prepayment and couldn't get a refund. We ended up with 3 different rooms, the first one was a "non-smoking" room and the carpet and all the furniture was burned from cigarettes, the bedspreads were smelly and tattered, room was dirty and the beds were worn out and sunken in the middle with the springs digging into you. The shower wouldn't drain and the toilet wouldn't flush so off to another room, (in the same shape I might add) only to find that afternoon upon returning to the room that the air conditioner wouldn't work, it must have been 120 degrees in there, after a serious fight in the lobby, off to another room. The last morning was the last straw when we woke up to find a roach in the bed and once again the toilet wouldn't flush. We left and went over to the Golden Nugget which was one of the finest hotels I have ever stayed in. After talking to several people, I came to the conclusion that all the rooms were the same as I saw many people complaining about this hotel. I was told by management that since this new man bought the hotel, he has done nothing to update it or spend any money on it.

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Krozair
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights at the Fitz. We found it vey comfortable, and the employees were very helpful. We always stay out all night, and sleep during the day. We NEVER were disturbed by the maids, although they did a great job of cleaning the room as soon as we dragged ourselves out of bed. Other visitors have commented about slow elevators. Not so. We never had more than a 2 minute wait, and we were on floor 17. The wall safes are a great bonus. We made constant use of them. The food was average. Not bad, but not quite the level of some others. Drink service at the casino was very prompt. All in all, we will probably stay there again, especially since they are so reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Fitzgeralds was Awful”
Reviews.Author: Shorewooder
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at Fitgeralds on June 2nd and 3rd. We arrived about 11PM and were a bit uncomfortable with the downtown area. Our room was awful! It was on the 9th floor and it was filthy! Unfortunately, we did not realize how bad it was until we were already in our PJs. I thought the sink in the bathroom was just old and dingy - then realized it was filthy - coffee grounds and dirt. I cleaned it and then we went on to other disasters. The sheets were dirty - probably unchanged for the last guests - we found hair and cigarrete burns on the sheets. We also discovered dried blood on the bathroom mirror. The air condtioner was deafening. We woke early planning to get out, but since it was a Saturday night, I was worried that we would pay top dollar for a room at another hotel. I explained the condition of the room at the front desk and recieved an apology and the offer of a new room. We were sent to the 20th floor to a corner room that was clean but very old and in need of updating. Again the air condtioner was very loud. This was a corenr room and would have had a very good view, but the wondows were quite dirty. It was suggested that I stop back to talk to the manager but each time I checked the manager was not avaialbe. Due to the flith, we did not feel comfortable eating at the hotel and just walked through the casino. Fitzgeralds was recommeded by a travel agent who said that her sister had stayed there and was very picky, and she said it was OK. It was not!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!! We loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: denaerin
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying at the Fitz for 3 nights, May25th-28th/06. I highly recommend this hotel, I have been to Vegas three times now and this is the first time staying downtown. LOVED IT!! We were a little worried about it cuz being Canadian, we didn't know about the long weekend until after we booked the trip. But it was great. The staff are casual, friendly and helpful. Just avoid the entrance under the 'pot of gold' unless you want to always be asked about the time shares. The elevators weren't slow at all. When we booked, we asked for a view, king size bed and non-smoking room and were told it may not be possible cuz of the long weekend but at check-in we were pleasantly surprised to get all our requests. Downtown is so much nicer and less packed than the strip. We almost didn't leave at all but since it was my friends first Vegas experience, I had to show him other stuff as well. One thing we did that's new downtown that we highly recommend is the Vintage Vegas Walking Tour. Go to the Las Vegas Gambling Museum in Neonopolis on Fremont. The tour guide, Tim was very friendly and gave us lots of interesting facts about old Vegas (mobsters, Howard Hughes, Bugsy...etc). The patio on the second floor is a great place to watch the Fremont Experience, or just people watch. We highly recommend staying here!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad At All. . .”
Reviews.Author: Eddiebo
Reviews.Content: I wish they ahd a 3.5 rating. I really like the Fitz but I don't know if I'd give it an "Above Average" rating. My wife and I and another couple just spent a couple of nights at the Fitz. It was a great deal. We booked it via America West Vacations and for a Friday and Saturday night stay (airfare for two from Denver included) for a total of $467. Super bargain! The room. . . They put us on the 25th floor (of 34) and the West facing view was pretty cool. Pretty vanilla room but very comfortable beds, shower was GREAT (very powerful) and it was clean. Can't ask for more for the money. The casino. . . Super friendly dealers and low limit games. Poker room is coming soon. Staff . . . The staff was great all the way around. Downtown. . . . If you've never stayed in downtown Vegas, you HAVE to. Walking around Freemont Street is a blast. Especially at night with the light show. Plus, it's a two minute walk from casino to casino instead of a cab ride. Good times. Oh. . . Best of all! Krispy Kream downstairs just off the casino on Freemont Street.

Reviews.Title: “No problems at the Fritz.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fritz April 24-28 of 2006. The was our first time staying downtown and found it to be great. Every casino and shopping is just a short walk, not like on the strip where you have to walk long distances to see everything. We found the hotel to be very clean and the staff was very friendly. We had some concerns from others that left reviews on the Fritz, but wanted to find out for ourselfs. The rooms had everything that was needed including extra pillows and the AC worked just fine. The elevators were quick with very little waiting time. We ate at all the buffets downtown and all were decent but found the Golden Nugget to be the best downtown. On our next trip we will stay at the Fitzgeralds again.

Reviews.Title: “Walked 11 floors of stairs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: FITZGERALD'S CASINO & HOTEL, DOWNTOWN LAS VEGAS We stayed at Fitzgerald's April 12-15, 2006. I have to commend the hotel staff as very friendly. On previous occasions we gambled at their 5 cent slots and found them loose and enjoyed the long play, but this time they were very tight. This was the first time we stayed in overnight in their rooms. We prefer larger rooms and asked for a suite. We were told customers can ask for upgrades when they check in, but cannot reserve suites ahead of time. We were also told that they had deluxe rooms (regular rooms), the club suite (for player's card holders, when available), and luxury suites (which were supposedly very nice and an additional $100 a night). We also asked about internet access which I need for my work, and were told yes, it is available. When we arrived, we upgraded to a club suite because no luxury suites were available. The only difference between a club suite and a regular (deluxe) room is a coffee pot, hair dryer, ironing board and bottles of water. The room size is no different than a regular room. There were no luxury suites available. The club suites were small rooms, with two beds, poor a/c-fan circulation and a flickering tv set. Since we didn't plan to spend much time in the room, we decided to rough it. This worked fine until the elevators quit working. Two days in a row, my husband walked down 11 floors of stairs along with many other guests. At least we were not on the 32 floor as some of his companions were. The elevators would go on the blink and stop at every single floor all the way up to 32 and all the way down to one. We were unable to board a down elevator during this time, so in order to use the elevator and not walk (which was not an option for me) we were forced to get on the elevator traveling up from floor eleven to floor 32, then back down to floor one. This took 25 minutes each time with nauseating stops at every floor all the way up and back down. I am diabetic, bad knee, and have Meniere's (a type of motion sickness). When we called the front desk to request a service elevator (which were working) for my transportation, we were refused. We explained that I had taken a insulin shot and needed to eat within 30 minutes, but were still refused. They offered to send room service but we knew that would take over an hour. I rode the elevator, without recourse, and we just stayed downstairs and avoided the rooms and elevators. As far as we know, no one was offered compensation for the inconvenience. We checked out a day early due to the elevators, and during check out we asked a bell hop if the elevator problems occurred often, and he nodded.

Reviews.Title: “The jolly green giant”
Reviews.Author: philij
Reviews.Content: 3rd stay at fitzgeralds...clean rooms...got a room change no problem...one of the best downtown hotels. Phil Joste UK.

Reviews.Title: “Nice downtown site”
Reviews.Author: OldOkie
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights at Fitz. Its agreat location to walk around under the dome. Found 2 for 1 buffet coupons for Fitzgralds, Freemont and Main Street. Main Street has the best buffet. Fitzgeralds was very clean but the bedding was below average. Plenty of drink bargins and live street music downtown. Going to the Strip take Las Vegas Blvd and come back in on 4th less traffic and lights.. The parking gargage is on 3rd.

Reviews.Title: “We're going back!”
Reviews.Author: fancy2572
Reviews.Content: I really went back and forth on my rating, between average and above average. I decided on average because when we returned from our 10 day stay at Fitzgeralds last year, I wrote a letter to management complaining about several issues that we had while we were there. THE NEGATIVES: When we checked in, we were told that the room with a king bed that I had reserved several months in advance was not available and that we would have to take two double beds instead. The desk clerk knew we were on our honeymoon, but refused to upgrade us or try to accomodate us regarding this. If we wanted a suite, she informed us it would be an extra $100 per day. We were on the 27th floor and when we arrived there, we found that the soda machine on our floor was broken and the ice machine dispensed so slowly it took almost five minutes to fill a bucket. Therefore, whenever we wanted a beverage, we had to go up or down a floor. We were also very disappointed that there was no refrigerator in our room, which was a major annoyance due to the length of our stay. Also, with several restaurants in the hotel, we were very surprised that they offered no room service. The elevators were very slow while we were there. We waited on average 5 to 10 minutes, sometimes longer, sometimes shorter. We really didn't mind waiting for them unless we were in a hurry. Which wasn't often because we were on vacation! We ate twice in Molly's buffet; one lunch and one breakfast. Compared to other buffets available in Vegas, this one we found to be overpriced and very limited in selection. Disappointing. We also ate at their coffee shop which is attached to the buffet on our last night there. This was most definitely the worst service we received during our stay. We waited almost half an hour just for the waitress to take our order, then were forced to order off of an extremely limited "late night" menu, then waited nearly an hour for our food. Not a great experience. THE POSITIVES: Our room was surprisingly spacious with an absolutely breathtaking view of the mountains. It was also extremely clean. We had housekeeping in every day to clean and they always left us extra towels and linens without us even having to ask. The room had a small safe so we were able to safely store our valuables as well. With the exception of the desk clerk that checked us in, we absolutely loved the staff at Fitzgeralds! Everyone was unfailingly friendly, polite and helpful, from the cocktail waitresses, table dealers, bartenders, cashiers, security, everyone! Plus, since we were there for 10 days, many of them took notice of us and went out of their way to greet us specially and make conversation. We felt very wanted there and it was wonderful. The casino was great! The slots were pretty loose espeically when compared to the strip. Plus, my husband tried his hand at blackjack, which he had never played before. The dealer went out of his way to help him and gave him tips on how to play! We also loved the balcony that was off of the bar on the second level. It overlooks Fremont Street and is a great place to sit and watch the light show and just watch the people. They also had karaoke several times while we were staying there and the host was excellent with a great book. Long rotation though, which is par for the course. So, at the beginning of my review, I mentioned that I wrote a letter to management. Well, it took 8 months but I received a response from the Vice President of Operations last November. He apologized for the inconveniences that we suffered during our honeymoon and offered us a return incentive. We will shortly be returning to Fitzgeralds and have been comped a suite there for a week! Can't wait to come back and post my next review!

Reviews.Title: “Great for someone on a budget”
Reviews.Author: walkerdill
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 5 nights at the hotel. The rooms are average sized and nothing fantastic but are clean though. The bathroom had a coffee maker & hair dryer. They do not have Room Service! If you are going to vegas on a budget it is perfect. If you like Fremont St. over the strip it will do. If you think your going to take the bus to the strip and back everyday you will be sorry! They cram you in those buses like sardines & it takes an hour to get up to the strip. If you plan on doing the tour for the timeshare in the hotel act like you are interested and then say no and they offer you more money to go...but every hotel offers you money to go.

Reviews.Title: “Got the Bang for my Buck!”
Reviews.Author: M3Princess
Reviews.Content: For our 4th trip to downtown LV, we checked into Fitzie's on March 20, 2006 for four nights and have to admit the front desk clerk was the friendliest woman we've ever met. We requested a "room with a view" and she gave us a room on the 31st floor with the most gorgeous view of snow-capped mountains I've ever seen from any hotel in LV! Rooms were decent-sized and clean, and we were raving about the shower pressure the entire time. No matter how grungy we were, that shower made us feel like brand new every time. We didn't have a chance to eat at Fitzie's but played some blackjack. Dealers were not the friendliest and the casino wasn't anything great. We played mostly at Fremont, Binion's and Golden Nugget where we've stayed at in the past and always get comped for our meals. All are decent hotels for the price, especially the Golden Nugget. Fitzie's parking garage was a little aggravating - valet parking takes up the first 6 floors. Parking was hard to find at certain times and the garage is very narrow so watch out for those tight turns. The best thing about downtown is the ability to walk to ten different casinos in minutes and have easy access to table games. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves! The bottom line, we'll stay at Fitzie's again in a hearbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great service at The Fitz”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a seven night stay at "The Fitz". Checked in at around 5:15pm Friday 3/17. We were amazed, there was no one in line to check in! We always come to Vegas on the Friday around St Patricks Day and about the same time of day. We have waited in line at other hotels anywhere from 30 to 90 minutes to check in! Asked to be put on an upper floor away from Fremont street, and although the hotel was totally booked (St Patrick's Day & March Madness) request was happily granted. We were given a great room on the 31st floor. We were a bit worried because of some of the comments about the elevators I had read, but our concerns were unfounded. We only had to wait one time during our whole stay and then not more than 3 or 4 minutes. The elevators were very fast. Stayed away from Molly's Buffet until the last night..again, due to the comments I had read. This buffet is not that bad. The selection is small, but everything offered was excellent. We used the discount coupon from the fun book so we didn't pay full price. We both agreed that if we had not gotten a discount we might have felt that it was too expensive for the offerings compared to other downtown buffets. Had a great time at the casino..no big wins, but that's par for us. Great service from cocktail waitresses. Probably better than other downtown casinos. These people crack us up when they complain about rooms. With the turn-over in these hotels, and the way a lot of people treat property, they can and will get a little "worn" between refurbishings. We have stayed at several strip locations over the years and have to say that once you get on the elevator there isn't much difference from one property to the next. As a matter of fact, one of the worst rooms we ever had was in a higher priced popular strip hotel. Our room at The Fitz was clean upon arrival and was maintained during our stay. OK, so one bedspread had been laundered more than the other and was a little faded..hey it was clean! We had a great time at The Fitz and expect to book there again next year for our annual March pilgrimage!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Stay - Dirty Beds and Unresponsive Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This sums up my stay, as it's the complaint letter which I wrote to the hotel - which they didn't respond to. When we checked in, we inspected the room and found ink like stains on the bed linens, so we called the front desk and asked for a room change. The original room was 1841. The front desk said they would change us, and to come down to the front desk to switch out the keys. Having experienced this problem previously elsewhere, many hotels will bring you new keys, instead of making you hall all luggage down to the front desk and then to the new room. It was a minor problem in comparison to the next one I’ll detail, but a problem nonetheless. When we checked into our new room 1941, we noticed the same type of ink like stains on the linens. From this, we just thought it’s a problem in every room, and at least the stains were not directly in the center of the bed. The entry way light blinked violently, and instead of reporting it we decided just not to use it. Our biggest problem with our stay, came from our first night and involved housekeeping. At about 1:15am we were awoken by knocking on our door. In my experience, when you don’t answer people will realize they have the wrong room and walk away – but this was not the case. I heard a voice say something resembling ‘housekeeping’ and they barged into the room. Obviously we were confused, and yelled at the person to get out. They replied by saying something neither of us understood and left. Because of this incident, we had extremely poor sleep that first night, waking up every hour. The next morning, I went down to the front desk to complain to the manager about this incident. I asked the attendant for the manager, but she wanted to help me so I decided to tell her about the incident. She seemed willing to help, and contacted the housekeeping supervisor for an explanation. After the phone call, I impressed upon her that I needed an explanation as to why housekeeping people are coming to my room at 1:15am. I told her the only logical conclusion I could think of, is that they were looking to steal personal belongings. The attendant didn’t disagree with my impression. She said I’d be notified as to why housekeeping came into my room, and I told her I’d be waiting in my room for a call. The call and explanation never came, and I was too busy to worry about it until I got home. Because of this unwanted and disturbing intrusion, we were extremely mindful to not have any maid service come into our room for the remainder of my stay, always keeping the privacy please sign, bolt lock and sliding lock on the door. It deprived us of one of the qualities I really look for in a hotel – safety. The only other concern I had about my stay, is the availability of internet at ‘reasonable prices’. As per your business center, $12 an hour is not reasonable to pay for internet. I am really disappointed in the a la carte nature of Las Vegas hotel casinos, believing that because they offer restaurants and slot machines, they can skimp on the things a traveler demands in any other city in the world. I am talking about a gym and business center, free of charge to hotel guests. Those are the bare minimum in my opinion, for a decent hotel – so if you want to elevate yourself among your competition, you’d add them free of charge. I would appreciate a written response to the problems I’ve taken the time to detail here, especially the late night housekeeping debacle. This is not the first time I’ve stayed in Fitzgeralds, but I’d seriously consider it being the last based upon the discrepancies I’ve detailed. Thank you for taking the time to address my concerns.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay downtown!”
Reviews.Author: luvtatravel
Reviews.Content: A group of 16 of us went to Vegas Jan 18-23 and had 8 rooms at the Fitz. We like to stay downtown and had stayed there once before. My husband and I had 2 nights free because of our previous stay. It is an older hotel, but there were no complaints from our group. We like the $5.00 tables which are next to impossible to find on the strip. The comps are good, also.

Reviews.Title: “Works for me!”
Reviews.Author: babs53
Reviews.Content: A friend and I decided to stay downtown for a change of pace. After reading reviews on the internet we decided on the Fitzgerald. We were looking for something that was clean, safe, and friendly. Fitzgerald's worked for us, we had a very pleasant stay, with easy check in and out. We plan on staying there next year on our annual visit to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the Rough”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the Fitz. We love it there. The staff/hosts/casino workers are very friendly. We felt that they went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed. Not to mention this casino has great comps! Everything is so close downtown. It is a totally different atmosphere. Much more relaxed than the strip. I cannot believe the negativity in some of these reviews. If we had any problems (minor problem with our player's card & we had received a smoking room instead of a non smoking room), the host and manager were there to take care of it immediately. My husband and I have stayed on the strip and we are never going back to it. The hotel we stayed at was supposedly one of the best....what a mistake that was, the pool was disgusting, cigarette butts and trash floating in the water. The rooms were dirty and the hotel/casino staff were rude. All of this for $225 a night. We are plannning our third trip to the Fitz in May of 2006. I can not wait to get my Yard of Margarita sit on the balcony and enjoy the light show and bands after a hard day of playing slots.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: teachernthehood
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last spring, and had a very nice experience. The room was spacious, and the view unbeatable. We were pretty high up. It was in need of a facelift, as much of it is old and worn, but that didn't bother me in the least. The slots are loose, and they were generous with complimentary drinks. The staff is friendly and helpful. The location is great. I was concerned about staying downtown, but am very glad that I did. I avoided the hustle and bustle of the strip, which is not easy to traverse on foot, especially because there was construction everywhere when we went. The casinos are very close to each other downtown. A big plus, since we didn't have a car. The price of this hotel simply cannot be beat. We got here via Expedia, and paid just under $600 for the two of us to fly out of NY and stay here for five nights. If I ever venture this way again, I will definitely stay at the Fitz.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, very friendly, very well priced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at Fitzgerald's Dec 6-10, 2005. I have been reading the reviews and was therefore more 'on the lookout' for issues than I would have been otherwise. In short, it was an excellent stay at a terrific price (we had a coupon from the Fitz that netted out to $ 17.50/night). ROOM: We checked in at noon and had no problems....room was ready and correct. Carpets were clean and relatively new. No peeling wallpaper, no stains, no missing towels. In short it was roomy, but not huge...very clean and neat. The room was made up each day with no issues. EMPLOYEES: All employees from the font desk to the dealers seemed quite friendly...no issues at all. FOOD: We found the 2nd floor buffet (Molly's) to be priced higher than most. It was really a brunch buffet (we went for breakfast). For breakfast only it was too high...for lunch it was OK. WE LIKED: Parking garage is free and clean, no problems. The McDonalds and Krispy Kreme within the hotel are handy. Live music show is fair. We didn't attend the other shows. Unlike some other write-ups we had no problems waiting for elevators...they were prompt. WE'D SUGGEST: In-room coffee pots would be a nice addition, although it was easy to get at McDonalds. Our room didn't have any available wall outlets outside the bathroom for plugging in a computer. OVERALL: Had a great time, an incredible bargain, and the people and hotel provided more than we had expected for the price. We were on the 29th floor and had a terrific view of the mountains and other downtown hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Fun at the Fitz”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Fitz a number of times and have throughly enjoyed each visit. After staying a few times on the strip, fighting the crowds, and not able to find each other, we tried the Fitz and found it a very welcome change from the hustle and bustle of the strip. The comps are very good and the staff very friendly. The food at Molly's is very good and the service top notch. It is nice to have the workers remember us each time we visit. Much different from the cold reception in the larger casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean and cheap”
Reviews.Author: milladoiro
Reviews.Content: First of all, if you've never been to Las Vegas, don't expect glamor and gangster hip...it isn't there. If you don't like gambling and watching people gorge themselves at buffets, this may well not be the place for you. On the other hand, this is a great - and inexpensive - place from which to base yourself if you are exploring National Parks. Death Valley, Zion, Bryce and the Grand Canyon are all within a few hours drive. In addition, Red Rocks Canyon Conservation Area - a BLM managed area - is a BEAUTIFUL place to hike, with intimate views of red sandstone formations, and long vistas that are usually found in National Parks. So on to Fitzgerald's. We paid 175 dollars per person to fly from Seattle to Vegas...that price included 3 nights at Fitzgerald's - a tourist class hotel in downtown Las Vegas. From check-in to check-out, the staff was remarkably friendly and went out of their way to make us feel welcomed. Our room was on the 32nd floor, providing amazing views to the West. Housekeeping staff were thorough and timely, the restaurant staff was extremely friendly, and the food was pretty good value, particularly the breakfast buffet (other meals served at the buffet looked less appetizing. The only thing about staying downtown is that some rooms - even ours on the 32nd floor - are subject to noise from the lightshow/music stages on Fremont Street. This was a very minor inconvenience, solved by turning on the fan in the room. If you get a really good deal, stay here. It's nice enough. Otherwise, try the Golden Nugget - 4 star hotel at 2 star prices.

Reviews.Title: “Won at Fitzgeralds”
Reviews.Author: Connie41
Reviews.Content: Didn't stay at Fitzgeralds - walked in one night just to say had visited another casino and nearly walked straight back out the place stunk so bad. It was a Saturday night and very busy and hubby wanted to play blackjack and managed to get on a table pretty much straight away, so I persevered with the smell and took to the slot machines. Won $200 on a five cent machine downstairs - the lady who went to get my collect was rude and I was almost going to fetch hubby when I noticed an upstairs area of the casino so went to check it out in the hopes it was quieter and not so smelly. Good move - straight away won $1,000 on a 25 cent machine. The slot attendant and cashiers seemed genuinley pleased for me so I didn't mind parting with a bit of my winnings in tips! Can't say much more about the accommodations or the restaurants as they were not utilised, but they definately could try and do something with the smell in the casino - perhaps it's the carpet - I don't know what it was but it was bad! Thanks for the winnings though!

Reviews.Title: “At the Fitz... Keep your eye on the room cleaners though!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just came back from 1 week at Fitzgeralds. Comfortable room with nice view on 27th floor. Room was clean except windows and ceiling stained with cigarette smoke. Casino workers not too friendly compared to surrounding downtown casinos. I was missing one pair of blue jeans from the hangers in the closet on the second day and had to file a theft report.

Reviews.Title: “FITZ was fine.”
Reviews.Author: JoLee
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Fitzgeralds on Freemont street.We had requested a high floor, but received the 7th. The next morning we were changed to the 34th.floor,which was much better,as you don't hear the sounds from street show. The room was clean and comfortable. No trouble with the elevator. We ate in the Buffet 2 times,and both time were good.We enjoyed the casino too. We like staying downtown and would return to the Fitzgeralds.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: lequébecois
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fitz for four nights (Nov 2nd-6th) and had a good time. The location is excellent, rooms are clean and the casino is good for beginners like we were (not at the end) . You can see the Fremont show from balcony. Overall I recommend it for people that looks for average type of hotel in addition of having a great location !!

Reviews.Title: “Fitzgeralds was GREAT!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Fitzgerald in downtown Las Vegas. October 3 to the 6th ,2005. We were some what aprehensive about staying down town, but to our surprise it was great. We could go out any door except the front one and be right on Freemont Street.We were not once bothered by the sounds of Freemont Street. It was great to walk up and down and see all the attractions that were offered. The gentleman that was juggling liquor bottles while making drinks was amazing. The rooms were fantastic as was housekeeping. We had a large queen size bed and it was every bit as comfortable as my own bed at home. The bathroom was a good size and there was plenty of hot water and pressure. Everyone of the staff was pleasant. The cocktail waitress were effeciant but not to the point of being a bother. We ate at the buffet several times and everything was hot and very tasty. There was a very good selection of foods. Both at the breakfast and supper buffets. We had breakfast in the resteraunt the morning we were leaving and the staff were great about us leaving our luggage beside our table. We went to a couple of the shows Larry G Jones and the Elvis show and they were both great. The entertainers themselves came through the buffet and offered 2 for 1 coupons to their shows.We were with a bus tour and had on our tour tags. The only thing we found that was somewhat of a bother were that the elevators were very slow. You had to leave at least 20 minutes before you planned on leaving just to get down to the lobby on time. Once we know that we just factored that time in. The next time we go to Las Vegas we will have no fears of staying downtown again. Its just a short cab ride to the strip and it really doesn't cost all that much. The cab drivers we had were very friendly and helpful. A great big thank you to the driver of the Hard Rock Cafe shuttle bus that stopped and offered my husband and I a ride back to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the Fitzgeralds Casino Las Vegas Hotel, I forgot something in the room, I called them at night, they asked me to call back next morning to speak to the supervisor. I went back to the hotel on next morning. Front desk called the maid and said they didn't find anything. If you forgot something in the room, don't expect it again, service from them is bad.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: QCman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fits for the 3rd time 10/14-10/16. $45/night on weekend is tough to beat. The room was old but super clean and comfortable. My friend was staying in west tower at Lady Lcuk so I wanted to check ouot the room. It too was old and clean but was really pretty gross with worn out pink shag carpet and furniture that just didn't look like you wanted to sit or sleep on it. I didn't play much at the Fits this time but hotel and casino staff always super friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at the Fitzgerald”
Reviews.Author: Carlanng
Reviews.Content: My brother and I spent three days at the Fitzgerald and we really liked our experience. The staff is very friendly and helpful--we got in after midnight and they looked after us promptly. We had a top floor room facing east with a wonderful view of the dessert. Very quiet room, clean and well appointed. This is not Bellagio or MGM, but it is a perfectly fine hotel for sleeping and enjoying the ambiance of the downtown Fremont Experience. Service, both for the room and the hotel was excellent--the bell captain was informative and when we left, we stored luggage for eight hours with him and he was very politie and effective. Ate breakfast in the hotel once and it was fine at about $5.00. My only recommendation to them was to have a better sports book--they have one little spot and no action really with the clientele. We had a great time and will definitely stay there again on our next trip. We were part of a package so not sure of the cost, but from what I understand it is around $60 a night. Pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Good considering the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: So, I just got back from my first trip to Las Vegas. I was a little disappointed when I found out that my group had booked a hotel that was not located on the strip (especially since this was my first trip, and I had a laundry list of things I wanted to see while I was there). When we checked in, the woman at the desk ( I believe her name was Carole) was very friendly. We got rooms on the 23rd floor, but got all the way up there ( with all of our bags) and realized that the 23rd floor was non-smoking. We had to go all the way back down to the front desk, and get new rooms on the 12th floor. The rooms were just what I expected- the basics- no frills, but very spacious with a pretty large TV. Overall, I was happy with the room (and the view). We had a few problems with the elevators, as there are only 4 in the hotel (and there were many times that we would have to wait for the elevator as they were oftentimes too full). I didn't get to see everything that I had hoped to see while in Vegas (I stayed from 9/19-9/23) because it was a pretty long trek to the strip from Fremont street with traffic. I liked the Fremont Street area though, and think it's a great place to stay when it's not your first time in Vegas and you're not heading back and forth to the strip every day to sight see. Overall, Fitzgerald's is a great hotel- especially considering the money you pay. The pool is a basic rectangular pool, located outside the building- but it does the job. The staff were very polite and helpful. The restaurants were decently priced with a pretty good selection.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at The Fitz!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay at the Fitz with my dad. Hotel is older but perfectly clean. The comparison to a Holiday Inn fits perfectly. The staff couldn't have been nicer. My dad was treated like a king by the hotel staff, dealers, pit bosses, and waitstaff. Limericks Steakhouse is absolutely first rate. This is where I take people to impress them in Vegas. Its not over the top like some of the newer strip property steakhouses but it is pure old Vegas class and charm. We got beat up pretty good on the tables but we had a great time. When we did gamble together and the dealeres or pitstaff found out we were on a father/son vacation they all gave my dad a little extra special treatment. I will go back to the Fitz every time I go to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “We love it here!”
Reviews.Author: debandboyd
Reviews.Content: We love Fitzgeralds! We are going back for our third time in November. The staff was all very nice - everyone from the front desk clerk to the waiters and housekeeping. The slots are loose, the (free) entertainment on the weekends on the casino floor both times we have been there has been great, even everyone that we met as guests were nice and fun. If you are looking for a very basic, low key (not pretentious) hotel and would rather spend your money on gambling or other things, this is the place to go. If you are looking for a beautiful place to stay and plan on spending a lot of time in your room, you may be better off at one of the more expensive hotels on the strip. Yes, the elevator was a little slow, but so what? The bed was comfortable, the a/c worked and was not like a jet engine, the view was great from our room. The only thing that I wasn't crazy about and will be passing on during our next visit was the buffett. Not a good selection, mediocre food, no desserts left. Oh yes, and that stupid entertainer with "the ears" that seemed to interrupt us at almost every meal trying to give us discounted tickets to his show - aarrgghh, enough alredy! Other than that, we'll be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Fitzgeralds Casino”
Reviews.Author: bluebelle51
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel around 11:00 a.m. There wasn't a line at the check in desk and we checked in but were told we couldn't go to our room untill after 3:00 p.m. We wandered Las Vegas untill 3:30 p.m. to pick up our keys and go to the room, and there was a huge line, only one girl working behind the counter and we waited for 40 minutes to get the keys to our room. Once we got into the room, it was fabulous, huge room, huge bed, wonderful view, extra towels in the bathroom, and even a room safe for valuables. I was very impressed with the room and the price ($39.00 for a week night, online price) Maybe the staff was having a bad night, maybe there was only one person working the desk because there was a flu epidemic, but I can say the only bad part of this visit was just to get to the room Once in the room the staff was helpful, freindly and competent. The hotel in right on Fremont Street and the food I ate there was really good, inexpensive and arrived without issues. The overall experience was very nice, just not between 11:00 a.m. and 4:00 p.m.

Reviews.Title: “The casino is fine...the hotel and restaurants need some help”
Reviews.Author: VegasDude66
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Fitz several times over the past 6-7 months during my frequent business trips into Las Vegas. The staff is friendly, for the most part (exception: Eric at the front desk - few words, no thank you, no smile, and sometimes an attitude - I'm "lucky" enough to get him at least 50% of the time!). The casino, although a bit dingy, is full of a variety of table games and some of the loosest slots I have played in my many trips to LV. A good choice of table games with low limits and friendly dealers. The cafe' upstairs is OK (probably a 5 on a 1-10 scale) and is somewhat pricey for the market it serves. The buffet is a miss...without question...it shouldn't qualify for a buffet in Las Vegas...maybe 2 choices of entrees, a couple of side choices, a small salad bar and perhaps 3 or 4 desserts to choose from...severely lacking by Vegas standards and not exactly cheap (lunch is about $8) given the selections you are offered (Stations casinos run lunch buffets for about $7 and give you 10X the options not to mention Main Street Station down the block). The McDonalds on the first floor is 24 hrs which is nice for that quick bite but they have been out of ice cream and milk shakes on at least 50% of my visits...seems poorly managed, a bit dirty, and less than efficient compared to most fast-food stops. A gift shop exists across from the front desk which stocks a good variety of products but closes too early for a LV hotel (10pm). Overall, the rooms are clean and a bit outdated but have an in-room safe, iron and ironing board. Water pressure is the best I have experienced in a hotel and hot water doesn't seem to be an issue any time of the day (can't say either about the 4 Queens). Non-smoking rooms are available but seem very limited as I have been given a smoking room on 4 of my last 6 visits even though I requested non-smoking when my reservation was made (the front desk doesn't even mention it isn't available when I check in, I just discover it when entering the floor from the elevator.0 Overall, a decent value for you money as far as hotels go...there's certainly room for improvement in both amenities and front-desk staffing. I've stayed at the 4 Queens, Golden Nugget, and the Fremont (with it's closet-sized bathrooms!) on a few of my visits and the all are on-par with the Fitz (Golden Nugget may be a notch higher).

Reviews.Title: “Great place away from the strip”
Reviews.Author: flyin'
Reviews.Content: The Fitzgerld turned out to be a fine place to stay. After reading some of the reviews I was skeptial about it. My first time in "Sin City" so I was not sure where this hotel was located. It is about two miles from the Strip but we found lots to do and enjoyed the Freemont Street Experience. The bus runs 24 hours a day to Strip $2.00 each way or $5.00 for a 24 hour pass. The Fitz is an older hotel but was very clean and has been keet well. Over overal lthe service was great. Some of the front desk clerks could use a few customer service lessons. The only issue we had was that the air conditioning unit was loud and unbearable. I phoned and they had the unit changed out in less than an hour. The only draw back is Molly's Resurant located on the 2nd floor. They were short of help and the service there was non existant. The food was okay but there are plenty of places to eat. Beware of the "Free Gift" Promotation. The hotel has these people that will give you $60.00 cash or dinner and a show if you tour their time share properties. If you don't buy (and please don't buy,) you are treated as red head convict step child. They abondoned you and leave you waiting for a shuttle to take you back to the hotel. A 90 min presentation took five hours. They did pay the $60.00 but it was not worth the time it took. All-in-all the Fitz was worth money. No it's not the Ritz but it is far from a flea bag.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Borus
Reviews.Content: I booked a 3 night stay at the Fitzgerald Hotel for a much needed vacation. The dates were the 18-21st of August 2005. The front desk allowed us to check in and proceeded to give us room keys when we checked in at around 0930am. We were excited to get a room so earlier in the day. We then we found out the room they gave us was a two double bed room instead of the King I requested. I called the desk and was informed that if I wanted to wait till 3pm I could have a King room. I opted to keep my room. The room was very nice and well kept. I had no complaints about the room. We then checked out the casino. The casino is small in size but has alot of slot machines to choose from with all types of denominations. We rate the casino as excellent. The only restaurant we ate at in the hotel was Molly's Buffet. We had breakfast there and it was excellent. The price was also good. We also ate dinner but that came at a price. I will explain. We were riding the elevator from our room located at the 32nd floor. We were in the elevator with an other couple who we did not know at the time. The elavator was travelling down when it made a loud noise and suddely stopped and jerked us around in the elevator. A few seconds later the door opened and we all decided to get out. A unknown woman entered the elevator when we exited and she became stuck in the elevator. We noticed that she got in before we could stop her and the door shut. The floor counter did not move and we heard the clicking on the elevator. We could hear the alarm being pushed from inside by the woman. A long story in a short form is that we called for help and the woman was rescued but we had to walk down 26 floors and then were only componsated with a free dinner buffet. The worst part was we had to use the elevator for the rest of our stay. Well back to the buffet, avoid eating dinner at Molly's it was terrible. I would not even recommend it for the cost of walking down 26 flights of stairs. The hotel does have a single outdoor pool and whirpool. Both of these items are very basic and would compare to what you would expect to find in a residental backyard. The casino does have a nice balcony that is accessable from the second floor and looks over fremont street experience. The hotel also has a great location being on the fremont street. I will sum up this lengthy review as the hotel is a great stay and the price is right. We payed about 50 a night including friday and saturday night. Check out the hotel and see for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “A Smaller Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stay at Fitzgerald's every year. We have stayed at 5 of the fancy hotels on the strip over the years. Fitzgerald's gives us lots of personal attention.My family prefers the casual atmosphere of downtown. We enjoy closeness of the downtown casinos. Fitzgerald's is also the only casino in Nevada to have my favorite table game - Pai Gow Mania. On our last visit, the hotel was undeergoing replacement of the air conditioning units. Luckily, our room had no problem with the old unit. The rooms are clean. The housekeeping dept. is friendly and efficient. The resturants aren't fancy, but the food moderately priced and tasty. When we go to Vegas, we usually hit the Strip every day, visiting some of our favorite casinos and trying any new ones. In the late afternoon or evening, we go back downtown and play in several of the downtown casinos. We frequent Four Queens, Binions and The Golden nugget downtown. But our overall favorite is Fitzgerald's. if you need to stay in a "fancy hotel", Fitzgerald's is not for you. But if you like a smaller, clean and friendly hotel, try Fitzgerald's

Reviews.Title: “Fitzgerald's is a Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: onemother
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Fitzgerald's from 8/3-8/6/05. The room was clean and practical. The Buffet had a poor selection, the floor was sticky, and the booths needed the cushions to be replaced, you practically fell to the ground when sitting down. The Cafe charged exorbitant prices, i.e., two cups of coffee and one order hash browns was $6. Take the local bus for $2 a person, and you can locate a Denny's on Las Vegas Blvd., and a Carl's, Jr., which is a hamburger joint, however, more economical. There is also a McDonald's in the lobby, however, they never get your order correct, and had poor management. At all costs, avoid the bus tour with Triple J Tours to the Grand Canyon. They advertise a tour of 13 hours, which turns into 16 hours, with no regard to schedule adherence. One hour is devoted to picking up passengers at other hotels. You only get two stops in the Canyon, and they want you to pay $10 to see a film. The complimentary lunch is pizza/lemonade. If you are limited in cash, this is the place to stay, otherwise, try one of the other downtown hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Fitzgerald's not bad not good just o.k.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at fitzgeralds for 8 nights July 18th-26th my sons ages 25 & 22 wanted to stay on the strip so they stayed at the Tropicana. Fitzgerald's was average at best. This my 3rd trip to vegas I wanted to experience the downtown area. The room was clean and not noisy.the elevators were slow and sometimes acted as if they were going to break down.But the biggest problem was the air conditioning i had to keep the curtains closed and the A/C unit on high night and day just to keep the room cool enough to sleep in it.Also the valet service was very slow for being such a small place.As far as the gambling goes I am a blackjack & video poker player I felt the Fremont across the street the four Queens next door and the California at the end of fremont st. had much better games and a better variety of games. I guess what im saying is only stay at Fitzgerald's if your budget and bankroll won't allow you to stay someplace better the Golden Nugget would be much better im sure.And The Orleans where i stayed last year is excellent a much better place to stay in every way.The bottom line is i will not be staying at fitzgerald's again.Oh and by the way stay away from the Tropicana what a dump people say it should be the next place to be imploded i agree.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: BDOG14
Reviews.Content: Visited the Fitzgerald last week....no complaints! Reservations handled very smooth, check - in quick and efficent, room clean, cool (during record heat) and comfortable. Casino staff friendly and helpful, dining options adequate ( including a Krispy Kreme on site). Only concern - cocktail service was slow while on casino floor. Love being downtown anyway....just has a better "vibe" as far as I am concerned. Will definitely stay at the Fitzgerald again!

Reviews.Title: “Make new friends”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the "Fitz" for several years. I've taken several members of my family and friends. Several times it was their first time to Vegas. Myself and everyone I have taken has loved the more relaxed feeling of the downtown. If you are fortunite to get a corner room, the view, evening sunset, and lights of the strip are wonderful. The staff is great. I have emailed Guest Services and they are always ready to help make my stay a great one. (from room upgrades, airport pick-up, better rates for extra rooms, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class Entertainment!”
Reviews.Author: MissWorldTraveller
Reviews.Content: Although we didn't stay downtown, one night we ventured downtown for the Freemont Street experience, this was excellent with live music and a fantastic lights FX show. We also visited Fitzgerald's hotel which has two fantastic acts on, Bobby Ruffin's The Drifter's and Steve Connelley's Elvis, these were both excellent and very good value (the price of entry was one drink), Bobby Ruffin has a fantastic voice and it is a shame he is not showing at a more high profile venue. Elvis was also extremely good, combining both comedy with an uncanny Elvis impersonation, I thoroughly recommend these shows.

Reviews.Title: “Love Fitgeralds”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ive been to Las Vegas about 20 times. I've stayed in a Penthouse Suite at the Mirage, in a Suite at Treasure Island, The Rio, at the Fiesta in Henderson, at the Plaza on Freemont and the Hilton. Half of my visits were at Fitzgeralds. Yes, you get that cleaning fluid smell when you go in. The staff has always been nice. The rooms have always been clean. The bathrooms are clean and neat. I've never had a problem with Fitzgeralds. With the "local" hotels Ive stayed at, I never seem to win anything. They are the worst to stay at. When I changed hotels from the local hotel to the Fitz, I wasn't there 5 minutes and won a $1600 jackpot. I've always left the Fitz with more money than when I went in. The other 3 places I won great were the Mirage, Treasure Island and the Bellagio. I don't recommend playing at a local hotel or at Harrahs, Balleys or the Luxor. I never seem to win at these places. The breakfast buffet at the Fitz was fantastic. I love the closeness to the Freemont Experience. I am sure some people had some bad luck there, but I have always enjoyed my stay and I am going back to the Fitz this September.

Reviews.Title: “We will Not be returning....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We (husband, 2 kids) recently (7/3/05) stayed at the Fitz for a night because we wanted the experience Downtown LV. After staying on the strip for the past 3 nights, we arrived at the Fitz around 5:30 pm to check-in. The building smelled musty and old, but that was expected for it being an older hotel. The guy at the counter who helped me was not very friendly or helpful. I had called the hotel several days before checking in to confirm my reservation and request 2 beds in a N/S room-no probs, it was noted in the computer. When I asked the guy at the counter if a room with 2 beds was available he said 'yes', then told me we had to wait for approx. 2 hrs because the room was not ready. He said he would make a quick call up to the housekeeping supervisor to confirm the availability and after hanging up he said that it would be around 30 mins before it was ready. I was a little disappointed because we were checking into the hotel after 3pm, yet they did not have any clean rooms with 2 beds available. Furthermore, at the same time that I was checking in, a woman next to me at the counter had requested the same type of room and she got it-no problems. I stepped away from the counter and figured we would just wait around the lobby since it was only supposed to be a half hour wait. After about 10 mins of standing around and me probably looking really frustrated, the guy called me back over and told me another room was 'suddenly' available. He handed me the room key in the little folder and didn't even have the decency to give me directions to the room, muchless direct me to an elevator. The room ended up being on the very top-34th floor, in the corner, with a view of the top of the Freemont St canopy. When we finally got to the room it was very HOT and stuffy. We immediately located the A/C and turned it on....that thing was sooo loud that we were practically yelling at each others the whole time we were in the room. To make things worse, the darn thing wouldn't even cool the whole room off. In order to feel any kind of cool breeze, you had to be standing right in front of the unit. Part of the reason it probably never cooled was because the unit was not completely attached to the wall (there was a big gap between the inside wall and outside). We decided that we were going to just deal with it, as we were going to be outside on Freemont St for a good part of the night and we figured that if we left it on while we were gone it would cool off some by the time we got back. That was a big mistake because when we finally got in, it was sooo hot that it was practically unbearable to sleep. Not only was the room temp uncomfortable, but the beds were as well....double beds w/springs poking at your back!!! We somehow made it though the early morning hours and were ready to check out. Overall, everything was gross and dirty-unvacuumed carpet, holes in blankets, bathroom, etc. We did enjoy the dowtown atmosphere; however, we will definitely NOT be staying here again. The customer service, along with old, scruffy rooms does not make it worth the hassle. I paid the same amount of $$$ to stay at the Stratosphere on this trip and it was 10x better.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Fitz!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kubbie3400
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last November together with another couple. The room was fine, carpet a bit dirty and full of lint but besides that everything was OK and clean. Loved the location, close to many of the hotels with loose slots and many great restaurants. Tried many of the buffets and found the Main Street Hotel Buffet to be our favorite. Found another restaurant at the Plaza with awesome prime rib dinner for 7.95. Was great. Enjoyed the Freemont Street Experience and the evening bands. Great shops within walking distance, everything half the price compared to on the strip. Walking distance to the bus stop. For five dollars per day you can ride the bus for 24 hours. Did fairly well with the VLT's. Wish the employees would have tried harder with bringing the drinks while we gambled, we usually tipped one dollar minimum per drink. More if they returned more often. Booked a day trip to the Grand Canyon, was enjoyable but a bit long. Still worth the time and money. A must see for anyone who has not seen it. We would stay at the Fitz again in a minute. Only had the breakfast buffet at Molly's, was great. There's also a Krispy Kreme and a McD's in the hotel. Had no problem with the elevators. Have a great time in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: when i called to check the prices of rooms the lady that took my call was really short with me. she did not know what rooms where left and nor their prices.. i was thinking of going there but! sheee changed my mind

Reviews.Title: “So much more than I expected!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: WOW!!! I sat for days on this computer reading reviews about the Fitzgerald's Hotel & Casino in Las Vegas & almost dreaded going on my trip from the horrible reviews I read so let me say this....ALL FALSE!!!! The Fitzgerald's is a very nice, well kept, fantastically located hotel/casino with extremely loose slots!!! We won enough in the first TWO HOURS in the casino to vacation extravagantly the entire weekend - renting limos, playing poker machines right up to the minute we left Vegas, buying clothes, eating out, etc. Honestly, I won more at Fitzgeralds than I did at the Hard Rock, Ceasars, The Venetian, etc. Our room was big with a view of Freemont Street. Everything was clean, including the sheets & the bathroom. The shower had GREAT water pressure. Air conditioning worked well. We were within walking distance to the bus stop, a drug store, the Golden Nugget, plently of places to eat, etc. etc. etc. (Krispy Kream donut shop is located in the lobby - yum - loved it) The staff were friendly in every part of the hotel & casino. This place isn't ritzy but it is PERFECT for somebody who wants a nice place to stay comfortably while saving money to do fun things rather than spend a fortune on a room to store your clothes & sleep!!! Do NOT hesitate to stay at Fitzgerald's Hotel & Casino in Vegas - THIS PLACE IS GREAT!!! Ignore the bad reviews on the internet - those people probably lost a little money in Vegas & want to take it out on the hotel. I was completely shocked when we got there because the reviews I read here had me convinced I would be sleeping with cockroaches and noisy air conditioners and listening to my "neighbors" do who knows what all night while I tried to sleep - it was totally opposite. Worth every penny!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My name is Tamatha and in May of 05 me, my mother and two of my sisters took our first time ever-trip to Las Vegas. Fitzgeralds came highly recommended by our Minister and close friend. we had an absolute fabulous time. The room we stayed in was very clean and the hotel staff was both courteous and helpful. We visited during the 100th celebration and it was nice our entire stay of 4 days and 4 nights. we are going back soon and will make this an annual trip. We stayed on the 16th floor and had an awesome view of the mountains; another guest suggested we go to the 34th floor and catch the view and it was breath taking.The elevators were fast coming and going.We visited the new strip and new fancy hotels but we loved the convenience of being downtown and right at everything. I also felt very safe and secure seeing security on the beat.

Reviews.Title: “Fitzgeralds casino”
Reviews.Author: menumber1
Reviews.Content: We stayed downtown at the fitzgeralds for the first time on May13-May16th. Upon arrival our friends who were getting married were upgraded to a room with a corner window overlooking freemont street. Our room was facing the other way but was nice. Remember, this is not one of the new hotels on the strip, but we found the rooms to be clean and the housekeeping service to be very prompt. If you are looking for the old vegas feel and like the closeness of the other downtown casinos then I would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was more then we expected...........”
Reviews.Author: missmn
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas March 15, 2005 thru March 20th. I was leary at first but after doing research on most of the Vegas hotels, decided there are good and bad reviews for every hotel, including the very best. We choose the Fitzgeralds as we went to get married and it was absolutely ideal! It was the block next to the courthouse, so we walked there and saved the cost of a taxi. Next we were married at the Chapel by the Courthouse which was a 2 block walk, again saving the cost of a taxi or limo. Checkin at the Fitz was very fast. We asked if a jacuzzi suite was available and one had just opened up, so for no additional cost, we enjoyed a huge room with a king size bed, loveseat, table and 2 chairs, great view of the mountains and part of the strip. With the jacuzzi being in the bathroom, the bathroom was HUGE. The slots were wonderfully loose, (wont tell the ones that were great for us!), and all of the staff was friendly. And St. Patricks Day was hopping and all had a good time. I highly recommend the Fitz's and also the Chapel By the Courthouse if you are having a small wedding. It was just the two of us and the man at the desk was very friendly as was the minister and photographer.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel and fond memories”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband have stayed at Fitzgeralds twice already and are ready for a 3rd. My husband was sceptical of las vegas and did not like to gamble but I took him to vegas and we stayed at Fitzgeralds on our first trip and he and I both had a fabulous time we will never forget. We love vegas and have tried other hotels and found our most enjoyable experience was with Fitzgeralds and our next visit will include fitzgeralds again. The staff was more then friendly. If you have never stayed at fitzgeralds, please do you wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Fitzgeralds”
Reviews.Author: TXSheri
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Fitz over NASCAR weekend, March 12-13th. We were promised a non-smoking room w/ king bed, but not what we got. We were told upon arrival it was "unavailable", and we were forced to take a smoking room to get a king bed. The desk clerk was nice, she tried to make it up by giving us a corner room with wraparound windows, way up on the 20-something floor. The view was absolutely spectacular, taking in downtown, Freemont and the Strip. This corner room offered a panoramic view with a 180 degree view thanks to all the windows. That was the best part of our stay. Otherwise, the room had burns in the carpet and looked nasty. When the A/C kicked on, the noise was similar to a plane landing. Those guests sensitive to noise should stay elsewhere. Also, the TV did not operate right, and the picture was frustrating. The bathroom was adequate, with vanity space. Good maid service. It's an OK place, nothing fancy. The location is great, in the center of everything on Freemont. If you can get a good deal on a room here, you might consider it. The casino is fun, but too noisy, with live music every night. If you play slots, it can be very distracting. Oh, one more thing---the elevator situation. During peak times, expect delays to get on an elevator, and sometimes the ride is crowded. Also, the elevators can act up, shake, make weird noises and scare the blarney out of you! It seems the word "NOISE" sums this place up very well.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel to be excellent and the casino was great. Loose slots, clean large rooms, 4 elevators that moved quickly. The food was above average. Having easy access to Fremont Street experience was great also. Checkin was smooth, and the room attendants were very thorough in keeping the rooms clean. Felt very safe even as late as 2AM.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and broken down”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I like to think I can look on the bright side, but this place was truley not pleasent. There were large peices of plaster missing from the ceiling. The tub had a layer of soap scum. The drawers all stuck, the a/c sounded like it was going to come off the wall and fly around. There was fecies on the side of the toilet(we didn't notice until the last day). It was a non-smoking room that was as smokey as the casino. The beds felt like they bought them used from a motel 6. I get the chills just thinking about what was on my sheats and comforter. The resteraunts were fair at best. The decore was shoddy, My wife wanted to play Keno no one came around. The people who worked there seamed nice and helpful, but you can only do so much with what you are given. So I did what I could, I left the hotel and gambled elsewhere. I tried to make the best of things. We bought show tickets at tickets 4 tonight 1/2 off tickets a good deal. We went to se rockotica at the Rio a great show, plenty of good rock music and sex appeal.

Reviews.Title: “what a dump!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel should not be in business.The bathrooms in the common area are not clean.The health department should be called in.The hotel is not fit to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “The Fitz is O.K.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Fitzgeralds Jan. 9-14. This was our fourth trip to Vegas in four years, and always enjoy visiting downtown, but this was our first time staying there. We found the room at the Fitz to be very clean and comfortable and a great value, booked through i4vegas. We ate once at the buffet and once at the coffee shop, and we should have heeded some of the reviews we had read on Trip Advisor. They weren't very good. Everything else at the Fitz was okay, but nothing special. As far as staying downtown, five nights were way too long.When you get tired of gambling,there just isn't much to do. We were constantly confronted by people trying to pull scams or asking for money. We had no problems with the Fitz other than the food, but as far as downtown, we will stay on the strip on our next trip and just visit there.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at alot of other places in Vegas both on the Strip (Caesars) and downtown (Golden Nugget & Four Queens), but we always keep coming back to the Fitz. The rooms are very clean and well kept, spacious too. While the buffet could be better, the restaurant Limerick's is awesome and they're very liberal with their comps, even for craps players. And we LOVE this casino. The atmosphere is very casual and fun. We always have a great time at this place. Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay downtown”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First time staying downtown, so did my homework and found the Fitz. Check in was fast and the clerk was friendly. Room was very "Holiday Inn" type. Carpet somewhat worn but clean. Bathroom very clean, as was the entire floor (22nd)and elevator area. We found the downtown area very entertaining, and loved the casino's being so close together. (trip was from Jan 13th-16th) Don't eat at the restaraunts here. If you are in town on Friday, go to the seafood buffet at the Fremont. Execellet! Also, the Golden Gate at the end of the Fremont St. has good burgers and breakfasts. Enjoyed the gambeling, depending on what dealer was on that shift. Some were better than others, but you will find that anywhere you go. We caught the Elvis show (one drink minimum) and it was fun. If you like cheap room and gambleing, stay here. If you need the glizty strip and extra perks, this is not your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay at the Fitz”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fitz and downtown for the first time from 8-11 Jan. We were pleased with the hotel staff's courteous service and our room. Location is great, especially during cold or wet weather, because you can walk out the door of one casino and into another without having to walk a great distance, as on the strip. Another reason we chose downtown for this visit was based on hearing that the slots were looser there. We didn't think so, however; in either the Fitz or other casinos we visited. To be fair, it could have just been our luck. We had dinner one night in Molly's Buffet. Service was great and prices were reasonable but, we had a very long wait for entrees. We took a cab on our last day to the strip and had much more fun and playing time on the slots. Even though the casinos there are futher apart, they're more spacious and slots seemed more generous than those downtown. Also, the cocktail waitresses were more abundant and attentive on the strip than at the Fitz and other downtown casinos. If you want to stay downtown, the Fitz is a great place for the price, but we'll stay on the strip again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TA_Travler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. Staff was very friendly. The rooms were clean. Elevators were quick. I was a little leary after reading some of the reviews but now I'm wondering if those people stayed at the same hotel. Nice thing about the location of the hotel was that the bus from the strip drops off right on the corner by the hotel. There is a walgreens right across the street for those forgotten essentials. We only ate at Mollys Cafe and found the food to be good. I would definetly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lax service in Casino”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took my best friend to Vegas Jan. 11 - Jan 14. Jan. 12th, her 50th birthday, we went to Fitzgeralds Casino to gamble. The floor manager was aware that it was my friend's 50th birthday and offered her a couple of buffet comps. She said to just let her know before we left the Casino. We were there for several hours and several hundred $. About an hour before we were ready to leave the Casino, we mentioned to the manager at the blackjack table that we were occupying the comped buffet tickets. She was unaware of the offer and said the day manager had left for the day. We were not expecting anything, like a meal when we arrived at the casino, but the floor manager offered and we thought that was a nice gesture. A few minutes later, the dealer shorted me on my winnings. When called to her attention, she was defensive. We got the manager on duty to come to the table and she called upstairs for a review of the tape. A few minutes later she told the dealer to pay me. NOT ONE TIME DID THE DEALER APPOLOGIZE TO ME. I thought that was extremely rude on top of the total disregard for the previous managers promise of buffet tickets. Needless to say, we will not be returning to the Fitzgerald on our next visit to Vegas in May. I must say we were quite disappointed in the Fitzgerald Casino's idea of customer service. I know that we are not "high rollers", but I can certainly lose my next $800 at another Casino.

Reviews.Title: “not what it used to be”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
